TEXT.English: Aerial CT
TEXT.Polish: Lotniczy CT

TEXT.English: Aerial I
TEXT.Polish: Lotnik I

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "The sky offers freedom and power. Those who control the sky control the Earth below. None can stand against strikes from the heavens." Although it comes at some expense and many prefer living with their heads in the clouds rather than their feet on the ground, focused on the toils at hand, this lofty Leader inspires his people to look up and to the horizon and will drive them to master all things within sight. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Free Aerial Strategies Promotion for Archer, Throwing, Gunpowder, Balloon, and Helicopter units. Gives an extra first strike, bonuses to hit and damage on distance assaults, and withdrawal Improvements. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Aerial type Buildings are faster to construct. [ICON_BULLET]Great Aviator (Pending - Generals for now) Specialists gain an additional Food yield. [ICON_BULLET]Great Aviator (Pending - Generals for now) Specialists gain two additional Research. [ICON_BULLET]Techs that represent advancements in Air Harnessing and Distance Weaponry are faster to discover. [ICON_BULLET]Archer and Throwing units gain extra Experience points when trained. [ICON_BULLET]Archer and Throwing units are faster to train. [ICON_BULLET]Distance Maintenance is Reduced since yours is a far reaching people. [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain an extra Trade Route from your far ranging merchants. [ICON_BULLET]Your city is slightly harder to bombard since your people are more well prepared to face threats from above. [ICON_BULLET]Access to Parrots and Poultry makes your people Happier. They like birds. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Overall Upkeep penalty since basics are often overlooked, leading to costly setbacks, and people resent the simpler tasks making them demand more for performing them. [ICON_BULLET]The overall improvement upgrade rate is far slower. [ICON_BULLET]Workers are much slower. [ICON_BULLET]Higher Maintenance costs from Number of Cities. Your people work better with farther distances between cities than if they are packed in close. [ICON_BULLET]The largest cities in your nation are less Happy. Your people like having room to breathe. [ICON_BULLET]Your people are more easily captured since they tend to go where the wind takes them. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer more Air Pollution since experimentation with vapors and a preference for burning trash into smoke is prevalent.
TEXT.Polish: Pozytywna cecha "Niebo oferuje wolnoœæ i moc. Ci, którzy kontroluj¹ niebo, kontroluj¹ Ziemiê w dole. Nikt nie jest w stanie przeciwstawiæ siê atakom z niebios". TEXT.English: Aerial II
TEXT.Polish: Lotnik II

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "The sky offers freedom and power. Those who control the sky control the Earth below. None can stand against strikes from the heavens." Although it comes at some expense and many prefer living with their heads in the clouds rather than their feet on the ground, focused on the toils at hand, this lofty Leader inspires his people to look up and to the horizon and will drive them to master all things within sight. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Free Aerial Weaponry Promotion for Gunpowder, High Tech, Siege, and Rocket Launcher units. Gives an extra chance for a first strike, a bonus to hit on distance assaults, and interception Improvements. [ICON_BULLET]All cities benefit from a higher Maximum cap on Trade Routes. Unique Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]All cities and forts can maintain an additional Air unit stationed there. [ICON_BULLET]Air units gain an additional plot range they can reach with missions. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Aerial type Buildings are faster to construct. [ICON_BULLET]Air based Improvements give more Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Air based Improvements are faster to upgrade if they can. [ICON_BULLET]Air based Improvements are quicker to build for your . [ICON_BULLET]Great Aviator (Pending - Generals for now) Specialists gain an additional Commerce yield. [ICON_BULLET]Great Aviator (Pending - Generals for now) Specialists gain two additional Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]Air Domain units gain an extra Experience point when trained. [ICON_BULLET]Air Domain units are faster to train. [ICON_BULLET]Techs that represent advancements in Air and Space and Distance Weaponry are faster to discover. [ICON_BULLET]Gunpowder, Siege, Rocket Launcher, Balloon, and Helicopter units gain an extra Experience point when trained. [ICON_BULLET]Gunpowder, Siege, Rocket Launcher, Balloon, and Helicopter units are faster to train. [ICON_BULLET]Distance Maintenance is Reduced since yours is a far reaching people. [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain an extra Trade Route from your far ranging merchants. [ICON_BULLET]Great Aviators are significantly faster to birth. (Pending - for now it's Generals) [ICON_BULLET]Your city is slightly harder to bombard since your people are more well prepared to face threats from above. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Overall Upkeep penalty since basics are often overlooked, leading to costly setbacks, and people resent the simpler tasks making them demand more for performing them. [ICON_BULLET]The overall improvement upgrade rate is far slower. [ICON_BULLET]Workers are much slower. [ICON_BULLET]Higher Maintenance costs from Number of Cities. Your people work better with farther distances between cities than if they are packed in close. [ICON_BULLET]The largest cities in your nation are less Happy. Your people like having room to breathe. [ICON_BULLET]Your people are more easily captured since they tend to go where the wind takes them. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer more Air Pollution since experimentation with vapors and a preference for burning trash into smoke is prevalent.

TEXT.English: Aerial III
TEXT.Polish: Lotnik III

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "The sky offers freedom and power. Those who control the sky control the Earth below. None can stand against strikes from the heavens." Although it comes at some expense and many prefer living with their heads in the clouds rather than their feet on the ground, focused on the toils at hand, this lofty Leader inspires his people to look up and to the horizon and will drive them to master all things within sight. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Free Aerial Superiority Promotion for Air combat units. Gives a basic combat modifier bonus and increased chance to evade. [ICON_BULLET]All cities benefit from a higher Maximum cap on Trade Routes. Unique Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]All cities and forts can maintain two additional Air units stationed there. [ICON_BULLET]Missiles gain an additional two plots range they can target with an attack. [ICON_BULLET]Air units gain an additional two plots range they can reach with missions. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Aerial type Buildings are faster to construct. [ICON_BULLET]Great Aviator (Pending - Generals for now) Specialists gain an additional Production yield. [ICON_BULLET]Great Aviator (Pending - Generals for now) Specialists gain two additional Gold. [ICON_BULLET]Air Domain units gain extra Experience points when trained. [ICON_BULLET]Air Domain units are faster to train. [ICON_BULLET]Techs that represent advancements in Air and Space and Distance Weaponry are faster to discover. [ICON_BULLET]Distance Maintenance is Reduced since yours is a far reaching people. [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain an extra Trade Route from your far ranging merchants. [ICON_BULLET]Great Aviators are much faster to birth. (Pending - for now it's Generals) [ICON_BULLET]Your city is slightly harder to bombard since your people are more well prepared to face threats from above. [ICON_BULLET]Units that can carry missile units gain space for a few more than normal. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Overall Upkeep penalty since basics are often overlooked, leading to costly setbacks, and people resent the simpler tasks making them demand more for performing them. [ICON_BULLET]The overall improvement upgrade rate is far slower. [ICON_BULLET]Workers are much slower. [ICON_BULLET]Higher Maintenance costs from Number of Cities. Your people work better with farther distances between cities than if they are packed in close. [ICON_BULLET]The largest cities in your nation are less Happy. Your people like having room to breathe. [ICON_BULLET]Your people are more easily captured since they tend to go where the wind takes them. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer more Air Pollution since experimentation with vapors and a preference for burning trash into smoke is prevalent.

TEXT.English: Aloof CT
TEXT.Polish: Powœci¹gliwy CT

TEXT.English: Aloof I
TEXT.Polish: Powœci¹gliwy I

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "This annoying throng of bureaucrats that surround me are constantly trying to get my attention, embroil me in local politics, and get me to overlook the needs of the rest of the empire and beyond. So frustrating! A decentralized nation is better anyhow." This Leader is very poor at using a super city strategy and is far better at spreading out the efforts of his nation to as many decentralized cities as he can. This isn't that bad a negative trait for a player who prefers not to rely on a few high quality production centers. Your Leader tries to avoid governing and prefers to think more on how he's going to expand. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]The Capital produces less Food, Production and Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]The Capital produces less Gold, Research, Culture and Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]Units trained in the Capital gain fewer bonus Experience Points than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Units Trained in the Holy City of your State Religion gain fewer bonus Experience Points than normal. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Great Military People are generated slower from battles inside your borders. [ICON_BULLET]National Wonders are constructed slower in your cities. [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolution option, Holy City instability is increased. [ICON_BULLET]Administrative and National Pride Buildings are slower to construct. [ICON_BULLET]Administrative and National Pride Buildings generate less to no Happiness in your cities. [ICON_BULLET]Your units gain a bit less Experience from combat within your borders. [ICON_BULLET]Holy Cities of Non-State Religions produce units with a penalty to Experience Points. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolution option, distance plays a smaller role in creating instability. [ICON_BULLET]Significant decrease in Maintenance from Distance to Capital as you like to spend your time considering how to make a nation that covers more land more efficient. [ICON_BULLET]Significant decrease in the Maintenance from Number of Cities since you have found numerous ways to make a country with more decentralization work effectively. [ICON_BULLET]Get one more Trade Route in every city since there is greater cooperation between cities in this sort of nation. [ICON_BULLET]Foreign Trade Routes are more productive since you and your people like to import more examples of what a larger nation can obtain.

Nie jest to a¿ tak z³a cecha, dla gracza, który woli nie polegaæ na kilku wysokiej jakoœci centrach produkcyjnych. Twój przywódca stara siê unikaæ rz¹dzenia i woli myœleæ wiêcej o tym, w jaki sposób zamierza siê rozwijaæ. Podstawowe kary: [ICON_BULLET]Stolica produkuje mniej ¿ywnoœci, produkcji i bogactwa. [ICON_BULLET]Stolica produkuje mniej z³ota, badañ, kultury i szpiegostwa. [ICON_BULLET]Jednostki wyszkolone w stolicy zyskuj¹ mniej dodatkowe punkty doœwiadczenia ni¿ normalnie. [ICON_BULLET]Znacz¹cy spadek kosztów za odleg³oœci od stolicy, poniewa¿ lubisz spêdzaæ czas na zastanawianiu siê, jak zwiêkszyæ efektywnoœæ kraju zajmuj¹cego wiêksz¹ powierzchniê. [ICON_BULLET]Znacz¹ce zmniejszenie kosztów utrzymania na podstawie liczby miast, poniewa¿ znalaz³eœ wiele sposobów na sprawienie, aby kraj o wiêkszej decentralizacji dzia³a³ skutecznie. [ICON_BULLET]Œwiête Miasta religii niepañstwowych produkuj¹ jednostki ze znaczn¹ kar¹ do punktów doœwiadczenia. TEXT.English: Although there are dramatic decreases in upkeep for large empires, this Leader is highly penalized in his centers of power, the Capital and Holy Cities.
TEXT.French: Bien qu'il y ait une diminution spectaculaire de l'entretien des grands empires, ce chef est fortement pénalisé dans ses centres de pouvoir, la Capitale et les villes saintes.
TEXT.Russian: Íåñìîòðÿ íà ðåçêîå ñíèæåíèå óðîâíÿ ôèíàíñîâûõ ðàñõîäîâ äëÿ êðóïíûõ èìïåðèé, ýòîò Ëèäåð ïîëó÷àåò øòðàôû â ñòîëèöå è Ñâÿùåííûõ ãîðîäàõ, êîòîðûå ìåäëåííåå ðàçâèâàþòñÿ.
TEXT.Polish: Chocia¿ w przypadku du¿ych imperiów nastêpuje dramatyczny spadek kosztów utrzymania, ten Przywódca jest surowo karany w swoich oœrodkach w³adzy, stolicach i œwiêtych miastach.

TEXT.English: Bigot CT
TEXT.Polish: Bigot CT

TEXT.English: Bigot I
TEXT.Polish: Bigot I

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "Extremely against allowing certain segments of the population an equal status." Your Leader, and those people among his society that are of a similar heritage, enjoys asserting his dominance and opinions onto others. His nation marginalizes entire ethnic groups, usually those dominated, so as to enforce them into a strong labor pool and regular military force to be exploited to the fullest. There are strong undercurrents of resentment that plague his society but he feels its worth it because his 'type' of person, with his particular faith, is clearly superior and meant to lord over others. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Each Non-State Religions present in a city adds an Unhappiness. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities require slightly more Food to grow. Secondary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all less Happy. [ICON_BULLET]Great People are slower to be born here where so many are openly oppressed. [ICON_BULLET]Time spent in Anarchy when adopting a new State Religion is doubled. [ICON_BULLET]You may conscript a few more of your population on a Draft action. [ICON_BULLET]Your largest cities are less Happy since these communities often have larger groups of the marginalized elements of society. [ICON_BULLET]You suffer a Diplomatic penalty since most foreign Leaders are either disgusted with your Leader's attitudes or are even personally from the ethnic groups of people your society considers lesser citizens. [ICON_BULLET]Your foreign Trade Routes are less profitable due to your culture's disdain for foreign ethnicities. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer from an increase in Crime. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer from an increase in Disease. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer from a decrease in Education. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Slave type Specialists gain an additional Production. [ICON_BULLET]Slave type Specialists generate an additional Culture and Gold. [ICON_BULLET]As soon as you conquer a city, it automatically drafts as much of the population as you can for an immediate unit boost.

TEXT.English: Bigot II
TEXT.Polish: Bigot II

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "Extremely against allowing certain segments of the population an equal status." Your Leader, and those people among his society that are of a similar heritage, enjoys asserting his dominance and opinions onto others. His nation marginalizes entire ethnic groups, usually those dominated, so as to enforce them into a strong labor pool and regular military force to be exploited to the fullest. There are strong undercurrents of resentment that plague his society but he feels its worth it because his 'type' of person, with his particular faith, is clearly superior and meant to lord over others. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Each Non-State Religions present in a city adds an Unhappiness. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities require slightly more Food to grow. [ICON_BULLET]Non-State Religions are a step further inactive on the Religious Disabling option, which may well destroy all Non-State Religious buildings rather than just disabling them. Secondary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all less Happy. [ICON_BULLET]Great People are moderately slower to be born here where so many are openly oppressed. [ICON_BULLET]You may conscript a few more of your population on a Draft action. [ICON_BULLET]Your largest cities are less Happy since these communities often have larger groups of the marginalized elements of society. [ICON_BULLET]You suffer a Diplomatic penalty since most foreign Leaders are either disgusted with your Leader's attitudes or are even personally from the ethnic groups of people your society considers lesser citizens. [ICON_BULLET]Your foreign Trade Routes are moderately less profitable due to your culture's disdain for foreign ethnicities. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer from an increase in Crime. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer from an increase in Disease. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer from a decrease in Education. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Slave type Specialists gain an additional Production. [ICON_BULLET]Slave type Specialists generate an additional Culture and Gold. [ICON_BULLET]You can train Inquisitors and send them to attempt to eliminate all Non-State Religions from cities. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all founded with your State Religion in place from the beginning.

TEXT.English: Bigot III
TEXT.Polish: Bigot III

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "Extremely against allowing certain segments of the population an equal status." Your Leader, and those people among his society that are of a similar heritage, enjoys asserting his dominance and opinions onto others. His nation marginalizes entire ethnic groups, usually those dominated, so as to enforce them into a strong labor pool and regular military force to be exploited to the fullest. There are strong undercurrents of resentment that plague his society but he feels its worth it because his 'type' of person, with his particular faith, is clearly superior and meant to lord over others. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Each Non-State Religions present in a city adds an Unhappiness. [ICON_BULLET]You suffer a considerable Diplomatic penalty since most foreign Leaders are either disgusted with your Leader's attitudes or are even personally from the ethnic groups of people your society considers lesser citizens. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities require significantly more Food to grow. Secondary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all less Happy. [ICON_BULLET]Great People are much slower to be born here where so many are openly oppressed. [ICON_BULLET]You may conscript a significantly more of your population on a Draft action. [ICON_BULLET]Your largest cities are less Happy since these communities often have larger groups of the marginalized elements of society. [ICON_BULLET]Golden ages last much shorter periods since so many are thoroughly oppressed. [ICON_BULLET]Your foreign Trade Routes are significantly less profitable due to your culture's disdain for foreign ethnicities. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer from an increase in Crime. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer from an increase in Disease. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer from a decrease in Education. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Android type Specialists gain a few additional Production. [ICON_BULLET]Android type Specialists generate a few additional Culture and Gold. [ICON_BULLET]The presence of your State Religion makes your cities significantly Happier. [ICON_BULLET]Cities with your State Religion construct buildings much faster.

TEXT.English: Less Happy. Not as quick to birth Great People or grow cities. Stronger slaves, a more conscriptable populace and you draft a segment of any conquered population as soon as you invade a city. Reluctant to adopt new Religious views and more judgmental and suppressive of those not adopted, but cities automatically adopt your State Religion. Diplomatic and foreign Trade penalty. Suffers from higher Crime and Disease and lower Education.
TEXT.French: Moins heureux. Pas aussi rapide pour faire naître des Personnages illustres ou développer des villes. Des esclaves plus forts et une population plus enrôlable et vous rédigez un segment de toute population conquise dès que vous envahissez une ville. Réticents à adopter de nouvelles opinions religieuses et plus de jugement et de suppression de ceux qui ne sont pas adoptés, mais les villes adoptent automatiquement votre Religion d'État. Sanction diplomatique et Commerce extérieur. Souffre d'une criminalité et d'une maladie plus élevées et d'une éducation plus faible.

TEXT.English: Careless CT
TEXT.Polish: Nieostro¿ny CT

TEXT.English: Careless I
TEXT.Polish: Nieostro¿ny I

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "Who cares if our armies are well trained and top notch. Put them under too much pressure and they'll likely run off. They're just there for show mostly anyhow. Since you're so concerned about it, why don't you take charge?" This Leader just doesn't like having to focus on his military forces and lets the organization run itself as much as he can. He doesn't often take the time to reward, train, or discipline his subordinates and as a result, his military can easily end up under trained and unprepared for real conflict. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Less starting Experience points to all units, potentially allowing them to start off at a total deficit of Experience. [ICON_BULLET]More Experience required for units to gain levels. [ICON_BULLET]Significant penalty of Experience points given to units trained in the Capital. The closer they are to the highest levels command, the more focused training is on style over substance. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Significant reduction in the rate of earning Great Military People. [ICON_BULLET]Further reduction in the rate of earning Great Military People when Experience accumulated towards that goal is earned within your borders. [ICON_BULLET]Military Training Buildings are more expensive to build. [ICON_BULLET]Techs that bring military training benefits are slower to discover. [ICON_BULLET]Your units earn less Experience when they fight inside your borders. Familiar places to rest and relax are too readily available. [ICON_BULLET]More vulnerable to Espionage since care is not taken with sensitive information. [ICON_BULLET]Great Generals are less likely to be born as normal Great People. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Slightly increased rate of earning standard Great People. The free time and lack of strong enforcement of military routines allows the military segment the population to explore personal interests and therefore opens up paths to personal achievement. [ICON_BULLET]Military units cost less to train and are thus faster to produce since the training is lax. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages are increased by a quarter as long as normal. Relaxed demands and expectations allow people to sustain elation at their accomplishments longer. [ICON_BULLET]Units are less expensive to upgrade since quality demands are not as high.

TEXT.English: Undisciplined military at every level.
TEXT.French: Des militaires indisciplinés à tous les niveaux.
TEXT.Russian: Íåäèñöèïëèíèðîâàííûå âîåííûå îòðÿäû íà êàæäîì óðîâíå.
TEXT.Polish: Niezdyscyplinowane wojsko na ka¿dym szczeblu.

TEXT.English: Civilized CT
TEXT.Polish: Cywilizowany CT

TEXT.English: Civilized I
TEXT.Polish: Cywilizowany I

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "We must rise above our savage roots. Only a refined civilization can prosper. We must not live like barbarians." This Leader values refinement and calm, rational, restrained behavior. He loves the advancements and developments that his Civilization achieves. Excellence and discipline are of value, as well as intelligence and competence and this value system spreads throughout his empire. War itself is considered a barbaric practice and is avoided by he and his people, though they approach combat with more discipline, which serves them well against chaotic opponents. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain a percentage modifier to Research and Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain a percentage modifier to Food and Commerce. Unique Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]The most Anarchy this nation can Experience is limited to 10 rounds, possibly modified by game speed. Civilized people find agreement faster and hate ineffective governance so puts an end so only tolerates it for so long. [ICON_BULLET]All Combatant and Naval Combatant units gain the Civilized I Promotion, which gives a solid bonus to Defense, a small penalty to Attack, and a large bonus against Barbarians and Hidden Nationality units. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]You earn Great People slightly faster than normal since being the best at what you do is very important to this excellence valuing society. [ICON_BULLET]World Wonders are faster to build since these are a huge statement that shows your society to be advanced and effective. [ICON_BULLET]National Wonders and Team Projects are faster to build because anything that displays your degree of civilized achievement is of strong importance to this Leader. [ICON_BULLET]All cities get an additional base Research and Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]All cities get an additional base Food and Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Routes are built significantly faster by your . Infrastructure is the foundation of a society. [ICON_BULLET]Improvements upgrade faster on their own since it is very unrefined for you to be operating on outdated systems. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Upkeep in general is more expensive here due to more spending to ensure quality in all operations. [ICON_BULLET]It takes a bit more Experience for your units to gain levels since they lack the basal aggression of more savage types. [ICON_BULLET]Your people suffer from more War Weariness since violence, though sometimes necessary, is disturbingly uncivilized. [ICON_BULLET]Military units take longer to train. The people have a hard time embracing their more violent and savage natures. [ICON_BULLET]Your people take longer to get over being whipped to rush construction or training since that is just not refined behavior. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities require a bit more Food to grow since carnal activities are more private and restrained here.

TEXT.English: Civilized II
TEXT.Polish: Cywilizowany II

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "We must rise above our savage roots. Only a refined civilization can prosper. We must not live like barbarians." This Leader values refinement and calm, rational, restrained behavior. He loves the advancements and developments that his Civilization achieves. Excellence and discipline are of value, as well as intelligence and competence and this value system spreads throughout his empire. War itself is considered a barbaric practice and is avoided by he and his people, though they approach combat with more discipline, which serves them well against chaotic opponents. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain a percentage modifier to Research and Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain a percentage modifier to Food and Commerce. Unique Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]The most Anarchy this nation can Experience is limited to 6 rounds, possibly modified by game speed. Civilized people find agreement faster and hate ineffective governance so puts an end so only tolerates it for so long. [ICON_BULLET]All Combatant and Naval Combatant units gain the Civilized II Promotion, which gives a solid bonus to Defense, a small penalty to Attack, and a large bonus against Ruffian units. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]You earn Great People faster than normal since being the best at what you do is very important to this excellence valuing society. [ICON_BULLET]World Wonders are significantly faster to build since these are a huge statement that shows your society to be advanced and effective. [ICON_BULLET]National Wonders and Team Projects are faster to build because anything that displays your degree of civilized achievement is of strong importance to this Leader. [ICON_BULLET]All cities get an additional base Research and Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]All cities get an additional base Food and Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Routes are built significantly faster by your . Infrastructure is the foundation of a society. [ICON_BULLET]Improvements upgrade faster on their own since it is very unrefined for you to be operating on outdated systems. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Upkeep in general is more expensive here due to more spending to ensure quality in all operations. [ICON_BULLET]It takes a bit more Experience for your units to gain levels since they lack the basal aggression of more savage types. [ICON_BULLET]Your people suffer from more War Weariness since violence, though sometimes necessary, is disturbingly uncivilized. [ICON_BULLET]Military units take longer to train. The people have a hard time embracing their more violent and savage natures. [ICON_BULLET]Your people take longer to get over being whipped to rush construction or training since that is just not refined behavior. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities require a bit more Food to grow since carnal activities are more private and restrained here.

TEXT.English: Weak at war but strong at Research and culture. Builds Wonders faster.
TEXT.French: Faible en guerre mais fort en recherche et en culture. Construit des merveilles plus rapidement.
TEXT.Russian: Ñëàá â âîéíå, íî ñèëåí â èññëåäîâàíèÿõ è êóëüòóðå. Ñòðîèò ×óäåñà áûñòðåå ïðî÷èõ ëèäåðîâ.
TEXT.Polish: S³abi na wojnie, ale silni w badaniach i kulturze. Szybciej buduje cuda.

TEXT.English: Aggressive CT
TEXT.Polish: Agresywny CT

TEXT.English: Aggressive I
TEXT.Polish: Agresywny I

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "I will not allow them to insult our Great nation. They will feel our steel if they dare to disrespect us. If we are strong, we can take what we want when we want it. Want to win on the international stage? Keep your rivals on the defensive." Sitting back and letting the opponent's forces come to you is the worst approach you can take with this Leader. He is far more prepared to launch an attack. Wherever he's taking the fight, he's taking it to his foes. This is a good trait for a raiding playstyle that knocks his foes down with some degree of regularity to keep them all in check. This Leader should not fear declaring war over the slightest offense, or even for no justification at all. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Inflicts War Weariness upon enemy players faster than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Reduced cost of upkeep per military unit. Unique Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Free Aggressive I Promotion to all Combatant and Naval Combatant units. Gives a large attack bonus but a small defense penalty. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Increase in the rate of earning Great Military People. [ICON_BULLET]Great Military People city Specialists gain an additional Production each. [ICON_BULLET]Combatants and Naval Combatants gain a few extra Experience when trained. [ICON_BULLET]Combatants and Naval Combatants are trained faster. The people are entering training more psychologically prepared to unleash their savagery. [ICON_BULLET]You suffer less War Weariness. [ICON_BULLET]Small increase to the maximum number of population you convert to units during a Conscription action in a city. [ICON_BULLET]Gain some Free Military Units that don't require upkeep as normal. [ICON_BULLET]Somewhat more likely to capture enemy units when defeating them. [ICON_BULLET]Units are less likely to be captured when defeated. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Reduction in the rate of earning Great Military People on combats that take place inside your borders. Enough to counter the bonus you get overall so that the bonus ONLY applies when the battle is outside your borders. [ICON_BULLET]Reduction in the amount of Experience earned during fights within your borders. [ICON_BULLET]Slightly diminished base city defense level. [ICON_BULLET]Penalty to diplomacy. This Leader is understood to be volatile and likely to seek cause to pick a fight. [ICON_BULLET]More expensive to upgrade units. Retraining them in new ways to unleash devastating attacks adds more to training costs.
TEXT.German: Positive Charaktereigenschaft "Der Angriff ist die beste Verteidigung." - deutsches Sprichwort Wer es mit einem aggressiven Gegner zu tun bekommt, der sollte sich besser nicht zurücklehnen und abwarten, sondern muss jederzeit mit einem Angriff rechnen. Ein aggressiver Anführer verfügt über ein gut ausgebildetes Militär und ist bereit, beim kleinsten Anlass loszuschlagen. Manchmal erklärt er den Krieg auch ohne jede Rechtfertigung, einfach weil ihm gerade danach ist. Dies ist eine hervorragende Charaktereigenschaft für Spieler, die ihre Gegner mit Militärmacht in die Knie zwingen wollen. Primäre Vorteile: [ICON_BULLET]schnellere Kriegsmüdigkeit bei gegnerischen Nationen [ICON_BULLET]reduzierte laufende Kosten für militärische Einheiten Vorteile für Einheiten: [ICON_BULLET]alle Kämpfer- und Marineeinheiten erhalten automatisch die Beförderung Aggressiv I Weitere Vorteile: [ICON_BULLET]erhöhte Geburtenrate für Große Feldherren [ICON_BULLET]als angesiedelte Spezialisten bringen Große Feldherren zusätzlich [ICON_PRODUCTION] [ICON_BULLET]Kämpfer- und Marineeinheiten erhalten beim Training zusätzliche Erfahrungspunkte [ICON_BULLET]beschleunigtes Training für Kämpfer- und Marineeinheiten (Die Bevölkerung ist auch ohne militärische Ausbildung schon für den Kampf gestählt.) [ICON_BULLET]Verminderung der Kriegsmüdigkeit des eigenen Volkes [ICON_BULLET]Erhöhung der Anzahl an neuen Militäreinheiten, die über Einberufungsaktionen gewonnen werden können [ICON_BULLET]zusätzliche freie Einheiten, für die keine laufenden Kosten anfallen [ICON_BULLET]erhöhte Wahrscheinlichkeit für die Gefangennahme gegnerischer Einheiten [ICON_BULLET]verringerte Wahrscheinlichkeit für die Gefangennahme eigener Einheiten Nachteile: [ICON_BULLET]normale Geburtenrate für Große Feldherren bei Gefechten innerhalb der eigenen Grenzen (Der Bonus für Gefechte außerhalb der eigenen Grenzen wird gerade aufgehoben.) [ICON_BULLET]Verminderung der Erfahrungspunkte für Gefechte innerhalb der eigenen Grenzen [ICON_BULLET]geschwächte Stadtverteidigung [ICON_BULLET]Nachteile bei diplomatischen Verhandlungen (Das Staatsoberhaupt gilt als impulsiv und jedes Gegenüber rechnet damit, dass es jederzeit einen Streit vom Zaun bricht.) [ICON_BULLET]Preisanstieg für die Modernisierung von Einheiten (Das Austesten neuer Möglichkeiten für vernichtende Angriffe und das Einüben derselben erhöht die Trainingskosten.)

[ICON_BULLET]Nieco wiêksze prawdopodobieñstwo, ¿e przejmie jednostki wroga podczas ich pokonywania [ICON_BULLET]Jednostki rzadziej zostan¹ schwytane, gdy zostan¹ pokonane. Wystarczaj¹co, aby zrównowa¿yæ ogóln¹ premiê, któr¹ otrzymujesz, tak aby premia mia³a zastosowanie TYLKO wtedy, gdy bitwa toczy siê poza twoimi granicami. [ICON_BULLET]Zmniejszenie iloœci doœwiadczenia zdobywanego podczas walk w twoich granicach. [ICON_BULLET]Zmniejszony podstawowy poziom obrony miasta. [ICON_BULLET]Kara dla dyplomacji. Przywódca ten jest uwa¿any za niestabilnego i sk³onnego do szukania powodu do wszczêcia walki. [ICON_BULLET]Dro¿sze ulepszanie jednostek. Przeszkolenie ich na nowe sposoby przeprowadzania niszczycielskich ataków zwiêksza koszty szkolenia.

[ICON_BULLET]Nieco wiêksze prawdopodobieñstwo, ¿e przejmie jednostki wroga podczas ich pokonywania [ICON_BULLET]Jednostki rzadziej zostan¹ schwytane, gdy zostan¹ pokonane. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Zmniejszenie tempa zdobywania wielkich wojskowych w walkach tocz¹cych siê w twoich granicach. Wystarczaj¹co, aby zrównowa¿yæ ogóln¹ premiê, któr¹ otrzymujesz, tak aby premia mia³a zastosowanie TYLKO wtedy, gdy bitwa toczy siê poza twoimi granicami. [ICON_BULLET]Zmniejszenie iloœci doœwiadczenia zdobywanego podczas walk w twoich granicach. [ICON_BULLET]Zmniejszony podstawowy poziom obrony miasta. [ICON_BULLET]Kara dla dyplomacji. Przywódca ten jest uwa¿any za niestabilnego i sk³onnego do szukania powodu do wszczêcia walki. [ICON_BULLET]Dro¿sze ulepszanie jednostek. TEXT.English: Positive Trait "I will not allow them to insult our Great nation. They will feel our steel if they dare to disrespect us. If we are strong, we can take what we want when we want it. Want to win on the international stage? Keep your rivals on the defensive." Sitting back and letting the opponent's forces come to you is the worst approach you can take with this Leader. He is far more prepared to launch an attack. Wherever he's taking the fight, he's taking it to his foes. This is a good trait for a raiding playstyle that knocks his foes down with some degree of regularity to keep them all in check. This Leader should not fear declaring war over the slightest offense, or even for no justification at all. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Inflicts War Weariness upon enemy players far faster than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Reduced cost of upkeep per military unit. Unique Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Free Aggressive Promotion to all Combatant and Naval Combatant units. Gives a large attack bonus but a small defense penalty. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Significant increase in the rate of earning Great Military People. [ICON_BULLET]Great Military People city Specialists gain an additional Production each. [ICON_BULLET]Great Military People city Specialists gain two additional Gold each. [ICON_BULLET]Combatants and Naval Combatants gain a few extra Experience when trained. [ICON_BULLET]Combatants and Naval Combatants are trained faster. The people are entering training more psychologically prepared to unleash their savagery. [ICON_BULLET]You suffer less War Weariness. [ICON_BULLET]Small increase to the maximum number of population you convert to units during a Conscription action in a city. [ICON_BULLET]Gain some Free Military Units that don't require upkeep as normal. [ICON_BULLET]More likely to capture enemy units when defeating them. [ICON_BULLET]Units are less likely to be captured when defeated. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Reduction in the rate of earning Great Military People on combats that take place inside your borders. Enough to counter the bonus you get overall so that the bonus ONLY applies when the battle is outside your borders. [ICON_BULLET]Significant reduction in the amount of Experience earned during fights within your borders. [ICON_BULLET]Diminished base city defense level. [ICON_BULLET]Significant penalty to diplomacy. This Leader is understood to be volatile and likely to seek cause to pick a fight. [ICON_BULLET]More expensive to upgrade units. Retraining them in new ways to unleash devastating attacks adds more to training costs.
TEXT.German: Positive Charaktereigenschaft "Der Angriff ist die beste Verteidigung." - deutsches Sprichwort Wer es mit einem aggressiven Gegner zu tun bekommt, der sollte sich besser nicht zurücklehnen und abwarten, sondern muss jederzeit mit einem Angriff rechnen. Ein aggressiver Anführer verfügt über ein gut ausgebildetes Militär und ist bereit, beim kleinsten Anlass loszuschlagen. Manchmal erklärt er den Krieg auch ohne jede Rechtfertigung, einfach weil ihm gerade danach ist. Dies ist eine hervorragende Charaktereigenschaft für Spieler, die ihre Gegner mit Militärmacht in die Knie zwingen wollen. Primäre Vorteile: [ICON_BULLET]schnellere Kriegsmüdigkeit bei gegnerischen Nationen [ICON_BULLET]reduzierte laufende Kosten für militärische Einheiten Vorteile für Einheiten: [ICON_BULLET]alle Kämpfer- und Marineeinheiten erhalten automatisch die Beförderung Aggressiv Weitere Vorteile: [ICON_BULLET]erhöhte Geburtenrate für Große Feldherren [ICON_BULLET]als angesiedelte Spezialisten bringen Große Feldherren zusätzlich [ICON_PRODUCTION] [ICON_BULLET]als angesiedelte Spezialisten bringen Große Feldherren zusätzlich [ICON_GOLD] [ICON_BULLET]Kämpfer- und Marineeinheiten erhalten beim Training zusätzliche Erfahrungspunkte [ICON_BULLET]beschleunigtes Training für Kämpfer- und Marineeinheiten (Die Bevölkerung ist auch ohne militärische Ausbildung schon für den Kampf gestählt.) [ICON_BULLET]Verminderung der Kriegsmüdigkeit des eigenen Volkes [ICON_BULLET]Erhöhung der Anzahl an neuen Militäreinheiten, die über Einberufungsaktionen gewonnen werden können [ICON_BULLET]zusätzliche freie Einheiten, für die keine laufenden Kosten anfallen [ICON_BULLET]erhöhte Wahrscheinlichkeit für die Gefangennahme gegnerischer Einheiten [ICON_BULLET]verringerte Wahrscheinlichkeit für die Gefangennahme eigener Einheiten Nachteile: [ICON_BULLET]normale Geburtenrate für Große Feldherren bei Gefechten innerhalb der eigenen Grenzen (Der Bonus für Gefechte außerhalb der eigenen Grenzen wird gerade aufgehoben.) [ICON_BULLET]Verminderung der Erfahrungspunkte für Gefechte innerhalb der eigenen Grenzen [ICON_BULLET]geschwächte Stadtverteidigung [ICON_BULLET]Nachteile bei diplomatischen Verhandlungen (Das Staatsoberhaupt gilt als impulsiv und jedes Gegenüber rechnet damit, dass es jederzeit einen Streit vom Zaun bricht.) [ICON_BULLET]Preisanstieg für die Modernisierung von Einheiten (Das Austesten neuer Möglichkeiten für vernichtende Angriffe und das Einüben derselben erhöht die Trainingskosten.)

TEXT.English: Prepares a hostile military, ready to attack. Operates under the theory that the best defense is a good offense.
TEXT.French: Prépare une armée hostile, prête à attaquer. Fonctionne selon la théorie selon laquelle la meilleure défense est une bonne attaque.
TEXT.German: Dieser Anführer vertritt die Ansicht, dass Angriff die beste Verteidigung ist. Mit einer aggressiven Militärpolitik ist er jederzeit auf einen Angriff vorbereitet.

TEXT.English: Agricultural CT
TEXT.Polish: Rolniczy CT

TEXT.English: Agricultural I
TEXT.Polish: Rolniczy I

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "Fertility is the essence of strength. By nurturing the land, you nurture your people and your forces will always be plentiful." Your nation is bountiful but your people do work long and hard days to provide, leading to less time for more advanced pursuits. This is a simple but effective trait for growth but can also provide faster unit training. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]An additional Food is generated by any plot that generates as much as 7 or more. [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain an additional base Food. [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain a percentage modifier to Food. Unique Abilities: [ICON_BULLET]Food is converted to Production in any unit engaged in training a unit. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all more Healthy thanks to more exercise in the outdoors. [ICON_BULLET]Food focused Improvements generate an additional Food. [ICON_BULLET]Food focused Improvements upgrade much faster as normal. [ICON_BULLET]Food focused Improvements are much faster for your to build. [ICON_BULLET]Noble, Citizen, and Slave type Specialists generate an additional Food. [ICON_BULLET]Technologies that enhance Food production and storage are discovered faster. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance for Number of Cities is reduced. Effective local gardening reduces Maintenance needs. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all less Happy. [ICON_BULLET]Great People are slower to be born because your people spend more time laboring in the fields than on personal development. [ICON_BULLET]Suffers slightly more Water Pollution. [ICON_BULLET]Your citizens suffer minor Education penalties.

TEXT.English: Agricultural II
TEXT.Polish: Rolniczy II

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "Fertility is the essence of strength. By nurturing the land, you nurture your people and your forces will always be plentiful." Your nation is bountiful but your people do work long and hard days to provide, leading to less time for more advanced pursuits. This is a simple but effective trait for growth but can also provide faster unit training. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]The threshold for a plot generating an additional Commerce drops from 7 to 6. [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain additional base Food. [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain a percentage modifier to Food. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all significantly more Healthy thanks to more exercise in the outdoors. [ICON_BULLET]Food focused Improvements generate an additional Food. [ICON_BULLET]Food focused Improvements upgrade much faster as normal. [ICON_BULLET]Food focused Improvements are much faster for your to build. [ICON_BULLET]Noble, Citizen, and Slave type Specialists generate an additional Food. [ICON_BULLET]Technologies that enhance Food production and storage are discovered faster. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance for Number of Cities is reduced. Effective local gardening reduces Maintenance needs. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all less Happy. [ICON_BULLET]Great People are slower to be born because your people spend more time laboring in the fields than on personal development. [ICON_BULLET]Your largest cities are significantly less Happy since your people prefer rural living. [ICON_BULLET]Suffers slightly more Water Pollution. [ICON_BULLET]Your citizens suffer minor Education penalties.

[ICON_BULLET]Your largest cities are less Happy since your people prefer rural living. [ICON_BULLET]Suffers more Water Pollution. [ICON_BULLET]Your citizens suffer Education penalties.

TEXT.English: Strong Food production. Hard work in the fields can be a burden to Happiness and your citizens prefer more rural lifestyles.
TEXT.French: Forte production alimentaire. Le travail acharné dans les champs peut être un fardeau pour le bonheur et vos citoyens préfèrent des modes de vie plus ruraux.

TEXT.English: Anti-Clerical CT
TEXT.Polish: Antyklerykalny CT

TEXT.English: Anti-Clerical I
TEXT.Polish: Antyklerykalny I

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "Religion is a manipulative bane to the sanity of the people and a threat to our political power!" Each negative trait is like tying one of your hands behind your back. This is a textbook example, as you and your people are equally suspicious of anyone trying to instill superstitious belief forms. You may select one to vaguely support, but it is wise to stick to that choice once you've made it and you will struggle to gain much benefit from it over the penalties it invites. There are some side benefits to this approach, but you do miss out on a lot of potential power in the game, though you may find you can achieve more in some ways by ignoring the Religious strategy. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Large penalty to Religions Anarchy time, doubling the amount of turns you'd normally suffer to switch Religions. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities gain an added Unhappiness for each Religion maintained in the city, whether it's a State Religion or not. [ICON_BULLET]Holy Cities produce units that have a percentage less Experience. [ICON_BULLET]When playing with the Religious Disabling option, all Non-State Religions are inactive, and, depending on Civics, if they also bar Non-State Religions, their buildings are destroyed rather than simply disabled. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolutions Option, Holy Cities and the presence of conflicting Religions are more likely to cause problems. [ICON_BULLET]Missionaries are trained much slower. [ICON_BULLET]Priest type City Specialists are penalized a Production Yield. [ICON_BULLET]Priest type City Specialists lose an additional Research and Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Religious and Spiritual Technologies are discovered slower. [ICON_BULLET]If you have a State Religion defined, your cities lose the improved Great People birth rate benefit. [ICON_BULLET]Presence of a State Religion makes units there take longer to train, enough to counter the Military unit training speed benefit. [ICON_BULLET]Presence of a State Religion makes buildings there take longer to train, as worship services enforce breaks from labor. [ICON_BULLET]You lose an Experience point on units trained in any city that has the State Religion, countering the overall bonus that normally stems from the self-reliance of being faithless. [ICON_BULLET]Great Prophets are slightly less likely to be born. [ICON_BULLET]All Religions are harder to spread. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Increased Rate of Birthing Great People, as humility is not so strong a value in this spiritually untrusting society. [ICON_BULLET]War Weariness accumulates slower in your nation as there is little guilt in war among your people, and they are hardened by minimal faith, expecting that their destiny can only lie in their own hands. [ICON_BULLET]All units gain a bonus Experience point, as your people often rely on themselves for help when they need it, rather than any deity. [ICON_BULLET]All Military units are cheaper to build, which is enough to be a bonus if you have no State Religion in the city. [ICON_BULLET]Allows the nation to produce Inquisitor units once technologically unlocked, that can remove all Religions but the State Religion in a city.

You may select one to vaguely support, but it is wise to stick to that choice once you've made it and you will struggle to gain much benefit from it over the penalties it invites. There are some side benefits to this approach, but you do miss out on a lot of potential power in the game, though you may find you can achieve more in some ways by ignoring the Religious strategy. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Large penalty to Religions Anarchy time, doubling the amount of turns you'd normally suffer to switch Religions. [ICON_BULLET]Holy Cities produce units that have a percentage less Experience. TEXT.English: Negative Trait "Religion is a manipulative bane to the sanity of the people and a threat to our political power!" Each negative trait is like tying one of your hands behind your back. This is a textbook example, as you and your people are equally suspicious of anyone trying to instill superstitious belief forms. You may select one to vaguely support, but it is wise to stick to that choice once you've made it and you will struggle to gain much benefit from it over the penalties it invites. There are some side benefits to this approach, but you do miss out on a lot of potential power in the game, though you may find you can achieve more in some ways by ignoring the Religious strategy. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Huge penalty to Religions Anarchy time, quadrupling the amount of turns you'd normally suffer to switch Religions. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities gain an added Unhappiness for each Religion maintained in the city, whether it's a State Religion or not. [ICON_BULLET]Holy Cities produce units that have a percentage less Experience. [ICON_BULLET]When playing with the Religious Disabling option, all Non-State Religions are inactive, and, depending on Civics, if they also bar Non-State Religions, their buildings are destroyed rather than simply disabled. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolutions Option, Holy Cities and the presence of conflicting Religions are more likely to cause problems. [ICON_BULLET]Missionaries are trained much slower. [ICON_BULLET]Priest type City Specialists are penalized a Commerce Yield. [ICON_BULLET]Priest type City Specialists are penalized a Production Yield. [ICON_BULLET]Priest type City Specialists lose an additional Gold, Research, Espionage AND Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Religious and Spiritual Technologies are discovered slower. [ICON_BULLET]If you have a State Religion defined, your cities lose the improved Great People birth rate benefit. [ICON_BULLET]Presence of a State Religion makes units there take longer to train, enough to counter the Military unit training speed benefit. [ICON_BULLET]Presence of a State Religion makes buildings there take longer to train, as worship services enforce breaks from labor. [ICON_BULLET]You lose an Experience point on units trained in any city that has the State Religion, countering the overall bonus that normally stems from the self-reliance of being faithless. [ICON_BULLET]Great Prophets are less likely to be born. [ICON_BULLET]All Religions are significantly harder to spread. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Increased Rate of Birthing Great People, as humility is not so strong a value in this spiritually untrusting society. [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain a bonus base Production. [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain a bonus base Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]War Weariness accumulates slower in your nation as there is little guilt in war among your people, and they are hardened by minimal faith, expecting that their destiny can only lie in their own hands. [ICON_BULLET]All units gain a bonus Experience point, as your people often rely on themselves for help when they need it, rather than any deity. [ICON_BULLET]All Military units are cheaper to build, which is enough to be a bonus if you have no State Religion in the city. [ICON_BULLET]Golden ages last a bit longer because the people take more personal pride in their achievements. [ICON_BULLET]Allows the nation to produce Inquisitor units once technologically unlocked, that can remove all Religions but the State Religion in a city.

TEXT.English: Barbaric CT
TEXT.Polish: Barbarzyñski CT

TEXT.English: Barbaric I
TEXT.Polish: Barbarzyñski I

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "Kill, loot, pillage and burn! What else is being alive for?" While this Leader may not actually BE a barbarian, he certainly prefers being a crude and unrefined type, who sees his more violent and animalistic nature as being the strength he relies on to succeed. He prides himself on it and his people are empowered to let themselves live more wild as a result. This does make for a little stronger military, but generates some serious penalties in the overall results for this nation, primarily penalizing Research, Espionage, Food and Commerce. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer a percentage penalty to Research and Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer a percentage penalty to Food and Commerce. Unique Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]All Combatant and Naval Combatant units gain the Barbaric I Promotion, which gives a solid bonus to Attack, a small penalty to Defense, and Improvements to pillaging. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]You earn Great People significantly slower than normal since your people often spend their time and resources on simpler pursuits. [ICON_BULLET]World Wonders are slower to construct. The planning and execution required to construct these impressive works usually requires more focus and attention than these citizens have the capacity for. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer a penalty to base Research and Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer a penalty to base Food and Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Routes are built significantly slower by your . Who needs roads? [ICON_BULLET]Improvements upgrade slower on their own since taking the time to improve their operations is not something the citizenry tends to spend their time investing into. [ICON_BULLET]You suffer a Diplomatic penalty due to your inability to take care with your expressions. [ICON_BULLET]The least Anarchy this nation can Experience when making policy changes is one round. It's hard to get this rabble to get back to work after periods of unrest until their enjoyment of unstructured Experience runs its course. [ICON_BULLET]Units are slightly more expensive to update as getting them to focus during retraining is difficult. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]It takes a bit less Experience for your units to gain levels since they are naturally savage fighters. [ICON_BULLET]Your people suffer from slightly less War Weariness since violence and combat are second nature. [ICON_BULLET]Military units are slightly faster to train. The people are easily invited into military service since it lets them unleash their wild sides. [ICON_BULLET]Your people forgive being whipped to rush construction and training under slavery faster than usual since it's more understandable to them that people only listen to threats of force.

He prides himself on it and his people are empowered to let themselves live more wild as a result. This does make for a little stronger military, but generates some serious penalties in the overall results for this nation, primarily penalizing Research, Espionage, Food and Commerce. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer a percentage penalty to Research and Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer a percentage penalty to Food and Commerce. Unique Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]All Combatant and Naval Combatant units gain the Barbaric II Promotion, which gives a solid bonus to Attack, a small penalty to Defense, and Improvements to pillaging. [ICON_BULLET]National Wonders and Team Projects are significantly slower to construct because these larger achievements are very difficult for unrefined people to strive for. It's hard to get this rabble to get back to work after periods of unrest until their enjoyment of unstructured Experience runs its course. [ICON_BULLET]Units are more expensive to update as getting them to focus during retraining is difficult. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]It takes a bit less Experience for your units to gain levels since they are naturally savage fighters. [ICON_BULLET]Your people suffer from less War Weariness since violence and combat are second nature. [ICON_BULLET]Military units are slightly faster to train. The people are easily invited into military service since it lets them unleash their wild sides. [ICON_BULLET]Your people forgive being whipped to rush construction and training under slavery faster than usual since it's more understandable to them that people only listen to threats of force.

[ICON_BULLET]Your people forgive being whipped to rush construction and training under slavery faster than usual since it's more understandable to them that people only listen to threats of force.

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "Kill, loot, pillage and burn! What else is being alive for?" While this Leader may not actually BE a barbarian, he certainly prefers being a crude and unrefined type, who sees his more violent and animalistic nature as being the strength he relies on to succeed. He prides himself on it and his people are empowered to let themselves live more wild as a result. This does make for a little stronger military, but generates some serious penalties in the overall results for this nation, primarily penalizing Research, Espionage, Food and Commerce. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer a percentage penalty to Research and Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer a percentage penalty to Food and Commerce. Unique Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]All Combatant and Naval Combatant units gain the Barbaric Promotion, which gives a solid bonus to Attack, a small penalty to Defense, and Improvements to pillaging. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]You earn Great People significantly slower than normal since your people often spend their time and resources on simpler pursuits. [ICON_BULLET]World Wonders are much slower to construct. The planning and execution required to construct these impressive works usually requires more focus and attention than these citizens have the capacity for. [ICON_BULLET]National Wonders and Team Projects are significantly slower to construct because these larger achievements are very difficult for unrefined people to strive for. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer a penalty to base Research and Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer a penalty to base Food and Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Routes are built significantly slower by your . Who needs roads? [ICON_BULLET]Improvements upgrade slower on their own since taking the time to improve their operations is not something the citizenry tends to spend their time investing into. [ICON_BULLET]You suffer a Diplomatic penalty due to your inability to take care with your expressions. [ICON_BULLET]The least Anarchy this nation can Experience when making policy changes is three rounds. It's hard to get this rabble to get back to work after periods of unrest until their enjoyment of unstructured Experience runs its course. [ICON_BULLET]Units are more expensive to update as getting them to focus during retraining is difficult. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]It takes a bit less Experience for your units to gain levels since they are naturally savage fighters. [ICON_BULLET]Your people suffer from significantly less War Weariness since violence and combat are second nature. [ICON_BULLET]Military units are significantly faster to train. The people are easily invited into military service since it lets them unleash their wild sides. [ICON_BULLET]Your people forgive being whipped to rush construction and training under slavery faster than usual since it's more understandable to them that people only listen to threats of force.

TEXT.English: Charismatic CT
TEXT.Polish: Charyzmatyczny CT

TEXT.English: Charismatic I
TEXT.Polish: Charyzmatyczny I

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "A Leader derives all power from his people. Persuasion is therefore the ultimate key." The ability to earn respect and persuade others is one of the most critical skills to possess in any profession, most of all in being a Leader. When your people WANT to obey your directives, and your rivals enjoy your company and respect your capacity for cooperative action and problem resolution, the world tends to respond to your will with much greater ease. You may tend to be overly chatty at times and let certain things slip that you shouldn't, however, and many who live under your rule may consider you so Great a role model that they also have similar problems, so Espionage is your primary drawback. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your units require significantly less Experience points to level thanks to their high degree of morale and inspiration your Leader's words have inspired. [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain a percentage modifier to Production and Commerce. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all Happier thanks to your inspiring and rousing speeches making them confident in the leadership here. [ICON_BULLET]All cities get an additional base Production and Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Artist and Detective Type Specialists cost an Espionage each. Expressive and deeply connected citizens often give away more state secrets than they mean to. [ICON_BULLET]War Weariness is reduced for this nation because your Leader is so good at selling the reasons for conflicts. [ICON_BULLET]An extra citizen can be drafted during a conscription action in a city. [ICON_BULLET]Each military unit staffed in a city always provides an additional Happiness since the people trust that the intentions of the military are purely to protect and serve them. [ICON_BULLET]You gain a Diplomatic bonus. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages last a bit longer in this proud nation. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer from a reduction of a base Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer a percentage penalty to Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]It is easier for opponents to perform Espionage missions in your cities.

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "A Leader derives all power from his people. Persuasion is therefore the ultimate key." The ability to earn respect and persuade others is one of the most critical skills to possess in any profession, most of all in being a Leader. When your people WANT to obey your directives, and your rivals enjoy your company and respect your capacity for cooperative action and problem resolution, the world tends to respond to your will with much greater ease. You may tend to be overly chatty at times and let certain things slip that you shouldn't, however, and many who live under your rule may consider you so Great a role model that they also have similar problems, so Espionage is your primary drawback. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your units require a lot less Experience points to level thanks to their high degree of morale and inspiration your Leader's words have inspired. [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain a percentage modifier to Production and Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]You gain a strong Diplomatic bonus. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all significantly Happier thanks to your inspiring and rousing speeches making them confident in the leadership here. [ICON_BULLET]All cities get an additional base Production and Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Celebrity and Noble Type Specialists cost an Espionage each. Influential people in this nation have a tendency to over-publicize the intentions of the nation's bureaucrats. [ICON_BULLET]War Weariness is reduced for this nation because your Leader is so good at selling the reasons for conflicts. [ICON_BULLET]More citizens can be drafted during a conscription action in a city. [ICON_BULLET]Each military unit staffed in a city always provides an additional Happiness since the people trust that the intentions of the military are purely to protect and serve them. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages last a bit longer in this proud nation. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer from a reduction of a few base Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer a significant percentage penalty to Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]It is significantly easier for opponents to perform Espionage missions in your cities.

TEXT.English: Military benefit from loyalty and strong diplomatic benefits with foreign Leaders and the people alike. Loose lips can sink ships, however, and this guy's got the loosest of all. Speaks passionately, persuasively, eloquently, and honestly to a fault as he thinks more about how to inspire and less about how to protect his secrets. Unfortunately, pre-eminent entertainers and politicians tend to follow his example of open expression. Production and Commerce thrive under the security of leadership industry believes in.
TEXT.French: Les militaires bénéficient de la loyauté et de solides avantages diplomatiques avec les dirigeants étrangers et le peuple. Les lèvres lâches peuvent couler, cependant, et ce gars a le plus lâche de tous. Parle avec passion, persuasion, éloquence et honnêteté d'une faute alors qu'il réfléchit davantage à la façon d'inspirer et moins à la façon de protéger ses secrets. Malheureusement, des artistes et des politiciens de premier plan ont tendance à suivre son exemple d'expression ouverte. La production et le Commerce prospèrent sous la sécurité de l'industrie de leadership croit en.

TEXT.English: Creative CT
TEXT.Polish: Kreatywny CT

TEXT.English: Creative I
TEXT.Polish: Kreatywny I

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "What good are a people that cannot diversely express the emotional Experience of being?" You are Happy to invest national resources into art, music and dance. Your people are Happier and more fulfilled, and embrace projects that will impress people around the world, but they have a hard time embracing the idea of combat and can tend to not work as hard. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]All cities produce a couple more base Culture. [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain a percentage modifier to Culture. [ICON_BULLET]All Specialists produce an extra Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Cities start with a little Culture. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all Happier feeling more fulfilled and welcome to express themselves. [ICON_BULLET]Great People are faster to be born in this society that values personal expression. [ICON_BULLET]World Wonders are faster to construct as the people get enthused by the idea of impressing the world with their accomplishments. [ICON_BULLET]Buildings that are primarily for generating Culture are constructed faster. [ICON_BULLET]Many buildings that are primarily for generating Culture and Entertainment make your people Happier. [ICON_BULLET]Artist type Specialists give an additional Production. [ICON_BULLET]Citizen and Slave type Specialists give an additional Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Your Capital produces a small percentage more Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Technologies that lead to Cultural development are faster to discover. [ICON_BULLET]Great Artists are more likely to be born. [ICON_BULLET]Access to the Dye resource makes your people Happier. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Overall upkeep is higher since you pour financial resources into the arts. [ICON_BULLET]All Combatant units you train get one less Experience Point. [ICON_BULLET]War Weariness affects your people more severely. [ICON_BULLET]Your are significantly slower at building Improvements, since they can't build anything without beautifying it. [ICON_BULLET]Your draft actions conscript one less citizen. [ICON_BULLET]Your Military Units are slightly slower to train. [ICON_BULLET]Your enemies suffer less War Weariness since they tend to think of your people as too bohemian for effective warfare. [ICON_BULLET]Your defenses in your cities are easier to bombard since form has been preferred over function in your fortifications. [ICON_BULLET]Your units are easier to capture since your citizens value their lives more.

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "What good are a people that cannot diversely express the emotional Experience of being?" You are Happy to invest national resources into art, music and dance. Your people are Happier and more fulfilled, and embrace projects that will impress people around the world, but they have a hard time embracing the idea of combat and can tend to not work as hard. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]All cities produce a couple more base Culture. [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain a significant percentage modifier to Culture. [ICON_BULLET]All Specialists produce an extra Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Cities start with a little Culture. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all Happier feeling more fulfilled and welcome to express themselves. [ICON_BULLET]Great People are significantly faster to be born in this society that values personal expression. [ICON_BULLET]World Wonders are significantly faster to construct as the people get enthused by the idea of impressing the world with their accomplishments. [ICON_BULLET]Buildings that are primarily for generating Culture are constructed faster. [ICON_BULLET]Many buildings that are primarily for generating Culture and Entertainment make your people Happier. [ICON_BULLET]Celebrity type Specialists give an additional Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Artist type Specialists give an additional Production. [ICON_BULLET]Artist and Celebrity type Specialists give a few additional Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Citizen and Slave type Specialists give a few additional Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Your Capital produces a percentage more Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Technologies that lead to Cultural development are faster to discover. [ICON_BULLET]Great Artists are more likely to be born. [ICON_BULLET]Hit Musicals, Hit Singles, Hit Movies and Dye resources make your people Happier. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Overall upkeep is significantly higher since you pour financial resources into the arts. [ICON_BULLET]All Combatant units you train get one less Experience Point. [ICON_BULLET]War Weariness affects your people more severely. [ICON_BULLET]Your are significantly slower at building Improvements, since they can't build anything without beautifying it. [ICON_BULLET]Your draft actions conscript fewer citizens. [ICON_BULLET]Your Military Units are slower to train. [ICON_BULLET]Your enemies suffer less War Weariness since they tend to think of your people as too bohemian for effective warfare. [ICON_BULLET]Your defenses in your cities are easier to bombard since form has been preferred over function in your fortifications. [ICON_BULLET]Your units are easier to capture since your citizens value their lives more.

TEXT.English: Strong Culture output. People are Happy with their beautified society but are a little soft as a result, sometimes unable to cope with harsh realities.
TEXT.French: Forte production culturelle. Les gens sont satisfaits de leur société embellie mais sont un peu mous en conséquence, parfois incapables de faire face aux dures réalités.

TEXT.Polish: Silny dorobek kultury. Ludzie s¹ zadowoleni ze swojego upiêkszonego spo³eczeñstwa, ale w rezultacie s¹ trochê miêkcy i czasami nie potrafi¹ sobie poradziæ z trudn¹ rzeczywistoœci¹.

TEXT.English: Cruel CT
TEXT.Polish: Okrutny CT

TEXT.English: Cruel I
TEXT.Polish: Okrutny I

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "Who cares what the people think or feel? All that matters is that they perform for me. If they fear me, they will perform." Perhaps the most loathsome Leaders of all time have been ones that clearly show a disdain for any concern for his subjects. It has been said that Leaders can influence with love or fear and this one certainly relies on fear, favoring huge punishments and public displays of torture. He spends time and government resources on inventing new ways to toy with people to show how powerless they are against the authority this Leader wields. His people have been taught to bully one another and establish strong hierarchies of leadership that actively look for reasons to flaunt their power. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your Cities are much less Healthy. Unique Abilities: [ICON_BULLET]Most combat capable units gain the Cruel I Promotion. It diminishes withdrawal, gives a solid combat modifier and causes the unit to spread a bit of Crime. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all less Happy, fearing running afoul of the authorities. [ICON_BULLET]Great People are born less frequently in this oppressed country. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are less stable on the Revolution option. [ICON_BULLET]Priest Type Specialists cost a Food each because they push others to work harder, and thus people require more sustenance. [ICON_BULLET]Citizen and Slave Type Specialists cost a Culture each. [ICON_BULLET]Your Largest cities are less Happy because they tend to catch the brunt of it. [ICON_BULLET]You gain a Diplomatic penalty since even other Leaders see you as a demon to be dispatched. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages don't last as long when you or those you know are suffering. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer from somewhat increased Crime levels. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer from somewhat increased Disease levels. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]World Wonders are constructed faster under threats of Great pain if project timeline goals are not met. [ICON_BULLET]Priest Type Specialists gain a Production each because they push others to work harder. [ICON_BULLET]Priest Type Specialists gain an additional Espionage by putting their talents to torture. [ICON_BULLET]This nation suffers from less War Weariness because they embrace opportunities to make others suffer. [ICON_BULLET]You can draft a few more citizens than normal with a conscript action. [ICON_BULLET]Your Military units are slightly faster to train because many of your people are well prepared to unleash their pain on others. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities tolerate being whipped to rush construction and training significantly faster than normal since this is low-grade taking place constantly.

His people have been taught to bully one another and establish strong hierarchies of leadership that actively look for reasons to flaunt their power. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your Cities are critically less Healthy. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all much less Happy, fearing running afoul of the authorities. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Great People are born much less frequently in this oppressed country. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are less stable on the Revolution option. [ICON_BULLET]Citizen Type Specialists cost a Food each because they are pushed to work harder, and thus require more sustenance. [ICON_BULLET]Citizen and Slave Type Specialists cost a Research each. [ICON_BULLET]Your Largest cities are less Happy because they tend to catch the brunt of it. [ICON_BULLET]You gain a Diplomatic penalty since even other Leaders see you as a demon to be dispatched. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages don't last as long when you or those you know are suffering. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer from somewhat increased Crime levels. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer from somewhat increased Disease levels. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]World Wonders are constructed much faster under threats of Great pain if project timeline goals are not met. [ICON_BULLET]Citizen Type Specialists gain a Production each because they are pushed to work harder. [ICON_BULLET]Doctor Type Specialists gain an additional Espionage by putting their talents to causing pain to extract information. [ICON_BULLET]This nation suffers from much less War Weariness because they embrace opportunities to make others suffer. [ICON_BULLET]You can draft a few more citizens than normal with a conscript action. [ICON_BULLET]Your Military units are significantly faster to train because many of your people are well prepared to unleash their pain on others.

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "Who cares what the people think or feel? All that matters is that they perform for me. If they fear me, they will perform." Perhaps the most loathsome Leaders of all time have been ones that clearly show a disdain for any concern for his subjects. It has been said that Leaders can influence with love or fear and this one certainly relies on fear, favoring huge punishments and public displays of torture. He spends time and government resources on inventing new ways to toy with people to show how powerless they are against the authority this Leader wields. His people have been taught to bully one another and establish strong hierarchies of leadership that actively look for reasons to flaunt their power. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your Cities are a Great deal less Healthy. Unique Abilities: [ICON_BULLET]Most combat capable units gain the Cruel Promotion. It diminishes withdrawal, gives a solid combat modifier and causes the unit to spread a bit of Crime. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all less Happy, fearing running afoul of the authorities. [ICON_BULLET]Great People are born less frequently in this oppressed country. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are less stable on the Revolution option. [ICON_BULLET]Priest, Citizen, and Slave Type Specialists cost a Food each because they push, or are pushed, to produce harder, and thus people require more sustenance. [ICON_BULLET]Citizen, and Slave Type Specialists cost a Culture and a Gold each. [ICON_BULLET]Your Largest cities are much less Happy because they tend to catch the brunt of it. [ICON_BULLET]You gain a Diplomatic penalty since even other Leaders see you as a demon to be dispatched. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages don't last as long when you or those you know are suffering. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer from increased Crime levels. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer from increased Disease levels. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]World Wonders are constructed faster under threats of Great pain if project timeline goals are not met. [ICON_BULLET]Priest, Citizen, and Slave Type Specialists gain a Production each because they push, or are pushed, to produce harder. [ICON_BULLET]Doctor Type Specialists gain an additional Research and Espionage by putting their talents to torture and direct testing on Humans. [ICON_BULLET]This nation suffers from significantly less War Weariness because they embrace opportunities to make others suffer. [ICON_BULLET]You can draft a few more citizens than normal with a conscript action. [ICON_BULLET]Your Military units are faster to train because many of your people are well prepared to unleash their pain on others. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities tolerate being whipped to rush construction and training significantly faster than normal since this is low-grade taking place constantly.
