TEXT.English: Protective I
TEXT.Polish: Opiekuñczy I

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "Allow your cities to fall and your nation will follow. None shall pass through these walls!" Many Civilizations will break their teeth trying to take your cities. Go ahead and provoke them to get the most out of your benefits, and keep the fighting within your own borders as much as possible. If you're playing a tough level and fear opponents that are far ahead of you in Technology, this trait should help you feel much more secure, as it does your citizens. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Free Protective I Promotion to all Combatant units. Strong city defense modifier and an extra benefit. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities gain a base defensive modifier due to complex strategic preparations always established and in place. [ICON_BULLET]Defenses in your cities are tougher to diminish with bombardments. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Increase in the rate of earning Great Military People when the battle takes place inside your borders. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities construct Defensive buildings faster. [ICON_BULLET]Defensive buildings make your people Happier. [ICON_BULLET]Great Military People Specialists gain two additional Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Techs that form prerequisites for Defensive buildings are faster to Research. [ICON_BULLET]Increase to the maximum number of population you convert to units during a Conscription action in a city. [ICON_BULLET]Gain a bonus amount of Free Military Units from the total population of your nation. [ICON_BULLET]Each military unit you staff in a city makes your citizens Happier. Your people are only satisfied when national defense is an obvious priority - you've made that one of your most solid vows to them. [ICON_BULLET]Your units gain more Experience when the battle takes place within your borders. [ICON_BULLET]It is more difficult for your opponents to perform Espionage missions against you. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages are somewhat less beneficial in terms of yields. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages are a little less beneficial in terms of commerces. [ICON_BULLET]Increase in the amount of War Weariness you suffer. Anxiety about the quality of your defenses, likely to be tested during war, is very much the reason you and your people so good at ensuring it. [ICON_BULLET]Higher Maintenance costs from Distance to Capital because a well defended network of cities is a tighter network and defensive building materials are often very heavy. [ICON_BULLET]Higher Maintenance costs from Number of Cities. The larger the nation and the more centers to protect, the harder it is to plan the defenses for. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages are less lengthy. You and your people take everything very seriously and are thus less jubilant for fear of letting down your guard.
TEXT.Polish: Pozytywna cecha: "Pozwólcie upaœæ swoim miastom, a wasz naród pod¹¿y za nimi. Nikt nie przejdzie przez te mury!" Wiele cywilizacji z³amie zêby, próbuj¹c zdobyæ wasze miasta. TEXT.English: Strong city and domestic defenses and military benefits but it all comes at some expense.
TEXT.French: De solides défenses urbaines et nationales et des avantages militaires, mais tout cela coûte cher.
TEXT.Russian: Ìîæåò ïîõâàñòàòü ñåðüåçíîé çàùèòîé ãðàíèö è ãîðîäîâ, íî âñå ýòî èìååò íåìàëóþ öåíó.
TEXT.Polish: Silna obrona miasta i kraju oraz korzyœci militarne, ale wszystko ma swoj¹ cenê.

TEXT.English: Revolutionary CT
TEXT.Polish: Rewolucyjny CT

TEXT.English: Revolutionary I
TEXT.Polish: Rewolucyjny I

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "Freedom is our heritage and our right. Freedom enables the purest expression of each individual to become his highest self. This creates a strong nation." This Leader earned his position with a strong grass-roots movement, sometimes a violent one, driven by the frustrations of the people. He is held up as the solution that will bring the change they all feel they need. A lot of hopes ride on this individual. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain a percentage modifier to Gold and Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Citizen Type Specialists gain an extra Production. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are Happier since people feel you are leading them to a better lifestyle. [ICON_BULLET]National Wonders are significantly faster to construct since there is a strong sense of national pride under this leadership. [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolutions option, your cities are more stable and less likely to revolt. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities gain an extra base Gold and Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Your Capital gains a percentage modifier to Food, Production and Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Your Capital gains a percentage modifier to Gold and Culture. [ICON_BULLET]War Weariness is significantly reduced. Your people are prepared to fight for their country. [ICON_BULLET]Military units are trained faster in your cities. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are harder to perform Espionage Missions against as they are more alert, knowing the national plans go against the grain. [ICON_BULLET]Your units are harder to capture by enemies that defeat them as they are fiercely loyal to the cause. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]General Upkeep is higher since upholding his promises to the people can be expensive. [ICON_BULLET]Civic Anarchy times are longer since your people have deep disagreements on what policies will be best to move forward with. [ICON_BULLET]You gain a Diplomatic penalty for being headstrong and projecting a willingness to fight for what you want. [ICON_BULLET]Anger from whip rushing constructions and training lasts significantly longer than normal since the people feel deeply betrayed by this act. [ICON_BULLET]Foreign Trade Routes are less profitable since other nations see you as an upstart they don't want to Trade as agreeably with. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer from a bit more Crime since rebels are empowered by your cause.

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "Freedom is our heritage and our right. Freedom enables the purest expression of each individual to become his highest self. This creates a strong nation." This Leader earned his position with a strong grass-roots movement, sometimes a violent one, driven by the frustrations of the people. He is held up as the solution that will bring the change they all feel they need. A lot of hopes ride on this individual and he is seen as the hero of the people. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain a percentage modifier to Gold and Culture. [ICON_BULLET]War Weariness is strongly reduced. Your people are prepared to fight for their country. [ICON_BULLET]Citizen Type Specialists gain an extra Food, Production, and Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Citizen Type Specialists gain an extra Gold, Research, Culture and Espionage. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are Happier since people feel you are leading them to a better lifestyle. [ICON_BULLET]National Wonders are significantly faster to construct since there is a strong sense of national pride under this leadership. [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolutions option, your cities are more stable and less likely to revolt. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities gain an extra base Gold and Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Your Capital gains a percentage modifier to Food, Production and Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Your Capital gains a percentage modifier to Gold and Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Military units are trained faster in your cities. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are harder to perform Espionage Missions against as they are more alert, knowing the national plans go against the grain. [ICON_BULLET]Your units are harder to capture by enemies that defeat them as they are fiercely loyal to the cause. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]General Upkeep is significantly higher since upholding his promises to the people can be expensive. [ICON_BULLET]Civic Anarchy times are significantly longer since your people have deep disagreements on what policies will be best to move forward with. [ICON_BULLET]You gain a Diplomatic penalty for being headstrong and projecting a willingness to fight for what you want. [ICON_BULLET]Anger from whip rushing constructions and training lasts a lot longer than normal since the people feel deeply betrayed by this act. [ICON_BULLET]Foreign Trade Routes are significantly less profitable since other nations see you as an upstart they don't want to Trade as agreeably with. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer from a bit more Crime since rebels are empowered by your cause.

TEXT.English: Good Happiness, Strong Specialists, Extremely good at avoiding revolt. A little less productive but compensates when building military. Extra expenses in setting up government. National Pride is high (+Culture) and innovative traders are enjoying their new freedoms (+Gold)
TEXT.French: Bon bonheur, spécialistes solides, extrêmement bon pour éviter la révolte. Un peu moins productif mais compense lors de la construction militaire. Dépenses supplémentaires pour la mise en place du gouvernement. La fierté nationale est élevée (+ Culture) et les commerçants innovants profitent de leurs nouvelles libertés (+ Gold)

Dodatkowe wydatki zwi¹zane z utworzeniem rz¹du. Duma narodowa jest wysoka (+Kultura), a innowacyjni handlowcy ciesz¹ siê z nowych swobód (+Z³oto)

TEXT.English: Scientific CT
TEXT.Polish: Naukowy CT

TEXT.English: Scientific I
TEXT.Polish: Naukowy I

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "Knowledge is the true source of all power. Understand the way the world works to find your destiny in it." Is there anything more obviously beneficial than accelerating your Research rate? Out-performing your rivals in technological progress is the most fundamental strategy for victory in any game of Civilization throughout all of its versions. However, there ARE some nuisances you'll have to deal with here and you may find some other Leaders with other traits that find ways to compensate this difference can challenge and threaten you regardless of your small scientific edge here. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]All cities produce a couple more base Research. [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain a percentage modifier to Research. [ICON_BULLET]All Specialists produce an extra Research. [ICON_BULLET]Team Projects are built significantly faster since they often represent major scientific achievements. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are Healthier since knowledge of best Health practices is valued higher in this society. [ICON_BULLET]Your nation generates Great People faster since it is seen as a positive thing to be smart. [ICON_BULLET]Buildings that are focused on Science and Research are faster to build. [ICON_BULLET]Scientist type Specialists generate an additional Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Citizen and Slave type Specialists give an additional Research. [ICON_BULLET]Your Capital produces a percentage more Research. [ICON_BULLET]Technologies that lead to developments in Science and Research are faster to discover. [ICON_BULLET]Great Scientists are more likely to be born. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your people suffer more War Weariness as war tends to become a major distraction from scientific funding. [ICON_BULLET]Religious Anarchy time is greatly increased since your people have a hard time adopting new ideas on faith alone. [ICON_BULLET]Non-State Religions are even more difficult for your people to tolerate so each adds an Unhappiness wherever it is found among your cities. [ICON_BULLET]Military units are slower to train. Your citizens are reluctant to be considered brutish warriors. [ICON_BULLET]All Religions are harder to spread. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer an increased amount of Air Pollution. A lot of experiments involve exotic gases, volatile chemicals, and fire-based technologies. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are a little more Educated since knowledge is a social value in your nation.

TEXT.English: Scientific II
TEXT.Polish: Naukowy II

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "Knowledge is the true source of all power. Understand the way the world works to find your destiny in it." Is there anything more obviously beneficial than accelerating your Research rate? Out-performing your rivals in technological progress is the most fundamental strategy for victory in any game of Civilization throughout all of its versions. However, there ARE some nuisances you'll have to deal with here and you may find some other Leaders with other traits that find ways to compensate this difference can challenge and threaten you regardless of your small scientific edge here. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]All cities produce more base Research. [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain a percentage modifier to Research. [ICON_BULLET]All Specialists produce an extra Research. [ICON_BULLET]Team Projects are built significantly faster since they often represent major scientific achievements. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are Healthier since knowledge of best Health practices is valued higher in this society. [ICON_BULLET]Your nation generates Great People faster since it is seen as a positive thing to be smart. [ICON_BULLET]Buildings that are focused on Science and Research are faster to build. [ICON_BULLET]Archaeological plot Improvements are built much faster. [ICON_BULLET]Doctor type Specialists generate an additional Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Scientist type Specialists generate a few more Research. [ICON_BULLET]Your Capital produces a small percentage more Research. [ICON_BULLET]Technologies that lead to developments in Science and Research are faster to discover. [ICON_BULLET]Great Scientists are significantly more likely to be born. [ICON_BULLET]Your flying units possess an extra plot of operational range. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your people suffer more War Weariness as war tends to become a major distraction from scientific funding. [ICON_BULLET]Religious Anarchy time is greatly increased since your people have a hard time adopting new ideas on faith alone. [ICON_BULLET]Even your State Religion elicits an additional Unhappiness wherever it has spread. [ICON_BULLET]Non-State Religions are even more difficult for your people to tolerate so each adds an Unhappiness wherever it is found among your cities. [ICON_BULLET]Military units are slower to train. Your citizens are reluctant to be considered brutish warriors. [ICON_BULLET]All Religions are harder to spread, Non-State Religions a bit tougher still. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer an increased amount of Air Pollution. A lot of experiments involve exotic gases, volatile chemicals, and fire-based technologies. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are a little more Educated since knowledge is a social value in your nation.

TEXT.English: Seafaring CT
TEXT.Polish: ¯eglarski CT

TEXT.English: Seafaring I
TEXT.Polish: ¯eglarski I

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "Command the seas and you command the world." The majority of the Earth is covered in water. Waterways are the crossing points where most nations are vulnerable, in transportation of land forces, Trade Routes and supply lines. When your people consider themselves more at home on the waves than they are on land, we can Capitalize on the great power this brings. It also allows us to make the most of the sea's bountiful resources. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Free Amphibious Promotion for Explorers, Melee, Mounted, and Throwing unit types so they can ignore naval assault and river crossing penalties. [ICON_BULLET]Free Seafaring I Promotion for all Naval units, giving a solid combat modifier and mobility benefit. [ICON_BULLET]Working any Sea Domain plot produces an additional Production. Unique Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Naval transport ships all gain an additional cargo space, or a strong volume capacity boost. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Water based Improvements that can upgrade do so much faster. [ICON_BULLET]Water based Improvements that take time to build will be constructed faster. [ICON_BULLET]Great Admiral Specialists gain an additional Food yield. [ICON_BULLET]Great Admiral Specialists gain two additional Research. [ICON_BULLET]Sea Domain units gain a few bonus Experience points when trained. [ICON_BULLET]Sea Domain units are faster to train. [ICON_BULLET]Techs that give sea travel and warfare benefits are faster to discover. [ICON_BULLET]Great Admirals are birthed faster. [ICON_BULLET]All coastal cities gain an additional Trade Route if they can reach another coastal city in the Trade network. [ICON_BULLET]Many resources derived from naval plots give extra Happiness in all your cities. Your people love seaFood and are proud of what they bring up from the depths. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Health penalty. Drowning deaths are common. [ICON_BULLET]Overall upkeep is slightly higher since so much focus goes into utilizing the ocean, increasing the costs and investments necessary to do so. [ICON_BULLET]Many land based Improvements aren't as valuable. For example, Mines get less Production and Farms get less Food. [ICON_BULLET]Workers lose a quarter of their productivity speed. [ICON_BULLET]Higher Maintenance costs from Number of Cities. Naval transportation costs to support a nation's infrastructure needs are usually a little higher Maintenance and land locked cities are more resentfully supported. [ICON_BULLET]The largest cities in your nation are less Happy. Your people are more introverted, being accustomed to the relative isolation Experienced on naval voyages.

TEXT.English: Seafaring II
TEXT.Polish: ¯eglarski II

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "Command the seas and you command the world." The majority of the Earth is covered in water. Waterways are the crossing points where most nations are vulnerable, in transportation of land forces, Trade Routes and supply lines. When your people consider themselves more at home on the waves than they are on land, we can Capitalize on the great power this brings. It also allows us to make the most of the sea's bountiful resources. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Free Amphibious Promotion for Gun and Helicopter unit types so they can ignore naval assault and river crossing penalties. [ICON_BULLET]Free Seafaring II Promotion for all Naval units, giving a solid combat modifier and mobility benefit. [ICON_BULLET]Working any Sea Domain plot produces an additional Food. Unique Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Naval transport ships all gain an additional cargo space, or a strong volume capacity boost. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Water based Improvements that can upgrade do so much faster. [ICON_BULLET]Water based Improvements that take time to build will be constructed faster. [ICON_BULLET]Great Admiral Specialists gain an additional Production yield. [ICON_BULLET]Great Admiral Specialists gain two additional Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]Sea Domain units gain a few bonus Experience points when trained. [ICON_BULLET]Sea Domain units are significantly faster to train. [ICON_BULLET]Techs that give sea travel and warfare benefits are faster to discover. [ICON_BULLET]Great Admirals are birthed significantly faster. [ICON_BULLET]All coastal cities gain an additional Trade Route if they can reach another coastal city in the Trade network. [ICON_BULLET]Units that can carry missile units gain space for a couple more than normal. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Health penalty. Drowning deaths are common. [ICON_BULLET]Overall upkeep is higher since so much focus goes into utilizing the ocean, increasing the costs and investments necessary to do so. [ICON_BULLET]Many land based Improvements aren't as valuable. For example, Mines get less Production and Farms get less Food. [ICON_BULLET]Workers lose a quarter of their productivity speed. [ICON_BULLET]Higher Maintenance costs from Number of Cities. Naval transportation costs to support a nation's infrastructure needs are usually a little higher Maintenance and land locked cities are more resentfully supported.

TEXT.English: Spiritual I
TEXT.Polish: Duchowy I

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "Knowing the nature of self is all important to achieving all things. Seek truth through fully understanding all Religions." It has been said that every Religion is a different blind man reaching out and feeling different parts of God and their conflicts and disagreements purely stem from having a limited perspective, but all have elements of the truth infused in them, along with misinformation to cover up gaps in the extent of the understanding each possesses. All Religions are efforts to explain those things that cannot be proven, things like the meaning of life and its purpose. This Leader believes in exploring all deep spiritual thought, seeking deeper truth and benefits to be found in each outlook. To do so, they must completely accept the teachings of each spiritual path to gain the depth of insight each provides. The people agree that being open minded and embracing people of all beliefs is key in solving the greatest mysteries all seek the answers to. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Reduction in Religions Anarchy time. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities gain a Happiness for each Religion maintained in the city, whether it's a State Religion or not. [ICON_BULLET]Gain a significant Experience point modifier boost in any Holy City, whether a State Religion or not. Unique Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Even Non-State Religions give Commerce benefits to cities as if they were the State Religion. [ICON_BULLET]A Golden Age begins whenever you birth a Great Prophet. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolutions Option, Holy Cities and the presence of conflicting Religions are less likely to cause problems. [ICON_BULLET]Missionaries are trained significantly faster. [ICON_BULLET]Priest type City Specialists give an additional Food yield. [ICON_BULLET]Priest type City Specialists give an additional Research and Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Religious and Spiritual Technologies are discovered faster. [ICON_BULLET]Great Prophets are more likely to be born. [ICON_BULLET]All Religions are easier to spread. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Slightly reduced rate of earning Great Military People. The devout of most Religions often eschew violence and find it personally paradoxical to make the mastery of warfare their profession. [ICON_BULLET]Combatant units earn one less Experience point when trained. [ICON_BULLET]Combatant units are slower to train. [ICON_BULLET]War Weariness accumulates much faster in your nation since so many of your people conscientiously object. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages are reduced in length by a quarter, since the society-wide elation of a spiritual breakthrough is more commonplace.
TEXT.Polish: Cecha pozytywna: "Poznanie swojej natury jest wa¿ne, aby coœ osi¹gn¹æ. Szukaj prawdy poprzez pe³ne zrozumienie wszystkich religii." Przywódca ten wierzy w zg³êbianie wszelkich g³êbokich myœli duchowych w poszukiwaniu g³êbszej prawdy i korzyœci, jakie mo¿na znaleŸæ w ka¿dym spojrzeniu. Aby to zrobiæ, musz¹ ca³kowicie zaakceptowaæ nauki ka¿dej œcie¿ki duchowej, aby uzyskaæ g³êbiê wgl¹du, jak¹ ka¿da z nich zapewnia. Ludzie zgadzaj¹ siê, ¿e bycie otwartym i akceptowanie ludzi wszystkich wyznañ jest kluczem do rozwi¹zania najwiêkszych tajemnic, na które wszyscy szukaj¹ odpowiedzi. G³ówne korzyœci: [ICON_BULLET]Skrócenie czasu anarchii religijnej. [ICON_BULLET]Twoje miasta zyskuj¹ szczêœcie za ka¿d¹ wyznawan¹ w nich religiê, niezale¿nie od tego, czy jest to religia pañstwowa czy nie. [ICON_BULLET]Specjaliœci miejscy typu kap³ana daj¹ dodatkowy plon ¿ywnoœci. [ICON_BULLET]Specjaliœci miejscy typu kap³ana zapewniaj¹ dodatkowe badania i kulturê. Wyznawcy wiêkszoœci religii czêsto unikaj¹ przemocy i uwa¿aj¹ za paradoksalne czynienie mistrzostwa w sztuce wojennej swoim zawodem. [ICON_BULLET]Zmêczenie wojn¹ narasta w twoim narodzie znacznie szybciej, poniewa¿ tak du¿y procent waszego ludu sprzeciwia siê temu ze wzglêdu na sumienie. TEXT.English: Spiritual II
TEXT.Polish: Duchowy II

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "Knowing the nature of self is all important to achieving all things. Seek truth through fully understanding all Religions." It has been said that every Religion is a different blind man reaching out and feeling different parts of God and their conflicts and disagreements purely stem from having a limited perspective, but all have elements of the truth infused in them, along with misinformation to cover up gaps in the extent of the understanding each possesses. All Religions are efforts to explain those things that cannot be proven, things like the meaning of life and its purpose. This Leader believes in exploring all deep spiritual thought, seeking deeper truth and benefits to be found in each outlook. To do so, they must completely accept the teachings of each spiritual path to gain the depth of insight each provides. The people agree that being open minded and embracing people of all beliefs is key in solving the greatest mysteries all seek the answers to. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Strong reduction in Religions Anarchy time. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities gain a Happiness for each Religion maintained in the city, whether it's a State Religion or not. [ICON_BULLET]Gain a significant Experience point modifier boost in any Holy City, whether a State Religion or not. Unique Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Gain a free Great Prophet with each new Era you enter. [ICON_BULLET]Gives a cause for all Religions to be active when playing on the Religious Disabling option. Even if you HAVE a declared State Religion! With Civics alone, this is only possible when you can't have a State Religion. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolutions Option, Holy Cities and the presence of conflicting Religions are less likely to cause problems. [ICON_BULLET]Missionaries are trained significantly faster. [ICON_BULLET]Priest type City Specialists give an additional Commerce yield. [ICON_BULLET]Priest type City Specialists give an additional Gold and Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Religious and Spiritual Technologies are discovered faster. [ICON_BULLET]Great Prophets are significantly more likely to be born. [ICON_BULLET]All Religions are easier to spread. [ICON_BULLET]Access to the Incense Resource gives an extra Happiness in all cities in the Trade network. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Slightly reduced rate of earning Great Military People. The devout of most Religions often eschew violence and find it personally paradoxical to make the mastery of warfare their profession. [ICON_BULLET]Combatant units earn one less Experience point when trained. [ICON_BULLET]Combatant units are slower to train. [ICON_BULLET]War Weariness accumulates much faster in your nation since so many of your people conscientiously object. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages are significantly reduced in length, since the society-wide elation of a spiritual breakthrough is more commonplace.

TEXT.English: Spiritual III
TEXT.Polish: Duchowy III

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "Knowing the nature of self is all important to achieving all things. Seek truth through fully understanding all Religions." It has been said that every Religion is a different blind man reaching out and feeling different parts of God and their conflicts and disagreements purely stem from having a limited perspective, but all have elements of the truth infused in them, along with misinformation to cover up gaps in the extent of the understanding each possesses. All Religions are efforts to explain those things that cannot be proven, things like the meaning of life and its purpose. This Leader believes in exploring all deep spiritual thought, seeking deeper truth and benefits to be found in each outlook. To do so, they must completely accept the teachings of each spiritual path to gain the depth of insight each provides. The people agree that being open minded and embracing people of all beliefs is key in solving the greatest mysteries all seek the answers to. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Strong reduction in Religions Anarchy time. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities gain a Happiness for each Religion maintained in the city, whether it's a State Religion or not. [ICON_BULLET]Gain a strong Experience point modifier boost in any Holy City, whether a State Religion or not. Unique Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]No upkeep costs on any of the Religious Civics. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolutions Option, Holy Cities and the presence of conflicting Religions are less likely to cause problems. [ICON_BULLET]Missionaries are trained significantly faster. [ICON_BULLET]Priest type City Specialists give an additional Production yield. [ICON_BULLET]Priest type City Specialists give an additional Espionage and Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Religious and Spiritual Technologies are discovered faster. [ICON_BULLET]Gain a diplomatic bonus since your exposure to so many different points of view has helped you to get into the minds of your rivals and deeply understand their motives. [ICON_BULLET]Great Prophets are much more likely to be born. [ICON_BULLET]All Religions are much easier to spread. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Slightly reduced rate of earning Great Military People. The devout of most Religions often eschew violence and find it personally paradoxical to make the mastery of warfare their profession. [ICON_BULLET]Combatant units earn one less Experience point when trained. [ICON_BULLET]Combatant units are slower to train. [ICON_BULLET]War Weariness accumulates far faster in your nation since so many of your people conscientiously object. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages are significantly reduced in length, since the society-wide elation of a spiritual breakthrough is more commonplace.

TEXT.English: Agile at switching Religions and getting the most benefit from collecting as many Religions as possible.
TEXT.French: Agile pour changer de Religion et tirer le meilleur parti de la collecte du plus de Religions possible.

TEXT.English: Temperamental CT
TEXT.Polish: Temperamentny CT

TEXT.English: Temperamental I
TEXT.Polish: Temperamentny I

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "What? You DARE to defy ME? Off with his head! Oh, he's a foreign Leader is he? Well then... this means WAR!" Sometimes Leaders let the power really get to their heads and they start to act like insolent children, but since they are the ones defining the law and the direction of the nation, they have the authority to do tremendous damage with this abuse. Loyalties can be challenged and morale can suffer but the fear generated by this type of Leader can serve them in a few ways. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your units require significantly more Experience points to level since they so greatly resent the treatment they suffer. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer a percentage penalty to Production and Commerce. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all less Happy under your heavy handed rule. [ICON_BULLET]All cities are penalized by one less base Production and Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]War Weariness is significantly increased for this nation because your Leader comes across as willing to fight without good cause. [ICON_BULLET]Fewer citizens can be drafted during a conscription action in a city. [ICON_BULLET]You suffer a Diplomatic penalty. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages last a bit shorter in this fearful nation. [ICON_BULLET]Your citizens resent being whipped to rush construction and training longer. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Civic Anarchy periods are significantly reduced in fear of your Leader's wrath at any delays in establishing policy changes. [ICON_BULLET]It is harder for opponents to perform Espionage missions in your cities for fear of your Leader's retribution. [ICON_BULLET]Your enemies suffer from greater War Weariness since the people of rival nations find you frighteningly irrational. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer from less Crime than usual since punishments are severe.

TEXT.English: Diplomatically terrible and lacks for troop loyalty. Less Anarchy time as he has zero tolerance for disagreement. Less Crime because his punishments are severe.
TEXT.French: Diplomatiquement terrible et manque de loyauté envers les troupes. Moins de temps d'anarchie car il n'a aucune tolérance aux désaccords. Moins de criminalité car ses peines sont sévères.

TEXT.English: Covetous CT
TEXT.Polish: Po¿¹dliwy CT

TEXT.English: Covetous I
TEXT.Polish: Po¿¹dliwy I

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "Everything they have is better than what we have. We need to spend our time trying to emulate them so we can have those things too! Trade with them to learn their superior ways!" The jealousy this Leader feels impedes his ability to inspire his people to opening up to their own creativity, instead always looking to have the shiny new objects circulating through other nations. He's always disappointed with the accomplishments of his own nation and fails to recognize their achievements, leaving them demoralized in their efforts and feeling like it's just not their role to generate the new things in the world but to collect what others have made instead. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer from a percentage penalty to Research and Culture. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer from a percentage penalty to Production and Commerce. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]World Wonders are constructed slower. It is demotivating to think nothing will impress their Leader despite their best efforts. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer a penalty of a base Research and Culture. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer a penalty of a base Production and Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]The largest cities in your nation are a little less Happy since they live with such strong envy of other metropolitan centers they could never possibly be as impressive as. [ICON_BULLET]Anarchy periods last at least as long as a round, possibly scaled by game speed. Although quick to adopt a solution when it is found, an exhaustive Research of the best ways to implement a policy that have been shown by other nations must be undertaken first. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages don't last as long thanks to the underlying feeling of inner disappointment that drags down the mood of the people. [ICON_BULLET]Anger from using slavery to whip rush construction and training lasts longer than normal due to resent by the people for being apparently so poor at getting things done that they must be pushed to such suffering. [ICON_BULLET]Rushing construction and training with Gold costs more, as the people are not capable of responding to money motivation in their demoralized state. [ICON_BULLET]Units are a little more expensive to train because you always want to make sure they have the best weaponry, even if it costs you more for ineffective gains. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]War Weariness is not as strong against your people who see war as an opportunity to take the works of others. [ICON_BULLET]Civic Anarchy time is diminished since your bureaucrats are quick to settle on sufficient solutions to policy decisions that are as close to a copy of what others have established elsewhere as possible. [ICON_BULLET]Workers are faster since they keep designs as basic and functional as possible. [ICON_BULLET]All cities get an additional Trade Route since your merchants are always looking to get what others have. [ICON_BULLET]Foreign Trade Routes are more profitable since your people are always hungry to buy things from foreign lands.

Chocia¿ rozwi¹zanie jest szybkie do przyjêcia, gdy zostanie znalezione, najpierw nale¿y przeprowadziæ wyczerpuj¹ce badania nad najlepszymi sposobami wdro¿enia polityki, które wypróbowa³y inne narody. [ICON_BULLET]Gniew wynikaj¹cy z wykorzystywania niewolnictwa do poœpiechu podczas budowy i szkolenia trwa d³u¿ej ni¿ zwykle z powodu urazy ludzi za to, ¿e najwyraŸniej s¹ tak s³abi w wykonywaniu zadañ, ¿e trzeba ich zmuszaæ do takich cierpieñ. [ICON_BULLET]Poœpiech w budowie i szkoleniu za pomoc¹ z³ota kosztuje wiêcej, poniewa¿ ludzie nie s¹ w stanie odpowiedzieæ na motywacjê pieniê¿n¹ w swoim zdemoralizowanym stanie. [ICON_BULLET]Wyszkolenie jednostek jest nieco dro¿sze, poniewa¿ zawsze chcesz mieæ pewnoœæ, ¿e maj¹ najlepsz¹ broñ, nawet jeœli nieefektywne zyski bêd¹ ciê kosztowaæ wiêcej. Korzyœci: [ICON_BULLET]Zmêczenie wojn¹ nie jest tak silne w przypadku waszych ludzi, którzy postrzegaj¹ wojnê jako okazjê do przejêcia cudzego dzie³a. [ICON_BULLET]Czas anarchii obywatelskiej ulega skróceniu, poniewa¿ wasi biurokraci szybko ustalaj¹ wystarczaj¹ce rozwi¹zania decyzji politycznych, które s¹ tak bliski¹ kopi¹ tego, co inni ustalili gdzie indziej, jak to mo¿liwe. [ICON_BULLET]Robotnicy s¹ szybsi, poniewa¿ utrzymuj¹ projekty tak proste i funkcjonalne, jak to mo¿liwe. [ICON_BULLET]Wszystkie miasta uzyskuj¹ dodatkowy szlak handlowy, poniewa¿ twoi kupcy zawsze chc¹ zdobyæ to, co maj¹ inni. [ICON_BULLET]Zagraniczne szlaki handlowe s¹ bardziej dochodowe twoi ludzie s¹ zawsze g³odni kupowania rzeczy z obcych krajów.

TEXT.English: Covetous II
TEXT.Polish: Po¿¹dliwy II

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "Everything they have is better than what we have. We need to spend our time trying to emulate them so we can have those things too! Trade with them to learn their superior ways!" The jealousy this Leader feels impedes his ability to inspire his people to opening up to their own creativity, instead always looking to have the shiny new objects circulating through other nations. He's always disappointed with the accomplishments of his own nation and fails to recognize their achievements, leaving them demoralized in their efforts and feeling like it's just not their role to generate the new things in the world but to collect what others have made instead. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer from a percentage penalty to Research and Culture. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer from a percentage penalty to Production and Commerce. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]World Wonders and Team Projects are constructed significantly slower. It is demotivating to think nothing will impress their Leader despite their best efforts. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer a penalty of a base Research and Culture. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer a penalty of a base Production and Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]The largest cities in your nation are a little less Happy since they live with such strong envy of other metropolitan centers they could never possibly be as impressive as. [ICON_BULLET]Anarchy periods last at least as long as a few rounds, possibly scaled by game speed. Although quick to adopt a solution when it is found, an exhaustive Research of the best ways to implement a policy that have been shown by other nations must be undertaken first. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages don't last as long thanks to the underlying feeling of inner disappointment that drags down the mood of the people. [ICON_BULLET]Anger from using slavery to whip rush construction and training lasts significantly longer than normal due to resent by the people for being apparently so poor at getting things done that they must be pushed to such suffering. [ICON_BULLET]Rushing construction and training with Gold costs significantly more, as the people are not capable of responding to money motivation in their demoralized state. [ICON_BULLET]Units are a little more expensive to train because you always want to make sure they have the best weaponry, even if it costs you more for ineffective gains. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]War Weariness is not as strong against your people who see war as an opportunity to take the works of others. [ICON_BULLET]Civic Anarchy time is diminished since your bureaucrats are quick to settle on sufficient solutions to policy decisions that are as close to a copy of what others have established elsewhere as possible. [ICON_BULLET]Improvements upgrade naturally much faster since best practices are rapidly adopted once invented. [ICON_BULLET]Workers are faster since they keep designs as basic and functional as possible. [ICON_BULLET]All cities get an additional Trade Route since your merchants are always looking to get what others have. [ICON_BULLET]Foreign Trade Routes are more profitable since your people are always hungry to buy things from foreign lands.

TEXT.English: Some Trade and diplomatic benefits but loses a lot of strength at home and is weak against Espionage.
TEXT.French: Certains avantages commerciaux et diplomatiques, mais perd beaucoup de force à la maison et est faible contre l'espionnage.

TEXT.Polish: Niektóre korzyœci handlowe i dyplomatyczne, ale traci du¿o si³ w kraju i jest s³aby przeciwko szpiegostwu.

TEXT.English: Cowardly CT
TEXT.Polish: Tchórzliwy CT

TEXT.English: Cowardly I
TEXT.Polish: Tchórzliwy I

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "Please don't hurt me!" As afraid as you and your people are of being attacked, the very idea of being assaulted can invigorate them somewhat when they go on the attack. They can be like bullies that are much more confident when they are the aggressor but as soon as they come under fire, they tend to fold. This all stems from their Leader having a similar mentality, who panders and blusters to avoid, at all cost, any reproach from anyone. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Assigns the Cowardly I Promotion to all Combatant and Naval Combatant units. Gives a large defense penalty but a small attack bonus. [ICON_BULLET]Increased cost of upkeep per unit. Working for the government is perceived as carrying risk of conflict. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Decrease in the rate of earning Great Military People. [ICON_BULLET]Forts upgrade much slower than usual. [ICON_BULLET]Your build fort Improvements much slower. [ICON_BULLET]Combatants and Naval Combatants lose some Experience when trained. [ICON_BULLET]Combatants and Naval Combatants take longer to train. [ICON_BULLET]Increase in War Weariness your people suffer. There is a cultural sense of terror that grips your people when at war. [ICON_BULLET]Decrease to the maximum number of population you convert to units during a Conscription action in a city. [ICON_BULLET]Lose some Free Military Units that don't require upkeep as normal that you may be getting from another source. [ICON_BULLET]Units are more likely to be captured when defeated. They are always looking for way they will survive being under attack. Bonuses: [ICON_BULLET]Each military unit you staff in a city makes your citizens feel much safer and thus Happier. [ICON_BULLET]Gain an additional Trade Route in each city due to the economic amiability of your people so as to appease potential rivals. [ICON_BULLET]Decrease in the cost of upgrading units since training can only cover the bare minimums without freaking out your government employees.
TEXT.German: Negative Charaktereigenschaft "Der Feige stirbt schon vielmal, eh' er stirbt, die Tapfern kosten einmal nur den Tod." - William Shakespeare (1564-1616) Feige Anführer leben in ständiger Angst vor Angriffen und versuchen diese auf Biegen und Brechen zu vermeiden. Paradoxerweise führt das dazu, dass ihre Truppen tatsächlich gestärkt sind, solange sie selbst die Angreifer darstellen, in der Verteidigung aber hoffnungslos unterlegen. Sie sind ähnlich wie Raufbolde auf dem Schulhof, die nur solange stark sind, wie sie andere schikanieren können, die aber sofort einknicken, wenn sie selbst in die Schusslinie geraten. Primäre Nachteile: [ICON_BULLET]erhöhte laufende Kosten für militärische Einheiten (Wegen des gefürchteten Konfliktpotenzials wird der Militärdienst nur ungern verrichtet.) Nachteile für Einheiten: [ICON_BULLET]alle Kämpfer- und Marineeinheiten erhalten automatisch die Beförderung Feige I Weitere Nachteile: [ICON_BULLET]gesenkte Geburtenrate für Große Feldherren [ICON_BULLET]Befestigungsanlagen im Umland werden langsamer modernisiert [ICON_BULLET]Arbeitstrupps bauen Befestigungsanlagen langsamer [ICON_BULLET]Kämpfer- und Marineeinheiten erhalten beim Training weniger Erfahrungspunkte [ICON_BULLET]verzögertes Training für Kämpfer- und Marineeinheiten [ICON_BULLET]Steigerung der Kriegsmüdigkeit des eigenen Volkes (Jeder Kriegszustand versetzt das Volk in Angst und Schrecken.) [ICON_BULLET]Verminderung der Anzahl an neuen Militäreinheiten, die über Einberufungsaktionen gewonnen werden können [ICON_BULLET]weniger freie Einheiten, für die keine laufenden Kosten anfallen [ICON_BULLET]erhöhte Wahrscheinlichkeit für die Gefangennahme eigener Einheiten (Überleben ist alles, was zählt.) Vorteile: [ICON_BULLET]erhöhte Zufriedenheit durch stationierte Militäreinheiten in Städten (da die ansässige Bevölkerung sich dadurch sicherer fühlt) [ICON_BULLET]eine Handelsroute mehr pro Stadt (Die Händler sind in der Lage, potenzielle Rivalen zu beschwichtigen.) [ICON_BULLET]Preissenkung für die Modernisierung von Einheiten (Es kann nur am Minimum trainiert werden, da alles andere zu Panik wegen vermeintlicher bevorstehender Konflikte führen würde.)

TEXT.English: Cowardly II
TEXT.Polish: Tchórzliwy II

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "Please don't hurt me!" As afraid as you and your people are of being attacked, the very idea of being assaulted can invigorate them somewhat when they go on the attack. They can be like bullies that are much more confident when they are the aggressor but as soon as they come under fire, they tend to fold. This all stems from their Leader having a similar mentality, who panders and blusters to avoid, at all cost, any reproach from anyone. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Assigns the Cowardly II Promotion to all Combatant and Naval Combatant units. Gives a large defense penalty but a small attack bonus. [ICON_BULLET]Increased cost of upkeep per unit. Working for the government is perceived as carrying risk of conflict. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Decrease in the rate of earning Great Military People. [ICON_BULLET]Forts upgrade much slower than usual. [ICON_BULLET]Your build fort Improvements much slower. [ICON_BULLET]Combatants and Naval Combatants lose Experience when trained. [ICON_BULLET]Combatants and Naval Combatants take longer to train. [ICON_BULLET]Significant increase in War Weariness your people suffer. There is a cultural sense of terror that grips your people when at war. [ICON_BULLET]Significant decrease to the maximum number of population you convert to units during a Conscription action in a city. [ICON_BULLET]Lose some Free Military Units that don't require upkeep as normal that you may be getting from another source. [ICON_BULLET]Units are much more likely to be captured when defeated. They are always looking for way they will survive being under attack. Bonuses: [ICON_BULLET]Each military unit you staff in a city makes your citizens feel much safer and thus Happier. [ICON_BULLET]Gain an additional Trade Route in each city due to the economic amiability of your people so as to appease potential rivals. [ICON_BULLET]Decrease in the cost of upgrading units since training can only cover the bare minimums without freaking out your government employees. [ICON_BULLET]More likely to capture enemy units when defeating them because their terror driven rage tends to surprise foes into submission and because they can empathize, they are likely to take pity on those who surrender.

Nachteile für Einheiten: [ICON_BULLET]alle Kämpfer- und Marineeinheiten erhalten automatisch die Beförderung Feige II Weitere Nachteile: [ICON_BULLET]gesenkte Geburtenrate für Große Feldherren [ICON_BULLET]Befestigungsanlagen im Umland werden langsamer modernisiert [ICON_BULLET]Arbeitstrupps bauen Befestigungsanlagen langsamer [ICON_BULLET]Kämpfer- und Marineeinheiten erhalten beim Training weniger Erfahrungspunkte [ICON_BULLET]verzögertes Training für Kämpfer- und Marineeinheiten [ICON_BULLET]Steigerung der Kriegsmüdigkeit des eigenen Volkes (Jeder Kriegszustand versetzt das Volk in Angst und Schrecken.) [ICON_BULLET]Verminderung der Anzahl an neuen Militäreinheiten, die über Einberufungsaktionen gewonnen werden können [ICON_BULLET]weniger freie Einheiten, für die keine laufenden Kosten anfallen [ICON_BULLET]erhöhte Wahrscheinlichkeit für die Gefangennahme eigener Einheiten (Überleben ist alles, was zählt.) [ICON_BULLET]Preissenkung für die Modernisierung von Einheiten (Es kann nur am Minimum trainiert werden, da alles andere zu Panik wegen vermeintlicher bevorstehender Konflikte führen würde.) [ICON_BULLET]erhöhte Wahrscheinlichkeit für die Gefangennahme gegnerischer Einheiten (Die eigenen Truppen lassen aus Angst vor Racheaktionen eher Gnade walten.)

Vorteile: [ICON_BULLET]erhöhte Zufriedenheit durch stationierte Militäreinheiten in Städten (da die ansässige Bevölkerung sich dadurch sicherer fühlt) [ICON_BULLET]eine Handelsroute mehr pro Stadt (Die Händler sind in der Lage, potenzielle Rivalen zu beschwichtigen.) [ICON_BULLET]Preissenkung für die Modernisierung von Einheiten (Es kann nur am Minimum trainiert werden, da alles andere zu Panik wegen vermeintlicher bevorstehender Konflikte führen würde.) [ICON_BULLET]erhöhte Wahrscheinlichkeit für die Gefangennahme gegnerischer Einheiten (Die eigenen Truppen lassen aus Angst vor Racheaktionen eher Gnade walten.)
TEXT.Polish: Negatywna cecha "Proszê, nie krzywdŸ mnie!" Niezale¿nie od tego, jak ty i twoi ludzie boicie siê ataku, sama myœl o tym, ¿e mo¿ecie zostaæ zaatakowani, mo¿e ich nieco o¿ywiæ, gdy przyst¹pi¹ do ataku. Mog¹ zachowywaæ siê jak tyrani, którzy s¹ znacznie bardziej pewni siebie, gdy s¹ agresorem, ale gdy tylko znajd¹ siê pod ostrza³em, maj¹ tendencjê do pasowania. Wszystko to wynika z tego, ¿e ich przywódca ma podobn¹ mentalnoœæ, który schlebia i przechwala siê, aby za wszelk¹ cenê unikn¹æ jakichkolwiek wyrzutów ze strony kogokolwiek. Kary g³ówne: [ICON_BULLET]Przydziela awans Tchórzliwy I wszystkim jednostkom Wojowników i Kombatantów Morskich. Daje du¿¹ karê do obrony, ale niewielk¹ premiê do ataku. Zwiêkszony koszt utrzymania jednostek. Praca dla rz¹du jest postrzegana jako nios¹ca ryzyko konfliktu. Kary dodatkowe: [ICON_BULLET]Spadek tempa zdobywania wielkich wojskowych. [ICON_BULLET]Forty aktualizuj¹ siê znacznie wolniej ni¿ zwykle. [ICON_BULLET]Twoi pracownicy buduj¹ ulepszenia fortów znacznie wolniej. [ICON_BULLET]Wojownicy i ¿o³nierze morscy trac¹ czêœæ doœwiadczenia podczas szkolenia. [ICON_BULLET]Szkolenie ¿o³nierzy i ¿o³nierzy marynarki wojennej zajmuje wiêcej czasu. [ICON_BULLET]Zwiêksza siê zmêczenie wojn¹, na które cierpi¹ twoi ludzie. Podczas wojny twój lud ogarnia kulturowe poczucie terroru. [ICON_BULLET]Zmniejsza maksymaln¹ liczbê ludnoœci, któr¹ przekonwertujesz na jednostki podczas akcji poboru w mieœcie. [ICON_BULLET]Tracisz kilka darmowych jednostek wojskowych, które nie wymagaj¹ utrzymania, które zwykle byœ otrzymal z innego Ÿród³a. [ICON_BULLET]Bardziej prawdopodobne, ¿e jednostki zostan¹ schwytane, gdy zostan¹ pokonane. Zawsze szukaj¹ sposobu, jak przetrwaæ atak. Bonusy: [ICON_BULLET]Ka¿da jednostka wojskowa, któr¹ obsadzasz w mieœcie, sprawia, ¿e Twoi obywatele czuj¹ siê znacznie bezpieczniejsi, a przez to szczêœliwsi. [ICON_BULLET]Dodatkowy szlak handlowy w ka¿dym mieœcie dziêki ¿yczliwoœci ekonomicznej Twojego ludu, aby uspokoiæ potencjalnych rywali. [ICON_BULLET]Zmniejszenie kosztów modernizacji jednostek, poniewa¿ szkolenie mo¿e pokryæ jedynie absolutne minimum bez panikowania pracowników rz¹dowych.

TEXT.English: Units are very weak when defending but there are some diplomatic benefits.
TEXT.French: Les unités sont très faibles lors de la défense mais il y a des avantages diplomatiques.
TEXT.German: Feige Anführer haben es bei diplomatischen Verhandlungen etwas leichter. Leider sind ihre Truppen sehr schwach in der Verteidigung und neigen dazu, vor Kämpfen davonzulaufen.

TEXT.Polish: Jednostki s¹ bardzo s³abe podczas obrony, ale istniej¹ pewne korzyœci dyplomatyczne.

TEXT.English: Crooked CT
TEXT.Polish: Nieuczciwy tomograf komputerowy

TEXT.English: Crooked I
TEXT.Polish: Nieuczciwy I

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "A sucker is born every minute and I'm nobody's fool. Those who get ahead are those who take advantage of others." There is an underlying lazy cowardliness in this Leader and his people. Although they are quite aggressive at breaking down others when they can stay hidden, operating in the shadows, if attacked, they prove poor at defending themselves, tending to shrink away and flee, finding to their terror that they cannot flee from their homes without being lost forever. They pay heavy economic costs for promoting an every man for himself society. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Crime is significantly increased in your cities. Unique Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your Criminal units all gain the Crooked I Promotion, which enhances Crime Spreading and other benefits normally possessed by Criminal units. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are less Happy since the good people are plagued by these thugs and hoodlums. [ICON_BULLET]Generic Upkeep is more expensive thanks to the coffers being commonly pilfered. [ICON_BULLET]Great Military People are less frequent to emerge since people here are naturally inspired by their Leader to be less disciplined. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are a touch less stable on the Revolution option. [ICON_BULLET]Spy Type Specialists are penalized a Commerce each. [ICON_BULLET]Merchant Type Specialists generate one less Gold. [ICON_BULLET]Your Law Enforcement units are trained with a few less Experience Points. [ICON_BULLET]Your Law Enforcement units are trained significantly slower. [ICON_BULLET]Your nation suffers more War Weariness since your Leader and his people are privately very cowardly types. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Distance to Capital is higher. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Number of Cities is higher. [ICON_BULLET]Your largest cities are less Happy since there is a reduced sense of personal security in the ghettos of the inner cities. [ICON_BULLET]Combat inside your borders produces a bit less Experience thanks to a lack of national pride and loyalty. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are somewhat less defensible since people here are reluctant to help take a stand in the small ways the citizenry often does. [ICON_BULLET]You suffer a Diplomatic penalty since other Leaders often understand your Leader is probably only looking for ways to take advantage of them for personal gain. [ICON_BULLET]It is moderately easier to perform Espionage Missions against your cities since information is up for sale by anyone. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]All cities generate an additional base Culture. Creativity is stronger among those who seek ways to get the most they can for the least effort. [ICON_BULLET]Buildings that tend to spread Crime, even if overall more beneficial that penalizing, are constructed faster. Overall this is a benefit because it doesn't require you build them, only saves you production expense if you do. [ICON_BULLET]Technologies that represent advancements in Criminal thinking are faster to discover. A benefit because you do need these for later prerequisites at least. [ICON_BULLET]Your Criminal units are trained with an additional few Experience Points. [ICON_BULLET]Your Criminal units are trained significantly faster.

TEXT.English: Crooked III
TEXT.Polish: Nieuczciwy III

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "A sucker is born every minute and I'm nobody's fool. Those who get ahead are those who take advantage of others." There is an underlying lazy cowardliness in this Leader and his people. Although they are quite aggressive at breaking down others when they can stay hidden, operating in the shadows, if attacked, they prove poor at defending themselves, tending to shrink away and flee, finding to their terror that they cannot flee from their homes without being lost forever. They pay heavy economic costs for promoting an every man for himself society. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Crime is significantly increased in your cities. Unique Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your Criminal units all gain the Crooked III Promotion, which enhances Crime Spreading and other benefits normally possessed by Criminal units. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are less Happy since the good people are plagued by these thugs and hoodlums. [ICON_BULLET]Generic Upkeep is significantly more expensive thanks to the coffers being commonly pilfered. [ICON_BULLET]Great Military People are less frequent to emerge since people here are naturally inspired by their Leader to be less disciplined. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are a touch less stable on the Revolution option. [ICON_BULLET]Lawyer Type Specialists are penalized a Commerce each. [ICON_BULLET]Investigator Type Specialists generate one less Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]Your Law Enforcement units are trained with a few less Experience Points. [ICON_BULLET]Your Law Enforcement units are trained significantly slower. [ICON_BULLET]Your nation suffers far more War Weariness since your Leader and his people are privately very cowardly types. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Distance to Capital is higher. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Number of Cities is higher. [ICON_BULLET]Corporations are significantly more expensive to maintain due to internal theft. [ICON_BULLET]Your largest cities are less Happy since there is a reduced sense of personal security in the ghettos of the inner cities. [ICON_BULLET]Combat inside your borders produces less Experience thanks to a lack of national pride and loyalty. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are less defensible since people here are reluctant to help take a stand in the small ways the citizenry often does. [ICON_BULLET]You suffer a Diplomatic penalty since other Leaders often understand your Leader is probably only looking for ways to take advantage of them for personal gain. [ICON_BULLET]It is much easier to perform Espionage Missions against your cities since information is up for sale by anyone. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Great People are born more frequently since personal freedom without restraint is highly valued here. [ICON_BULLET]All cities generate an additional base Culture. Creativity is stronger among those who seek ways to get the most they can for the least effort. [ICON_BULLET]Buildings that tend to spread Crime, even if overall more beneficial that penalizing, are constructed faster. Overall this is a benefit because it doesn't require you build them, only saves you production expense if you do. [ICON_BULLET]Technologies that represent advancements in Criminal thinking are faster to discover. A benefit because you do need these for later prerequisites at least. [ICON_BULLET]Your Criminal units are trained with an additional few Experience Points. [ICON_BULLET]Your Criminal units are trained significantly faster.

TEXT.French: Subit un grand Crime pour quelques petits avantages. Entraîne des criminels plus puissants.

TEXT.Polish: Cierpi z powodu wiêkszej przestêpczoœci, dla drobnych korzyœci. Szkoli silniejszych przestêpców.

TEXT.English: Defensive CT
TEXT.Polish: Defensywny CT

TEXT.English: Defensive I
TEXT.Polish: Defensywny I

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "Victory rarely goes to the aggressor, but rather to the prepared." The best thing you can do with this Leader is let your foes attack you and blunt their teeth against your thick hide. Place your forces on strongly defensive ground and they will be impossible to uproot. Capture bottlenecks and hold them to deny your foes passage. Act with impunity, for what are they going to do about it? Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Free Defensive I Promotion to all Combatant and Naval Combatant units. Gives a large defense bonus but a small attack penalty. [ICON_BULLET]Reduced cost of upkeep per military unit. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Increase in the rate of earning Great Military People. [ICON_BULLET]Forts upgrade much faster than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Your build fort Improvements faster. [ICON_BULLET]Great Military People Specialists gain an additional Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Combatants and Naval Combatants gain extra Experience when trained. [ICON_BULLET]Combatants and Naval Combatants are trained faster. [ICON_BULLET]Reduction in War Weariness your people suffer. [ICON_BULLET]Small increase to the maximum number of population you convert to units during a Conscription action in a city. [ICON_BULLET]Gain some Free Military Units that don't require upkeep as normal. [ICON_BULLET]Units are less likely to be captured when defeated. They are staunch forces. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]One less Trade Route in each city due to added security. [ICON_BULLET]Reduction in the amount of War Weariness your enemies suffer since they tend to believe you won't counter-attack. [ICON_BULLET]Increase in the cost of upgrading units since it requires more training to prepare them to master the art of defense. [ICON_BULLET]Less likely to capture enemy units when defeating them since they are not as likely to pursue the defeated.
TEXT.German: Positive Charaktereigenschaft "Wer auf den Krieg vorbereitet ist, kann den Frieden am besten wahren." - George Washington (1732-1799) Ein defensiver Anführer igelt sich am liebsten ein und lässt seine Feinde von seiner starken Verteidigung dezimieren. Wenn er Engpässe besetzen kann, dann gibt es für gegnerische Einheiten nahezu kein Durchkommen mehr. Wer gegen einen defensiven Anführer in den Krieg zieht, der sollte sich auf Materialschlachten einstellen und bereit sein, einen hohen Blutzoll zu entrichten. Primäre Vorteile: [ICON_BULLET]reduzierte laufende Kosten für militärische Einheiten Vorteile für Einheiten: [ICON_BULLET]alle Kämpfer- und Marineeinheiten erhalten automatisch die Beförderung Defensiv I Weitere Vorteile: [ICON_BULLET]erhöhte Geburtenrate für Große Feldherren [ICON_BULLET]Befestigungsanlagen im Umland werden schneller modernisiert [ICON_BULLET]Arbeitstrupps bauen Befestigungsanlagen schneller [ICON_BULLET]als angesiedelte Spezialisten bringen Große Feldherren zusätzlich [ICON_COMMERCE] [ICON_BULLET]Kämpfer- und Marineeinheiten erhalten beim Training zusätzliche Erfahrungspunkte [ICON_BULLET]beschleunigtes Training für Kämpfer- und Marineeinheiten [ICON_BULLET]Verminderung der Kriegsmüdigkeit des eigenen Volkes [ICON_BULLET]Erhöhung der Anzahl an neuen Militäreinheiten, die über Einberufungsaktionen gewonnen werden können [ICON_BULLET]zusätzliche freie Einheiten, für die keine laufenden Kosten anfallen [ICON_BULLET]verringerte Wahrscheinlichkeit für die Gefangennahme eigener Einheiten Nachteile: [ICON_BULLET]eine Handelsroute weniger pro Stadt (durch die erhöhten Sicherheitsvorkehrungen) [ICON_BULLET]Verminderung der Kriegsmüdigkeit der gegnerischen Bevölkerung (Niemand rechnet mit Gegenangriffen.) [ICON_BULLET]Preisanstieg für die Modernisierung von Einheiten (Ausgefeilte Verteidigungstaktiken zu erlernen, hat seinen Preis.) [ICON_BULLET]verringerte Wahrscheinlichkeit für die Gefangennahme gegnerischer Einheiten (Die eigenen Truppen lassen sich nicht auf die Verfolgung Besiegter ein.)
TEXT.Russian: Positive Trait 'Victory rarely goes to the aggressor, but rather to the prepared.' The best thing you can do with this Leader is let your foes attack you and blunt their teeth against your thick hide. Place your forces on strongly defensive ground and they will be impossible to uproot. Capture bottlenecks and hold them to deny your foes passage. Act with impunity, for what are they going to do about it? Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Free Defensive I Promotion to all Combatant and Naval Combatant units. Gives a large defense bonus but a small attack penalty. [ICON_BULLET]Reduced cost of upkeep per military unit. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Increase in the rate of earning Great Military People. [ICON_BULLET]Forts upgrade much faster than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Your build fort Improvements faster. [ICON_BULLET]Great Military People Specialists gain an additional Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Combatants and Naval Combatants gain extra Experience when trained. [ICON_BULLET]Combatants and Naval Combatants are trained faster. [ICON_BULLET]Reduction in War Weariness your people suffer. [ICON_BULLET]Small increase to the maximum number of population you convert to units during a Conscription action in a city. [ICON_BULLET]Gain some Free Military Units that don't require upkeep as normal. [ICON_BULLET]Units are less likely to be captured when defeated. They are staunch forces. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]One less Trade Route in each city due to added security. [ICON_BULLET]Reduction in the amount of War Weariness your enemies suffer since they tend to believe you won't counter-attack. [ICON_BULLET]Increase in the cost of upgrading units since it requires more training to prepare them to master the art of defense. [ICON_BULLET]Less likely to capture enemy units when defeating them since they are not as likely to pursue the defeated.

TEXT.English: Defensive II
TEXT.Polish: Defensywny II

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "Victory rarely goes to the aggressor, but rather to the prepared." The best thing you can do with this Leader is let your foes attack you and blunt their teeth against your thick hide. Place your forces on strongly defensive ground and they will be impossible to uproot. Capture bottlenecks and hold them to deny your foes passage. Act with impunity, for what are they going to do about it? Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Free Defensive II Promotion to all Combatant and Naval Combatant units. Gives a large defense bonus but a small attack penalty. [ICON_BULLET]Reduced cost of upkeep per military unit. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Increase in the rate of earning Great Military People. [ICON_BULLET]Forts upgrade much faster than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Your build fort Improvements faster. [ICON_BULLET]Great Military People Specialists gain two additional Research. [ICON_BULLET]Combatants and Naval Combatants gain significant extra Experience when trained. [ICON_BULLET]Combatants and Naval Combatants are trained faster. [ICON_BULLET]Significant reduction in War Weariness your people suffer. [ICON_BULLET]Increase to the maximum number of population you convert to units during a Conscription action in a city. [ICON_BULLET]Gain some Free Military Units that don't require upkeep as normal. [ICON_BULLET]Units are less likely to be captured when defeated. They are staunch forces. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]One less Trade Route in each city due to added security. [ICON_BULLET]Reduction in the amount of War Weariness your enemies suffer since they tend to believe you won't counter-attack. [ICON_BULLET]Increase in the cost of upgrading units since it requires more training to prepare them to master the art of defense. [ICON_BULLET]Less likely to capture enemy units when defeating them since they are not as likely to pursue the defeated.
TEXT.German: Positive Charaktereigenschaft "Wer auf den Krieg vorbereitet ist, kann den Frieden am besten wahren." - George Washington (1732-1799) Ein defensiver Anführer igelt sich am liebsten ein und lässt seine Feinde von seiner starken Verteidigung dezimieren. Wenn er Engpässe besetzen kann, dann gibt es für gegnerische Einheiten nahezu kein Durchkommen mehr. Wer gegen einen defensiven Anführer in den Krieg zieht, der sollte sich auf Materialschlachten einstellen und bereit sein, einen hohen Blutzoll zu entrichten. Primäre Vorteile: [ICON_BULLET]reduzierte laufende Kosten für militärische Einheiten Vorteile für Einheiten: [ICON_BULLET]alle Kämpfer- und Marineeinheiten erhalten automatisch die Beförderung Defensiv II Weitere Vorteile: [ICON_BULLET]erhöhte Geburtenrate für Große Feldherren [ICON_BULLET]Befestigungsanlagen im Umland werden schneller modernisiert [ICON_BULLET]Arbeitstrupps bauen Befestigungsanlagen schneller [ICON_BULLET]als angesiedelte Spezialisten bringen Große Feldherren zusätzlich [ICON_RESEARCH] [ICON_BULLET]Kämpfer- und Marineeinheiten erhalten beim Training zusätzliche Erfahrungspunkte [ICON_BULLET]beschleunigtes Training für Kämpfer- und Marineeinheiten [ICON_BULLET]Verminderung der Kriegsmüdigkeit des eigenen Volkes [ICON_BULLET]Erhöhung der Anzahl an neuen Militäreinheiten, die über Einberufungsaktionen gewonnen werden können [ICON_BULLET]zusätzliche freie Einheiten, für die keine laufenden Kosten anfallen [ICON_BULLET]verringerte Wahrscheinlichkeit für die Gefangennahme eigener Einheiten Nachteile: [ICON_BULLET]eine Handelsroute weniger pro Stadt (durch die erhöhten Sicherheitsvorkehrungen) [ICON_BULLET]Verminderung der Kriegsmüdigkeit der gegnerischen Bevölkerung (Niemand rechnet mit Gegenangriffen.) [ICON_BULLET]verringerte Wahrscheinlichkeit für die Gefangennahme gegnerischer Einheiten (Die eigenen Truppen lassen sich nicht auf die Verfolgung Besiegter ein.)

[ICON_BULLET]Strong increase in the cost of upgrading units since it requires more training to prepare them to master the art of defense. [ICON_BULLET]Less likely to capture enemy units when defeating them since they are not as likely to pursue the defeated.
TEXT.German: Positive Charaktereigenschaft "Wer auf den Krieg vorbereitet ist, kann den Frieden am besten wahren." - George Washington (1732-1799) Ein defensiver Anführer igelt sich am liebsten ein und lässt seine Feinde von seiner starken Verteidigung dezimieren. Wenn er Engpässe besetzen kann, dann gibt es für gegnerische Einheiten nahezu kein Durchkommen mehr. Wer gegen einen defensiven Anführer in den Krieg zieht, der sollte sich auf Materialschlachten einstellen und bereit sein, einen hohen Blutzoll zu entrichten. Primäre Vorteile: [ICON_BULLET]Verminderung der Kriegsmüdigkeit des eigenen Volkes (Das starke Militär sorgt dafür, dass die Bevölkerung sich sicher und beschützt fühlt.) [ICON_BULLET]reduzierte laufende Kosten für militärische Einheiten Vorteile für Einheiten: [ICON_BULLET]alle Kämpfer- und Marineeinheiten erhalten automatisch die Beförderung Defensiv Weitere Vorteile: [ICON_BULLET]erhöhte Geburtenrate für Große Feldherren [ICON_BULLET]Befestigungsanlagen im Umland werden schneller modernisiert [ICON_BULLET]Arbeitstrupps bauen Befestigungsanlagen schneller [ICON_BULLET]als angesiedelte Spezialisten bringen Große Feldherren zusätzlich [ICON_COMMERCE] [ICON_BULLET]als angesiedelte Spezialisten bringen Große Feldherren zusätzlich [ICON_RESEARCH] [ICON_BULLET]Kämpfer- und Marineeinheiten erhalten beim Training zusätzliche Erfahrungspunkte [ICON_BULLET]beschleunigtes Training für Kämpfer- und Marineeinheiten [ICON_BULLET]Erhöhung der Anzahl an neuen Militäreinheiten, die über Einberufungsaktionen gewonnen werden können [ICON_BULLET]zusätzliche freie Einheiten, für die keine laufenden Kosten anfallen [ICON_BULLET]verringerte Wahrscheinlichkeit für die Gefangennahme eigener Einheiten Nachteile: [ICON_BULLET]eine Handelsroute weniger pro Stadt (durch die erhöhten Sicherheitsvorkehrungen) [ICON_BULLET]Verminderung der Kriegsmüdigkeit der gegnerischen Bevölkerung (Niemand rechnet mit Gegenangriffen.) [ICON_BULLET]Preisanstieg für die Modernisierung von Einheiten (Ausgefeilte Verteidigungstaktiken zu erlernen, hat seinen Preis.) [ICON_BULLET]verringerte Wahrscheinlichkeit für die Gefangennahme gegnerischer Einheiten (Die eigenen Truppen lassen sich nicht auf die Verfolgung Besiegter ein.)
TEXT.Russian: Positive Trait 'Victory rarely goes to the aggressor, but rather to the prepared.' The best thing you can do with this Leader is let your foes attack you and blunt their teeth against your thick hide. Place your forces on strongly defensive ground and they will be impossible to uproot. Capture bottlenecks and hold them to deny your foes passage. Act with impunity, for what are they going to do about it? Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Free Defensive Promotion to all Combatant and Naval Combatant units. Gives a large defense bonus but a small attack penalty. [ICON_BULLET]Strong reduction in War Weariness your people suffer. There is a cultural sense of confidence that your forces will protect the people. [ICON_BULLET]Reduced cost of upkeep per military unit. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Significant increase in the rate of earning Great Military People. [ICON_BULLET]Forts upgrade twice as fast as normal. [ICON_BULLET]Your build fort Improvements much faster. [ICON_BULLET]Great Military People Specialists gain an additional Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Great Military People Specialists gain two additional Research. [ICON_BULLET]Combatants and Naval Combatants gain extra Experience when trained. [ICON_BULLET]Combatants and Naval Combatants are trained faster. [ICON_BULLET]Small increase to the maximum number of population you convert to units during a Conscription action in a city. [ICON_BULLET]Gain some Free Military Units that don't require upkeep as normal. [ICON_BULLET]Units are much less likely to be captured when defeated. They are staunch forces. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]One less Trade Route in each city due to added security. [ICON_BULLET]Significant reduction in the amount of War Weariness your enemies suffer since they tend to believe you won't counter-attack. [ICON_BULLET]Strong increase in the cost of upgrading units since it requires more training to prepare them to master the art of defense. [ICON_BULLET]Less likely to capture enemy units when defeating them since they are not as likely to pursue the defeated.
TEXT.Polish: Pozytywna cecha "Zwyciêstwo rzadko trafia do agresora, a czêœciej do bardziej przygotowanego." TEXT.English: Military focused with a 'Hold your ground' ideal.
TEXT.French: Militaire concentré avec un idéal «Tenez votre terrain».
TEXT.German: Defensive Anführer haben kein großes Interesse an Angriffskriegen, sie nutzen ihr Militär hauptsächlich zur Sicherung ihrer eigenen Landesgrenzen.

TEXT.English: Dynamic CT
TEXT.Polish: Dynamiczny CT

TEXT.English: Dynamic I
TEXT.Polish: Dynamiczny I

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "I push my nation to operate as quickly as it can, for there is much work to be done. We will take the initiative and beat all others to the goals only one may ever obtain. I have many plans and goals and all of them build onto one another, are interconnected. So many working parts and I keep them all spinning. I WILL leave a legacy!" The goal of this Leader is for he and his people to leave behind as incredible a legacy as possible in the amount of time he has to achieve it. He pushes his people hard to find Great accomplishments but cuts some corners on some things to achieve this, like Trade investments. Any buildings and techs that increase productivity are faster to come together as they get higher priority resources. Units are trained with a little less quality. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]World Wonders, National Wonders, and Team Projects are constructed significantly faster than usual. [ICON_BULLET]Rushing construction and training costs much less than normal. Unique Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Buildings that speed up construction and training are constructed faster. [ICON_BULLET]Techs that give benefits for being first to Research them are discovered faster. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Civic Anarchy periods don't last as long because your Leader more rapidly addresses the problems with new policy shifts. [ICON_BULLET]Improvements naturally upgrade twice as fast. [ICON_BULLET]Workers are much faster than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Your people are more efficient at their jobs and thus you gain a Free Specialist in all cities to represent that added amount of labor. [ICON_BULLET]Military Units are faster to train due to streamlined training regimens. [ICON_BULLET]The people are faster to forgive whipping to rush construction and training. [ICON_BULLET]Units are cheaper to upgrade since they are faster to learn new ways to fight. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Trade Route profits are reduced for Food yields. [ICON_BULLET]Units begin with one less Experience Point due to streamlined training procedures. [ICON_BULLET]Your nation naturally supports a reduced amount of Free Units based on a small percentage of the overall total population. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages don't last as long because people get back to a sense of normal faster.

TEXT.English: Dynamic II
TEXT.Polish: Dynamiczny II

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "I push my nation to operate as quickly as it can, for there is much work to be done. We will take the initiative and beat all others to the goals only one may ever obtain. I have many plans and goals and all of them build onto one another, are interconnected. So many working parts and I keep them all spinning. I WILL leave a legacy!" The goal of this Leader is for he and his people to leave behind as incredible a legacy as possible in the amount of time he has to achieve it. He pushes his people hard to find Great accomplishments but cuts some corners on some things to achieve this, like Trade investments. Any buildings and techs that increase productivity are faster to come together as they get higher priority resources. Units are trained with a little less quality. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]World Wonders, National Wonders, and Team Projects are constructed significantly faster than usual. [ICON_BULLET]Rushing construction and training costs much less than normal. Unique Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Buildings that speed up construction and training are constructed faster. [ICON_BULLET]Techs that give benefits for being first to Research them are discovered faster. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Civic Anarchy periods don't last as long because your Leader more rapidly addresses the problems with new policy shifts. [ICON_BULLET]Improvements naturally upgrade twice as fast. [ICON_BULLET]Workers are much faster than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Your people are more efficient at their jobs and thus you gain a Free Specialist in all cities to represent that added amount of labor. [ICON_BULLET]Military Units are moderately faster to train due to streamlined training regimens. [ICON_BULLET]The people are faster to forgive whipping to rush construction and training. [ICON_BULLET]Units are moderately cheaper to upgrade since they are faster to learn new ways to fight. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Trade Route profits are reduced for Commerce yields. [ICON_BULLET]This nation suffers more from War Weariness since war slows down development projects and enhances achievement stress. [ICON_BULLET]Units begin with one less Experience Point due to streamlined training procedures. [ICON_BULLET]Your nation naturally supports a reduced amount of Free Units based on a small percentage of the overall total population. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are a little harder to defend since they are built for efficiency rather than holding invaders out. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages don't last as long because people get back to a sense of normal faster.
