TEXT.English: Positive Trait "No society is fit to function until all of its people can learn to follow the laws as established. Enforcing them is of the utmost importance." Ruling his nation with an Iron Fist, this Leader is not as concerned with whether the law is liberating or oppressive so much as that it is followed. He spends the resources needed on rooting out corruption, wherever it may exist. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Each Military unit you staff in a city adds more Happiness. It's a comfort to know that if you can't get away with anything here, nobody else will either. [ICON_BULLET]Crime is significantly reduced in your cities. Unique Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your Law Enforcement units all gain the Lawful Promotion, which enhances Crime Control and other benefits possessed by Law Enforcement units. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Battles inside your borders produce Great Military People faster due to the increased discipline required here. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are a touch more stable on the Revolution option. [ICON_BULLET]Buildings involving Crime Fighting are constructed faster. [ICON_BULLET]Spy, Investigator and Law Type Specialists gain a Commerce each. [ICON_BULLET]Merchant Type Specialists gain an additional Gold. [ICON_BULLET]Investigator Type Specialists gain an additional Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]Law Type Specialists gain an additional Research. [ICON_BULLET]Technologies that represent advancements in Law Enforcement methods are faster to discover. [ICON_BULLET]Your Law Enforcement units are trained with an additional few Experience Points. [ICON_BULLET]Your Law Enforcement units are trained significantly faster. [ICON_BULLET]Your nation suffers significantly less War Weariness since the public is less likely to offer resistance. [ICON_BULLET]Your largest cities are Happier since there is less fear of hidden threats in the crowd. [ICON_BULLET]Combat inside your borders produces significantly more Experience thanks to heightened discipline within your lands. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are built to control everything, so are significantly easier to defend. [ICON_BULLET]It is significantly harder to perform Espionage Missions against your cities thanks to a high degree of authoritative monitoring. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are less Happy living under the rule of this total square who allows no naughty fun to be had. [ICON_BULLET]Generic Upkeep is significantly higher since budget is poured into Law Enforcement without restraint. [ICON_BULLET]Great People aren't born as frequently here because people are heavily conditioned to stay within the lines. [ICON_BULLET]All cities are penalized a base Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Distance to Capital is significantly higher. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Number of Cities is significantly higher. [ICON_BULLET]Corporations are significantly more expensive to maintain due to stiff regulations. [ICON_BULLET]Access to Cannabis, Opium, Peyote, LSD, Meth or Ecstasy creates an Unhappiness each as it really freaks people out to be exposed to the Great personal risk involved in being associated with these substances.

TEXT.English: No society is fit to function until all of its people can learn to follow the laws as established. Enforcing them is of the utmost importance.
TEXT.French: Aucune société n'est apte à fonctionner tant que tous ses habitants ne peuvent pas apprendre à suivre les lois établies. Leur application est de la plus haute importance.

TEXT.English: Lazy CT
TEXT.Polish: Leniwy CT

TEXT.English: Lazy I
TEXT.Polish: Leniwy I

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "Relax and enjoy life before its all gone! Too much work is just a big buzz kill." If you believe you can be successful with a lot less overall production, you may find this to be a softly penalizing negative trait, particularly if you aren't going to rely on Engineers, Citizens, and Slave Specialist assignments much. Other traits may well be able to compensate the reduced core production while you benefit from some stronger Health and Happiness and hardly having any concerns with Pollution. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]One less Production is generated by any plot that generates as much as 7 or more. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer one less base Production. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer a percentage penalty to Production. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Production focused Improvements generate less Production. [ICON_BULLET]Production focused Improvements upgrade far slower than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Production focused Improvements are much slower for your to build. [ICON_BULLET]Engineer, Citizen, and Slave type Specialists generate less Production. [ICON_BULLET]Techs that bring Improvements to industry are slower to Research. [ICON_BULLET]Your are slower at building Improvements overall. [ICON_BULLET]Great Engineers are less likely to be born. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]More Health in each city since there are less injuries with a lighter workload. [ICON_BULLET]Engineer, Citizen, and Slave type Specialists generate one more Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Suffers somewhat less Air Pollution. [ICON_BULLET]Suffers somewhat less Water Pollution.

TEXT.English: Lazy II
TEXT.Polish: Leniwy II

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "Relax and enjoy life before its all gone! Too much work is just a big buzz kill." If you believe you can be successful with a lot less overall production, you may find this to be a softly penalizing negative trait, particularly if you aren't going to rely on Engineers, Citizens, and Slave Specialist assignments much. Other traits may well be able to compensate the reduced core production while you benefit from some stronger Health and Happiness and hardly having any concerns with Pollution. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]The threshold for a plot generating one less production drops from 7 to 6. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer less base Production. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer a percentage penalty to Production. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Production focused Improvements generate less Production. [ICON_BULLET]Production focused Improvements upgrade far slower than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Production focused Improvements are much slower for your to build. [ICON_BULLET]Engineer, Citizen, and Slave type Specialists generate less Production. [ICON_BULLET]Techs that bring Improvements to industry are slower to Research. [ICON_BULLET]Your are slower at building Improvements overall. [ICON_BULLET]Great Engineers are significantly less likely to be born. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]More Happiness since people spend more time in play than laboring. [ICON_BULLET]Engineer, Citizen, and Slave type Specialists generate one more Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Suffers a bit less Air Pollution. [ICON_BULLET]Suffers a bit less Water Pollution.

Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]The threshold for a plot generating one less production drops from 7 to 6. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer less base Production. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer a percentage penalty to Production. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Production focused Improvements generate less Production. [ICON_BULLET]Production focused Improvements upgrade far slower than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Production focused Improvements are much slower for your to build. [ICON_BULLET]Engineer, Citizen, and Slave type Specialists generate less Production. [ICON_BULLET]Techs that bring Improvements to industry are slower to Research. [ICON_BULLET]Your are slower at building Improvements overall. [ICON_BULLET]Great Engineers are significantly less likely to be born. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]More Happiness since people spend more time in play than laboring. [ICON_BULLET]Engineer, Citizen, and Slave type Specialists generate one more Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Suffers a bit less Air Pollution. [ICON_BULLET]Suffers a bit less Water Pollution.

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "Relax and enjoy life before its all gone! Too much work is just a big buzz kill." If you believe you can be successful with a lot less overall production, you may find this to be a softly penalizing negative trait, particularly if you aren't going to rely on Engineers, Citizens, and Slave Specialist assignments much. Other traits may well be able to compensate the reduced core production while you benefit from some stronger Health and Happiness and hardly having any concerns with Pollution. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]The threshold for a plot generating one less production drops from 6 to 5. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer much less base Production. [ICON_BULLET]Techs that bring Improvements to industry are slower to Research. [ICON_BULLET]Your are slower at building Improvements overall. [ICON_BULLET]Great Engineers are much less likely to be born. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]More Health in each city since there are less injuries with a lighter workload. [ICON_BULLET]More Happiness since people spend more time in play than laboring. [ICON_BULLET]Engineer, Citizen, and Slave type Specialists generate one more Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Suffers somewhat less Air Pollution. [ICON_BULLET]Suffers somewhat less Water Pollution.

TEXT.English: Liar CT
TEXT.Polish: K³amca CT

TEXT.English: Liar I
TEXT.Polish: K³amca I

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "What they don't know won't hurt you." Your Leader really doesn't care if people trust him or not. If he has something to hide, he'll do his best to hide it. Unfortunately, he's not all that good at it and frequently gets caught lying and bragging and making up alternative facts. Other nations don't trust him, nor do they trust your people, and it costs you in Trade and diplomacy. When things are going well, it's often more that your Leader is playing a political maneuver to make people THINK things are prosperous, and as a result, when things SHOULD be Great, they are a little lackluster under the surface. People are often misinformed and undereducated here, but at least all that confusion makes it harder for your opponents to get any reliable intel from your people. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your people are significantly more difficult to Educate. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages are significantly less profitable for all Yields. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages are significantly less profitable for all Commerces. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all more Unhappy, frustrated with frequently finding out they believed in a falsehood. [ICON_BULLET]Civic Anarchy periods are increased. [ICON_BULLET]All of your cities lose a Trade Route. Merchants resent the underhanded dealing they encounter here. [ICON_BULLET]You gain a Diplomatic penalty since other Leaders can see your Leader speaks from both sides of his mouth. [ICON_BULLET]Foreign Trade Routes are less profitable since your people's scams reduce the willingness of foreign merchants to engage in fair dealings with them. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are significantly harder to perform Espionage Missions in. [ICON_BULLET]The length of Golden Ages is significantly increased since your Leaders lofty claims keeps people thinking the nation is prospering even when it isn't. [ICON_BULLET]Your people take significantly less time to forgive being whipped to rush construction and training projects. They are used to being deeply disappointed in their Leader. [ICON_BULLET]Non-State Religions are significantly easier to spread.

TEXT.English: Liar III
TEXT.Polish: K³amca III

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "What they don't know won't hurt you." Your Leader really doesn't care if people trust him or not. If he has something to hide, he'll do his best to hide it. Unfortunately, he's not all that good at it and frequently gets caught lying and bragging and making up alternative facts. Other nations don't trust him, nor do they trust your people, and it costs you in Trade and diplomacy. When things are going well, it's often more that your Leader is playing a political maneuver to make people THINK things are prosperous, and as a result, when things SHOULD be Great, they are a little lackluster under the surface. People are often misinformed and undereducated here, but at least all that confusion makes it harder for your opponents to get any reliable intel from your people. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your people are significantly more difficult to Educate. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages are significantly less profitable for all Yields. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages are significantly less profitable for all Commerces. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all more Unhappy, frustrated with frequently finding out they believed in a falsehood. [ICON_BULLET]Civic Anarchy periods are significantly increased. [ICON_BULLET]You lose a Free Specialist in all cities. Your people are often confused and making efficiency costly mistakes in an environment of misinformation. [ICON_BULLET]All of your cities lose a Trade Route. Merchants resent the underhanded dealing they encounter here. [ICON_BULLET]You gain a Diplomatic penalty since other Leaders can see your Leader speaks from both sides of his mouth. [ICON_BULLET]Foreign Trade Routes are significantly less profitable since your people's scams reduce the willingness of foreign merchants to engage in fair dealings with them. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]All Specialists provide an additional Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are significantly harder to perform Espionage Missions in. [ICON_BULLET]The length of Golden Ages is significantly increased since your Leaders lofty claims keeps people thinking the nation is prospering even when it isn't. [ICON_BULLET]All Religions are easier to spread, somewhat moreso if they are a Non-State Religions.

Unfortunately, he's not all that good at it and frequently gets caught lying and bragging and making up alternative facts. Other nations don't trust him, nor do they trust your people, and it costs you in Trade and diplomacy. When things are going well, it's often more that your Leader is playing a political maneuver to make people THINK things are prosperous, and as a result, when things SHOULD be Great, they are a little lackluster under the surface. People are often misinformed and undereducated here, but at least all that confusion makes it harder for your opponents to get any reliable intel from your people. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your people are significantly more difficult to Educate. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages are significantly less profitable for all Yields. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages are much less profitable for all Commerces. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all more Unhappy, frustrated with frequently finding out they believed in a falsehood. [ICON_BULLET]Civic Anarchy periods are increased significantly. [ICON_BULLET]You lose a Free Specialist in all cities. Your people are often confused and making efficiency costly mistakes in an environment of misinformation. [ICON_BULLET]All of your cities lose a Trade Route. Merchants resent the underhanded dealing they encounter here. [ICON_BULLET]You gain a Diplomatic penalty since other Leaders can see your Leader speaks from both sides of his mouth. [ICON_BULLET]The length of Golden Ages is significantly increased since your Leaders lofty claims keeps people thinking the nation is prospering even when it isn't. TEXT.English: Gets some Espionage benefits but is not trusted. Education penalized, which can be a benefit to a Leader who doesn't want people understanding what they are up to.
TEXT.French: Obtient des avantages d'espionnage mais n'est pas fiable. L'éducation est pénalisée, ce qui peut être un avantage pour un Leader qui ne veut pas que les gens comprennent ce qu'ils font.

TEXT.Polish: Otrzymuje pewne korzyœci szpiegowskie, ale nie mo¿na mu ufaæ. Edukacja karana, co mo¿e byæ zalet¹ dla lidera, który nie chce, aby ludzie rozumieli, co robi¹.

TEXT.English: Medical CT
TEXT.Polish: Medyczny CT

TEXT.English: Medical I
TEXT.Polish: Medyczny I

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "A sick society is doomed to fail. Diseases, not other nations, are humanity's greatest threat and the role of government is to protect the people from their greatest threats" Extremely good at combating Disease. Most people in this nation are as fascinated by medicine as the Leader is. Problem is, providing such excellent care and subsidizing medical Research is expensive for the nation. But people are a bit more productive, being sick less often, and its easier to find Healthy recruits for the military when you've been keeping them Healthy all their lives. The nation doesn't weary of war quite so quickly when they feel confident their loved ones will be well cared for if injured. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]You enter a Golden Age whenever a Great Doctor is born in your nation. [ICON_BULLET]Disease is significantly reduced in all cities. Unique Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your Healer units all gain the Medical I Promotion, which enhances Healing benefits a bit and reduces Disease locally by a lot. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all Healthier. [ICON_BULLET]Buildings that improve your capacity to combat Disease are faster to build. [ICON_BULLET]Doctor Type Specialists get an additional Food. [ICON_BULLET]Priest and Doctor Type Specialists get an additional Research. [ICON_BULLET]Technologies that open up medical knowledge are faster to discover. [ICON_BULLET]Your Healer units are trained with an additional Experience Point. [ICON_BULLET]Your Healer units are trained faster. [ICON_BULLET]Great Doctors are more likely to be born in your cities. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Generic Upkeep is higher since budget is poured into Medical care and Research without restraint. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Distance to Capital is higher. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Number of Cities is higher. [ICON_BULLET]Golden ages don't last as long since they are so frequent. [ICON_BULLET]Your people hang on far longer to the anger they feel when you whip to rush construction and training projects.

But people are a bit more productive, being sick less often, and its easier to find Healthy recruits for the military when you've been keeping them Healthy all their lives. The nation doesn't weary of war quite so quickly when they feel confident their loved ones will be well cared for if injured. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all significantly Healthier. [ICON_BULLET]Disease is significantly reduced in all cities. Unique Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your Healer units all gain the Medical II Promotion, which enhances Healing benefits a bit and reduces Disease locally by a lot. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Buildings that improve your capacity to combat Disease are faster to build. [ICON_BULLET]Doctor Type Specialists get an additional Production. [ICON_BULLET]Doctor Type Specialists get an additional Espionage and Gold. [ICON_BULLET]Technologies that open up medical knowledge are faster to discover. [ICON_BULLET]Your Healer units are trained with an additional few Experience Points. [ICON_BULLET]Your Healer units are trained significantly faster. [ICON_BULLET]Your nation suffers from significantly less War Weariness since by taking care of their Health, they have complete faith in their Leadership to keep them safe. [ICON_BULLET]Your Largest Cities are Happier since there is more focus on ensuring the people are Healthy where there is more population to benefit from these programs. [ICON_BULLET]Great Doctors are significantly more likely to be born in your cities. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Generic Upkeep is significantly higher since budget is poured into Medical care and Research without restraint. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Distance to Capital is higher. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Number of Cities is higher. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities lose one Trade Route due to being more selective about who they allow to enter with stronger Health regulations. [ICON_BULLET]Golden ages don't last as long since they are so frequent.

TEXT.English: Medical III
TEXT.Polish: Medyczny III

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "A sick society is doomed to fail. Diseases, not other nations, are humanity's greatest threat and the role of government is to protect the people from their greatest threats" Extremely good at combating Disease. Most people in this nation are as fascinated by medicine as the Leader is. Problem is, providing such excellent care and subsidizing medical Research is expensive for the nation. But people are a bit more productive, being sick less often, and its easier to find Healthy recruits for the military when you've been keeping them Healthy all their lives. The nation doesn't weary of war quite so quickly when they feel confident their loved ones will be well cared for if injured. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all significantly Healthier. [ICON_BULLET]Disease is significantly reduced in all cities. Unique Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your Healer units all gain the Medical III Promotion, which enhances Healing benefits a bit and reduces Disease locally by a lot. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Buildings that improve your capacity to combat Disease are faster to build. [ICON_BULLET]Doctor Type Specialists get an additional Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Doctor Type Specialists get an additional Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Scientist Type Specialists get an additional Research. [ICON_BULLET]Technologies that open up medical knowledge are faster to discover. [ICON_BULLET]Your Healer units are trained with an additional few Experience Points. [ICON_BULLET]Your Healer units are trained significantly faster. [ICON_BULLET]Your nation suffers from significantly less War Weariness since by taking care of their Health, they have complete faith in their Leadership to keep them safe. [ICON_BULLET]Your Largest Cities are much Happier since there is more focus on ensuring the people are Healthy where there is more population to benefit from these programs. [ICON_BULLET]Great Doctors are significantly much more likely to be born in your cities. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Generic Upkeep is significantly higher since budget is poured into Medical care and Research without restraint. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Distance to Capital is significantly higher. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Number of Cities is significantly higher. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities lose one Trade Route due to being more selective about who they allow to enter with stronger Health regulations. [ICON_BULLET]Golden ages don't last as long since they are so frequent.

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "A sick society is doomed to fail. Diseases, not other nations, are humanity's greatest threat and the role of government is to protect the people from their greatest threats" Extremely good at combating Disease. Most people in this nation are as fascinated by medicine as the Leader is. Problem is, providing such excellent care and subsidizing medical Research is expensive for the nation. But people are a bit more productive, being sick less often, and its easier to find Healthy recruits for the military when you've been keeping them Healthy all their lives. The nation doesn't weary of war quite so quickly when they feel confident their loved ones will be well cared for if injured. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Significantly more Health in all cities. [ICON_BULLET]You enter a Golden Age whenever a Great Doctor is born in your nation. [ICON_BULLET]Disease is significantly reduced in all cities. Unique Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your Healer units all gain the Medical Promotion, which enhances Healing benefits a bit and reduces Disease locally by a lot. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Buildings that improve your capacity to combat Disease are faster to build. [ICON_BULLET]Doctor Type Specialists get an additional Food, Commerce and Production. [ICON_BULLET]Scientist and Doctor Type Specialists get an additional Research. [ICON_BULLET]Technologies that open up medical knowledge are faster to discover. [ICON_BULLET]Your Healer units are trained with an additional few Experience Points. [ICON_BULLET]Your Healer units are trained significantly faster. [ICON_BULLET]Your Largest Cities are Happier since there is more focus on ensuring the people are Healthy where there is more population to benefit from these programs. [ICON_BULLET]Great Doctors are more likely to be born in your cities. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Generic Upkeep is significantly higher since budget is poured into Medical care and Research without restraint. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Distance to Capital is significantly higher. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Number of Cities is significantly higher. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities lose one Trade Route due to being more selective about who they allow to enter with stronger Health regulations. [ICON_BULLET]Golden ages don't last as long since they are so frequent. [ICON_BULLET]Your people hang on longer to the anger they feel when you whip to rush construction and training projects.

TEXT.English: Strong Disease Fighting and Health. A little expensive to maintain. Focused more on the clinical side of healing than overall caring for the people. Powerful healers and inspiring Doctors.
TEXT.French: Forte lutte contre les maladies et santé. Un peu cher à entretenir. Plus axé sur l'aspect clinique de la guérison que sur la prise en charge globale des personnes. Guérisseurs puissants et médecins inspirants.

TEXT.Polish: Silna walka z chorobami, oraz zdrowie. Trochê drogi w utrzymaniu. Skoncentrowany bardziej na klinicznej stronie leczenia ni¿ na ogólnej opiece nad ludŸmi. Potê¿ni uzdrowiciele i inspiruj¹cy lekarze.

TEXT.English: Meek CT
TEXT.Polish: £agodny CT

TEXT.English: Meek I
TEXT.Polish: £agodny I

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "It is absolutely immoral and dangerous to go invading other nations. Large nations are far too much work anyhow! Count me out of ever taking part in such an effort." Meek Leaders are better off planning to avoid having to invade. They are better off growing larger, fewer cities. It might be costly for them to maintain large empires but if they can peacefully outgrow their rivals and never have to take ground by force, they can overcome their weaknesses. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Applies the Meek I Promotion to all Combatant units. Strong city attack penalty and a reduction in the ability to aid stability in the city. [ICON_BULLET]Military units cost even more Gold to upkeep. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities construct Siege based and Siege supporting buildings slower. [ICON_BULLET]Techs that support and unlock Siege units are slower to Research. [ICON_BULLET]Siege units lose Experience when trained. [ICON_BULLET]Siege units are slower to train. [ICON_BULLET]Slight decrease to the maximum number of population you convert to units during a Conscription action in a city. [ICON_BULLET]Higher Maintenance costs from Distance to Capital. Planning to conquer so much territory, your people are more efficient at maintaining larger empires with larger areas. [ICON_BULLET]Higher Maintenance costs from Number of Cities. [ICON_BULLET]Lose an amount of Free Units based on a small percentage of the total population of your nation. [ICON_BULLET]Lose an amount of Free Military Units based on a small percentage of the total population of your nation. [ICON_BULLET]Enemies suffer less War Weariness since they do not fear losing their cities to your forces. [ICON_BULLET]Your units are slightly less likely to capture defeated enemy units since they lack a dominant mindset and often allow those retreating to escape. [ICON_BULLET]Your units are more likely to be captured when defeated because they will more readily submit to their foes. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Reduction in overall upkeep costs. [ICON_BULLET]Slightly enhanced rate of birthing Great People as autonomy, both personal and national, is respected here. [ICON_BULLET]Gain a diplomatic bonus since Leaders comfortably believe you won't invade them. [ICON_BULLET]Units are slightly cheaper to upgrade because city invasion training is not part of their curriculum. [ICON_BULLET]Crime is reduced since the people value the personal freedoms they have.

[ICON_BULLET]Your units are slightly less likely to capture defeated enemy units since they lack a dominant mindset and often allow those retreating to escape. [ICON_BULLET]Your units are more likely to be captured when defeated because they will more readily submit to their foes. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Reduction in overall upkeep costs. [ICON_BULLET]Slightly enhanced rate of birthing Great People as autonomy, both personal and national, is respected here. [ICON_BULLET]Gain a diplomatic bonus since Leaders comfortably believe you won't invade them. [ICON_BULLET]Units are slightly cheaper to upgrade because city invasion training is not part of their curriculum. [ICON_BULLET]Crime is reduced since the people value the personal freedoms they have.

TEXT.English: Meek II
TEXT.Polish: £agodny II

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "It is absolutely immoral and dangerous to go invading other nations. Large nations are far too much work anyhow! Count me out of ever taking part in such an effort." Meek Leaders are better off planning to avoid having to invade. They are better off growing larger, fewer cities. It might be costly for them to maintain large empires but if they can peacefully outgrow their rivals and never have to take ground by force, they can overcome their weaknesses. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Applies the Meek II Promotion to all Combatant units. Strong city attack penalty and a reduction in the ability to aid stability in the city. [ICON_BULLET]All Units cost more Gold to upkeep. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities construct Siege based and Siege supporting buildings slower. [ICON_BULLET]Techs that support and unlock Siege units are slower to Research. [ICON_BULLET]Siege units lose Experience when trained. [ICON_BULLET]Siege units are slower to train. [ICON_BULLET]Decrease to the maximum number of population you convert to units during a Conscription action in a city. [ICON_BULLET]Significantly higher Maintenance costs from Distance to Capital. Planning to conquer so much territory, your people are more efficient at maintaining larger empires with larger areas. [ICON_BULLET]Significantly higher Maintenance costs from Number of Cities. [ICON_BULLET]Lose an amount of Free Units based on a small percentage of the total population of your nation. [ICON_BULLET]Lose an amount of Free Military Units based on a small percentage of the total population of your nation. [ICON_BULLET]Enemies suffer less War Weariness since they do not fear losing their cities to your forces. [ICON_BULLET]Your units are less likely to capture defeated enemy units since they lack a dominant mindset and often allow those retreating to escape. [ICON_BULLET]Your units are more likely to be captured when defeated because they will more readily submit to their foes. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Reduction in overall upkeep costs. [ICON_BULLET]Enhanced rate of birthing Great People as autonomy, both personal and national, is respected here. [ICON_BULLET]Gain a diplomatic bonus since Leaders comfortably believe you won't invade them. [ICON_BULLET]Units are cheaper to upgrade because city invasion training is not part of their curriculum. [ICON_BULLET]Crime is reduced since the people value the personal freedoms they have.

It might be costly for them to maintain large empires but if they can peacefully outgrow their rivals and never have to take ground by force, they can overcome their weaknesses. TEXT.English: Minimalist CT
TEXT.Polish: Minimalistyczny CT

TEXT.English: Minimalist I
TEXT.Polish: Minimalistyczny I

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "Large nations are impossible to manage. Better to have a small, compact one that can be kept under close wraps." It might be possible that with the Win for Losing game option on, this may actually be closer to a positive trait than a negative one, despite being primarily Negative in modifiers. This Leader would prefer to focus on managing a small nation well than trying much to build out that nation and expand it into an empire. It will take you a lot more effort to tame your lands. The people are slower to grow and expand and if you are too effective at it, you'll be saddled with huge expenses for doing so. However, you do benefit from people that are better at focusing on the problems they face and finding solutions to them, and on wondrous works. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer from a percentage penalty to Food and Production. [ICON_BULLET]Settlers are trained much slower than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Workers are trained much slower than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Improvements organically upgrade incredibly slower than usual, if at all. [ICON_BULLET]Workers are far slower at improving your territory. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolutions option, instability from the Distance to Capital is increased. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities all generate one less base Food and Production. [ICON_BULLET]Upkeep from Distance to Capital is moderately increased. [ICON_BULLET]Upkeep from Number of Cities is moderately increased. [ICON_BULLET]You get penalized an amount of Free Units derived from a small percentage of your overall Population. [ICON_BULLET]Your Largest Cities are less Happy since your citizens feel burdened in highly populated areas. [ICON_BULLET]Your Military Units are a little slower to be trained since your people are in no hurry. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]World Wonders are constructed faster than normal since these large projects represent highly focused local efforts. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all given an additional base Research. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities all benefit from a percentage modifier to Research. [ICON_BULLET]Scientist and Doctor type Specialists take their time in patient studies and thus add a Research each. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are a little more defensible because your cities are constructed with patient care.

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "Large nations are impossible to manage. Better to have a small, compact one that can be kept under close wraps." It might be possible that with the Win for Losing game option on, this may actually be closer to a positive trait than a negative one, despite being primarily Negative in modifiers. This Leader would prefer to focus on managing a small nation well than trying much to build out that nation and expand it into an empire. It will take you a lot more effort to tame your lands. The people are slower to grow and expand and if you are too effective at it, you'll be saddled with huge expenses for doing so. However, you do benefit from people that are better at focusing on the problems they face and finding solutions to them, and on wondrous works. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer from a percentage penalty to Food and Production. [ICON_BULLET]Settlers are trained much slower than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Workers are trained much slower than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Improvements organically upgrade incredibly slower than usual, if at all. [ICON_BULLET]Workers are far slower at improving your territory. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolutions option, instability from the Distance to Capital is increased. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities all generate one less base Food and Production. [ICON_BULLET]Upkeep from Distance to Capital is moderately increased. [ICON_BULLET]Upkeep from Number of Cities is moderately increased. [ICON_BULLET]You get penalized an amount of Free Units derived from a percentage of your overall Population. [ICON_BULLET]Your Largest Cities are significantly less Happy since your citizens feel burdened in highly populated areas. [ICON_BULLET]Your Military Units are slower to be trained since your people are in no hurry. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]World Wonders are constructed significantly faster than normal since these large projects represent highly focused local efforts. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all given an additional base Research. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities all benefit from a percentage modifier to Research. [ICON_BULLET]Priest and Noble type Specialists inspire patience as a virtue and invest into finding solutions and thus add a Research each. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are more defensible because your cities are constructed with patient care.

It might be possible that with the Win for Losing game option on, this may actually be closer to a positive trait than a negative one, despite being primarily Negative in modifiers. This Leader would prefer to focus on managing a small nation well than trying much to build out that nation and expand it into an empire. It will take you a lot more effort to tame your lands. The people are slower to grow and expand and if you are too effective at it, you'll be saddled with huge expenses for doing so. However, you do benefit from people that are better at focusing on the problems they face and finding solutions to them, and on wondrous works. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer from a percentage penalty to Food and Production. [ICON_BULLET]Settlers are trained much slower than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Workers are trained much slower than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Improvements organically upgrade incredibly slower than usual, if at all. [ICON_BULLET]Workers are far slower at improving your territory. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolutions option, instability from the Distance to Capital is increased. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities all generate one less base Food and Production. [ICON_BULLET]Upkeep from Distance to Capital is moderately increased. [ICON_BULLET]Law and Celebrity type Specialists favor policies of patient development and inspire people to create new ways to overcome problems and thus add a Research each. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are significantly more defensible because your cities are constructed with patient care.

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "Large nations are impossible to manage. Better to have a small, compact one that can be kept under close wraps." It might be possible that with the Win for Losing game option on, this may actually be closer to a positive trait than a negative one, despite being primarily Negative in modifiers. This Leader would prefer to focus on managing a small nation well than trying much to build out that nation and expand it into an empire. It will take you a lot more effort to tame your lands. The people are slower to grow and expand and if you are too effective at it, you'll be saddled with huge expenses for doing so. However, you do benefit from people that are better at focusing on the problems they face and finding solutions to them, and on wondrous works. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer from a percentage penalty to Food and Production. [ICON_BULLET]Settlers are trained far slower than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Workers are trained much slower than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Improvements organically upgrade astronomically slower than usual, if at all. [ICON_BULLET]Workers are incredibly slower at improving your territory. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolutions option, instability from the Distance to Capital is increased. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities all generate one less base Food and Production. [ICON_BULLET]Upkeep from Distance to Capital is greatly increased. [ICON_BULLET]Upkeep from Number of Cities is greatly increased. [ICON_BULLET]You get penalized an amount of Free Units derived from a small percentage of your overall Population. [ICON_BULLET]Your Largest Cities are less Happy since your citizens feel burdened in highly populated areas. [ICON_BULLET]Your Military Units are slower to be trained since your people are in no hurry. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]World Wonders are constructed significantly faster than normal since these large projects represent highly focused local efforts. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all given an additional few base Research. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities all benefit from a percentage modifier to Research. [ICON_BULLET]Celebrity and Noble type Specialists invest into and promote study projects and thus add a Research each. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are a little more defensible because your cities are constructed with patient care.

TEXT.English: Naive CT
TEXT.Polish: Naiwny CT

TEXT.English: Naive I
TEXT.Polish: Naiwny I

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "Surely people, even world Leaders, can be trusted. I don't understand all this paranoia from all my advisors!" While you are a clever Leader who often misdirects his foes into strategic traps, and your spies are top notch, your people don't appreciate being lied to and being subject to intrusive investigations. Other nations are particularly suspicious of you and your people. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]All cities produce a few less Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer a percentage penalty to Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]All Specialists are penalized an Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]Your Spy units are assigned the Naive I Promotion, making them easier to catch and giving them reduced chances of escape. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Buildings that are focused on Investigations and Security are slower to build. [ICON_BULLET]Spy and Investigator type Specialists cost a Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Citizen and Slave type Specialists are penalized an Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]Your Capital produces a small percentage less Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]Technologies that lead to Investigation and Security Improvements are slower to discover. [ICON_BULLET]Espionage units are trained with a few less Experience Points. [ICON_BULLET]Espionage units are trained slower. [ICON_BULLET]Espionage missions are easier to perform against your nation. [ICON_BULLET]Great Spies are less likely to be born. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are Happier since they enjoy more privacy. [ICON_BULLET]Your people suffer less War Weariness since they trust the accounts of war that they receive from the government. [ICON_BULLET]Civic Anarchy times are a little shorter since the people accept explanations of the need for change faster. [ICON_BULLET]You gain a diplomacy bonus since Leaders can rely on your word. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer a bit less Crime since the people tend to follow your example of honest behavior.

[ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer a percentage penalty to Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]All Specialists are penalized an Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]Your Spy units are assigned the Naive III Promotion, making them easier to catch and giving them reduced chances of escape and one less movement. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Buildings that are focused on Investigations and Security are slower to build. [ICON_BULLET]Spy type Specialists cost a Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Investigator type Specialists generate a few less Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]Your Capital produces a small percentage less Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]Technologies that lead to Investigation and Security Improvements are slower to discover. [ICON_BULLET]Espionage units are trained with a few less Experience Points. [ICON_BULLET]Espionage units are trained slower. [ICON_BULLET]Espionage missions are easier to perform against your nation. [ICON_BULLET]Great Spies are much less likely to be born. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are Happier since they enjoy more privacy. [ICON_BULLET]Your people suffer less War Weariness since they trust the accounts of war that they receive from the government. [ICON_BULLET]Civic Anarchy times are a little shorter since the people accept explanations of the need for change faster. [ICON_BULLET]You gain a diplomacy bonus since Leaders can rely on your word. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer a bit less Crime since the people tend to follow your example of honest behavior. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are easier to Educate since the truth is delivered in a straightforward manner.

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "Surely people, even world Leaders, can be trusted. I don't understand all this paranoia from all my advisors!" While you are a clever Leader who often misdirects his foes into strategic traps, and your spies are top notch, your people don't appreciate being lied to and being subject to intrusive investigations. Other nations are particularly suspicious of you and your people. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]All cities produce a few less Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer a significant percentage penalty to Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]All Specialists are penalized an Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]Your Spy units are assigned the Naive Promotion, making them easier to catch and giving them reduced chances of escape. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Buildings that are focused on Investigations and Security are slower to build. [ICON_BULLET]Spy and Investigator type Specialists cost a Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Spy and Investigator type Specialists generate a few less Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]Citizen and Slave type Specialists are penalized an Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]Your Capital produces a small percentage less Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]Technologies that lead to Investigation and Security Improvements are slower to discover. [ICON_BULLET]Espionage units are trained with a few less Experience Points. [ICON_BULLET]Espionage units are trained slower. [ICON_BULLET]Espionage missions are easier to perform against your nation. [ICON_BULLET]Great Spies are less likely to be born. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are Happier since they enjoy more privacy. [ICON_BULLET]Your people suffer less War Weariness since they trust the accounts of war that they receive from the government. [ICON_BULLET]Civic Anarchy times are a little shorter since the people accept explanations of the need for change faster. [ICON_BULLET]You gain a diplomacy bonus since Leaders can rely on your word. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer a bit less Crime since the people tend to follow your example of honest behavior. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are easier to Educate since the truth is delivered in a straightforward manner.

TEXT.English: Naturalist CT
TEXT.Polish: Przyrodnik CT

TEXT.English: Naturalist I
TEXT.Polish: Przyrodnik I

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "Walk gently upon Mother Earth for our Health is hers. I will not tolerate a messy society that disposes of its wastes haphazardly. We have enough to worry about without poisoning ourselves in the process of achieving our goals." Although the benefits from this trait may not be as strong for your nation in the immediate beginning of the game, being able to hit the mid-game developments without having Pollution going out of control would be quite a benefit. Pollution is normally very difficult, if not impossible, to fully manage throughout certain eras, and perhaps no property can create as crippling an impact as Pollution. Besides, respect for your environment pays off with Happier and Healthier people all throughout the game. You may see a little reduced Production but you can make up for it with creative solutions and your people know how to nurture the land so can produce a lot more Food. Your people don't produce as many things for sale since they try not to take so much from the land, so Commerce is impacted some. But if you can make this trait work for you, you should feel good about yourself and your nation, for while many real cultures have attempted to possess this outlook, unfortunately many proved to lack the aggression necessary to survive the test of time. Yet today, we turn to their ways and wish greatly that we had been adopting them ourselves all along. And perhaps we will really lament not adopting these views much earlier. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities benefit from less Air Pollution. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities benefit from less Water Pollution. Unique Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]All your units gain the Naturalist I Promotion, which makes all your units perform cleanup tasks in their downtime, therefore causing them to reduce both Water and Air Pollution a little each. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all Healthier. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all Happier. [ICON_BULLET]Improvements that represent green power and revitalizing the land are built faster. [ICON_BULLET]Artist Type Specialists gain an additional Production. [ICON_BULLET]Priest Type Specialists gain an additional Research. [ICON_BULLET]Celebrity and Artist Type Specialists gain an additional Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Your are more effective at working with the land rather than against it and thus complete their builds significantly faster. [ICON_BULLET]Your Largest cities are Happier since community cleanup efforts are stronger where there are more citizens there to chip in and usually big cities are festering in garbage - not here! Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Generic Upkeep is higher since being responsible with industry is expensive. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer from one less base Production. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer a small percentage penalty to Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Number of Cities is higher since patrols do regular garbage collections. [ICON_BULLET]Corporations are more expensive to operate under stiff emissions and waste regulations. [ICON_BULLET]The expense of rushing constructions and training is higher when your industries refuse to cut corners on cleanup. [ICON_BULLET]Access to Whales, Fur, and Lead all generate an Unhappiness each since they all arouse the ire of your citizens.

But if you can make this trait work for you, you should feel good about yourself and your nation, for while many real cultures have attempted to possess this outlook, unfortunately many proved to lack the aggression necessary to survive the test of time. Yet today, we turn to their ways and wish greatly that we had been adopting them ourselves all along. And perhaps we will really lament not adopting these views much earlier. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]All Specialists produce an extra Food. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities benefit from less Air Pollution. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities benefit from less Water Pollution. Unique Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]All your units gain the Naturalist II Promotion, which makes all your units perform cleanup tasks in their downtime, therefore causing them to reduce both Water and Air Pollution a little each. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all Healthier. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all Happier. [ICON_BULLET]Improvements that represent forest planting naturally upgrade far faster. [ICON_BULLET]Improvements that represent green power and revitalizing the land are built faster. [ICON_BULLET]Your are more effective at working with the land rather than against it and thus complete their builds significantly faster. [ICON_BULLET]Your Largest cities are Happier since community cleanup efforts are stronger where there are more citizens there to chip in and usually big cities are festering in garbage - not here! Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Generic Upkeep is higher since being responsible with industry is expensive. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer from a few less base Production. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer a small percentage penalty to Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Number of Cities is higher since patrols do regular garbage collections. [ICON_BULLET]Corporations are more expensive to operate under stiff emissions and waste regulations. [ICON_BULLET]The expense of rushing constructions and training is moderately higher when your industries refuse to cut corners on cleanup.

TEXT.English: Naturalist III
TEXT.Polish: Przyrodnik III

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "Walk gently upon Mother Earth for our Health is hers. I will not tolerate a messy society that disposes of its wastes haphazardly. We have enough to worry about without poisoning ourselves in the process of achieving our goals." Although the benefits from this trait may not be as strong for your nation in the immediate beginning of the game, being able to hit the mid-game developments without having Pollution going out of control would be quite a benefit. Pollution is normally very difficult, if not impossible, to fully manage throughout certain eras, and perhaps no property can create as crippling an impact as Pollution. Besides, respect for your environment pays off with Happier and Healthier people all throughout the game. You may see a little reduced Production but you can make up for it with creative solutions and your people know how to nurture the land so can produce a lot more Food. Your people don't produce as many things for sale since they try not to take so much from the land, so Commerce is impacted some. But if you can make this trait work for you, you should feel good about yourself and your nation, for while many real cultures have attempted to possess this outlook, unfortunately many proved to lack the aggression necessary to survive the test of time. Yet today, we turn to their ways and wish greatly that we had been adopting them ourselves all along. And perhaps we will really lament not adopting these views much earlier. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]All Specialists produce an extra Food. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities benefit from significantly less Air Pollution. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities benefit from significantly less Water Pollution. Unique Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]All your units gain the Naturalist III Promotion, which makes all your units perform cleanup tasks in their downtime, therefore causing them to reduce both Water and Air Pollution a little each. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all Healthier. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all Happier. [ICON_BULLET]Improvements that represent forest planting naturally upgrade far faster. [ICON_BULLET]Improvements that represent green power and revitalizing the land are built faster. [ICON_BULLET]Your are more effective at working with the land rather than against it and thus complete their builds significantly faster. [ICON_BULLET]Your Largest cities are Happier since community cleanup efforts are stronger where there are more citizens there to chip in and usually big cities are festering in garbage - not here! Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Generic Upkeep is higher since being responsible with industry is expensive. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer a percentage penalty to Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Number of Cities is higher since patrols do regular garbage collections. [ICON_BULLET]Corporations are more expensive to operate under stiff emissions and waste regulations. [ICON_BULLET]The expense of rushing constructions and training is significantly higher when your industries refuse to cut corners on cleanup.

TEXT.English: Very good at combating Pollution. People are Happy living in cleanliness.
TEXT.French: Très bon pour lutter contre la Pollution. Les gens sont heureux de vivre dans la propreté.

TEXT.English: Negligent CT
TEXT.Polish: Niedba³y CT

TEXT.English: Negligent I
TEXT.Polish: Niedba³y I

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "I really doubt anyone will ever wish to take MY cities. If they do I'll just take them back. Why build fortifications? Isn't that just going to make recapturing my cities even harder?" If you don't like worrying too much about holding your cities and would prefer to just protect them to a minimum and retaliate later if your opponents start capturing them, this is the Negative Trait of choice for you. Your people lack for caution but this leads to frazzled nerves for some. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Applies the Negligent I Promotion to all Combatant units. Strong city defense penalty and an additional side penalty. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer a penalty to base defensive modifier due to complex strategic preparations always established and in place. [ICON_BULLET]Defenses in your cities are easier to diminish with bombardments. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Penalty to Happiness in every city. Some just cannot handle the flippant state attitude about defense. [ICON_BULLET]Significant penalty to earning Great Military People when combat takes place inside your borders. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities construct Defensive buildings slower. [ICON_BULLET]Techs that form prerequisites for Defensive buildings are slower to discover. [ICON_BULLET]Decrease to the maximum number of population you convert to units during a Conscription action in a city. [ICON_BULLET]Lose an amount of Free Military Units based on the total population of your nation. [ICON_BULLET]Your units gain significantly less Experience when the battle takes place within your borders. [ICON_BULLET]It is easier for your opponents to perform Espionage missions against you. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages are somewhat more beneficial in terms of yields. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages are a little more beneficial in terms of commerces. [ICON_BULLET]Decrease in the amount of War Weariness you suffer. Most people are prepared for dealing with living under a new flag for a while but trust responses will be forthcoming. [ICON_BULLET]Lower Maintenance costs from Distance to Capital. Much of the upkeep costs for this were based on establishing defensive routes and plans and trained responses, all dismissed under this leadership. [ICON_BULLET]Lower Maintenance costs from Number of Cities. So much easier to get around the costs of defensive planning for lots of cities when you just don't bother with those plans. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages are longer. You and your people live as carefree as possible and take revelry farther than some societies would.

Korzyœci: [ICON_BULLET]Z³ote Wieki s¹ nieco bardziej korzystne pod wzglêdem plonów. [ICON_BULLET]Z³ote Wieki s¹ nieco bardziej korzystne pod wzglêdem bogactwa. [ICON_BULLET]Zmniejszenie iloœci odczuwanego przez Ciebie Zmêczenia Wojennego. Wiêkszoœæ ludzi jest przygotowana na radzenie sobie przez jakiœ czas pod now¹ flag¹, ale wkrótce pojawi¹ siê reakcje zaufania. [ICON_BULLET]Ni¿sze koszty utrzymania dziêki odleg³oœci do stolicy. Du¿a czêœæ kosztów utrzymania opiera³a siê na ustanowieniu tras i planów obronnych oraz wyszkolonych si³ach szybkiego reagowania, a wszyscy zostali zwolnieni pod tym przywództwem. [ICON_BULLET]Ni¿sze koszty utrzymania w porównaniu z liczb¹ miast. O wiele ³atwiej jest obejœæ koszty planowania obronnego wielu miast, jeœli po prostu nie zawraca siê sobie g³owy tymi planami. [ICON_BULLET]Z³ote Wieki s¹ d³u¿sze. Ty i twoi ludzie ¿yjecie tak beztrosko, jak to mo¿liwe i bawicie siê d³u¿ej ni¿ niektóre spo³eczeñstwa.

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "I really doubt anyone will ever wish to take MY cities. If they do I'll just take them back. Why build fortifications? Isn't that just going to make recapturing my cities even harder?" If you don't like worrying too much about holding your cities and would prefer to just protect them to a minimum and retaliate later if your opponents start capturing them, this is the Negative Trait of choice for you. Your people lack for caution but this leads to frazzled nerves for some. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Applies the Negligent Promotion to all Combatant units. Strong city defense penalty and loses a first strike if the unit already had one. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer a large penalty to base defensive modifier due to complex strategic preparations always established and in place. [ICON_BULLET]Defenses in your cities are easier to diminish with bombardments. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Strong penalty to earning Great Military People when combat takes place inside your borders. [ICON_BULLET]Penalty to Happiness in every city. Some just cannot handle the flippant state attitude about defense. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities construct Defensive buildings slower. [ICON_BULLET]Techs that form prerequisites for Defensive buildings are slower to discover. [ICON_BULLET]Decrease to the maximum number of population you convert to units during a Conscription action in a city. [ICON_BULLET]Lose an amount of Free Military Units based on the total population of your nation. [ICON_BULLET]Your units gain significantly less Experience when the battle takes place within your borders. [ICON_BULLET]It is easier for your opponents to perform Espionage missions against you. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages are more beneficial in terms of yields. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages are more beneficial in terms of commerces. [ICON_BULLET]Decrease in the amount of War Weariness you suffer. Most people are prepared for dealing with living under a new flag for a while but trust responses will be forthcoming. [ICON_BULLET]Much lower Maintenance costs from Distance to Capital. Much of the upkeep costs for this were based on establishing defensive routes and plans and trained responses, all dismissed under this leadership. [ICON_BULLET]Far lower Maintenance costs from Number of Cities. So much easier to get around the costs of defensive planning for lots of cities when you just don't bother with those plans. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages are a quarter longer. You and your people live as carefree as possible and take revelry farther than some societies would.

TEXT.English: Ignores city defenses in favor of other goals.
TEXT.French: Ignore les défenses de la ville au profit d'autres objectifs.
TEXT.Russian: Èãíîðèðóåò îáîðîíó ãîðîäîâ â ïîëüçó äðóãèõ öåëåé.
TEXT.Polish: Ignoruje obronê miasta na rzecz innych celów.

TEXT.English: Negotiator CT
TEXT.Polish: Negocjator CT

TEXT.English: Negotiator I
TEXT.Polish: Negocjator I

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "Through Trade and negotiation comes the leverage for world dominance." This Leader knows how to win friends and influence people and the public learns by his example. This makes Trade and tourism your forte, as well as diplomacy and politics. War really isn't your 'thing' much since you usually find more cooperative ways to address matters rather than direct conflict. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]All Trade Routes are significantly more productive with yields generated. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities may maintain an additional Trade Route than the normal limit. [ICON_BULLET]All Foreign Trade Routes are even more productive with yields generated. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Merchant Type Specialists generate an additional Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Trade Units are trained with a bonus Experience Point. [ICON_BULLET]Trade Units are trained faster. [ICON_BULLET]Civic changes cause slightly fewer rounds of Anarchy. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Distance to Capital is reduced since your people are fast and effective at shipping and Trade. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from the Number of Cities is reduced since you are able to use your diplomatic talents to keep other cities more self-sustaining with less funding from the national coffers. [ICON_BULLET]All your cities gain an additional Trade Route. [ICON_BULLET]You gain a Diplomatic bonus with other Leaders. They like working with someone who quickly finds strong cooperative solutions. [ICON_BULLET]Gains additional Tourism in all your cities. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Great Generals are a little slower to emerge since the military is not a heavily relied on bargaining point. [ICON_BULLET]War Weariness accumulates faster since war interrupts Trade Routes. [ICON_BULLET]One less citizen may be drafted during a conscription action. [ICON_BULLET]Cities are less defensible since they are built more for effective routing of travel than for defense. [ICON_BULLET]Military units are trained slower. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are easier to perform Espionage Missions in for your enemies. Your people are a talkative bunch.

TEXT.English: Negotiator II
TEXT.Polish: Negocjator II

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "Through Trade and negotiation comes the leverage for world dominance." This Leader knows how to win friends and influence people and the public learns by his example. This makes Trade and tourism your forte, as well as diplomacy and politics. War really isn't your 'thing' much since you usually find more cooperative ways to address matters rather than direct conflict. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]All Trade Routes are significantly more productive with yields generated. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities may maintain a few additional Trade Routes than the normal limit. [ICON_BULLET]All Foreign Trade Routes are even more productive with yields generated. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Merchant Type Specialists generate an additional Food. [ICON_BULLET]Trade Units are trained with a bonus Experience Point. [ICON_BULLET]Trade Units are trained faster. [ICON_BULLET]Civic changes cause slightly fewer rounds of Anarchy. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Distance to Capital is reduced since your people are fast and effective at shipping and Trade. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from the Number of Cities is reduced since you are able to use your diplomatic talents to keep other cities more self-sustaining with less funding from the national coffers. [ICON_BULLET]Corporation Maintenance is reduced since your people are very skilled merchants and advertisers who can maximize profits by driving more sales and finding where they're services are most needed. [ICON_BULLET]All your cities gain an additional Trade Route. [ICON_BULLET]You gain a Diplomatic bonus with other Leaders. They like working with someone who quickly finds strong cooperative solutions. [ICON_BULLET]Gains additional Tourism in all your cities. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Great Generals are a little slower to emerge since the military is not a heavily relied on bargaining point. [ICON_BULLET]War Weariness accumulates faster since war interrupts Trade Routes. [ICON_BULLET]One less citizen may be drafted during a conscription action. [ICON_BULLET]Cities are less defensible since they are built more for effective routing of travel than for defense. [ICON_BULLET]Military units are trained slower. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are easier to perform Espionage Missions in for your enemies. Your people are a talkative bunch.

They like working with someone who quickly finds strong cooperative solutions. [ICON_BULLET]Gains additional Tourism in all your cities. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Great Generals are a little slower to emerge since the military is not a heavily relied on bargaining point. [ICON_BULLET]War Weariness accumulates faster since war interrupts Trade Routes. [ICON_BULLET]One less citizen may be drafted during a conscription action. [ICON_BULLET]Cities are less defensible since they are built more for effective routing of travel than for defense. [ICON_BULLET]Military units are trained slower. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are significantly easier to perform Espionage Missions in for your enemies. Your people are a talkative bunch.

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "Through Trade and negotiation comes the leverage for world dominance." This Leader knows how to win friends and influence people and the public learns by his example. This makes Trade and tourism your forte, as well as diplomacy and politics. War really isn't your 'thing' much since you usually find more cooperative ways to address matters rather than direct conflict. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]All Trade Routes are significantly more productive with yields generated. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities may maintain 2 more Trade Routes than the normal limit. [ICON_BULLET]All Foreign Trade Routes are even more productive with yields generated. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Merchant Type Specialists generate an additional Production, Food, and Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Trade Units are trained with a bonus Experience Point. [ICON_BULLET]Trade Units are trained faster. [ICON_BULLET]Civic changes cause fewer rounds of Anarchy. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Distance to Capital is reduced since your people are fast and effective at shipping and Trade. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from the Number of Cities is reduced since you are able to use your diplomatic talents to keep other cities more self-sustaining with less funding from the national coffers. [ICON_BULLET]Corporation Maintenance is reduced since your people are very skilled merchants and advertisers who can maximize profits by driving more sales and finding where they're services are most needed. [ICON_BULLET]All your cities gain an additional Trade Route. [ICON_BULLET]You gain a Diplomatic bonus with other Leaders. They like working with someone who quickly finds strong cooperative solutions. [ICON_BULLET]Gains additional Tourism in all your cities. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Great Generals are slower to emerge since the military is not a heavily relied on bargaining point. [ICON_BULLET]War Weariness accumulates faster since war interrupts Trade Routes. [ICON_BULLET]Fewer citizens may be drafted during a conscription action. [ICON_BULLET]Cities are less defensible since they are built more for effective routing of travel than for defense. [ICON_BULLET]Military units are trained significantly slower. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are easier to perform Espionage Missions in for your enemies. Your people are a talkative bunch.

TEXT.English: Strong Trade benefits. A little lax on warfare, an impediment to Trade. Reductions in Anarchy time and upkeep. Diplomatic benefit. Espionage defense reduced as enhanced Trade efforts opens up potential for infiltration. Tourism grows as you appear friendly to visitors.
TEXT.French: Avantages commerciaux importants. Un peu relâché sur la guerre, un obstacle au Commerce. Réduction du temps d'anarchie et de l'entretien. Avantage diplomatique. La défense contre l'espionnage a été réduite à mesure que l'intensification des efforts commerciaux ouvre un potentiel d'infiltration. Le tourisme se développe à mesure que vous paraissez sympathique aux visiteurs.

Obrona przed szpiegostwem zosta³a zmniejszona, poniewa¿ wzmo¿one wysi³ki handlowe otwieraj¹ potencja³ infiltracji. Turystyka rozwija siê, gdy wydajesz siê przyjazny dla goœci.

TEXT.English: Pacifist CT
TEXT.Polish: Pacyfistyczny CT

TEXT.English: Pacifist I
TEXT.Polish: Pacyfistyczny I

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "War? What's it good for? Absolutely nothing!" This Leader resents conflict and tends to live in denial that it can occasionally be necessary, or a key to achievement. He, and his people, focus more on other priorities and tend to leave themselves vulnerable as a result. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Reduction of any available Free Military units from a penalty based on the total amount of your overall population. [ICON_BULLET]Huge Increase in War Weariness you suffer. Your people are not merely fearful of war, but object to it as a solution. [ICON_BULLET]Strong Reduction in the speed of training all Military units. Your people object to becoming soldiers in any capacity. [ICON_BULLET]Strong Increase in the price to upgrade your units. Unique Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Applies Pacifist I Promotion to all Combatant units. Pacifist I is a fairly basic Promotion with a relatively minor -10% combat modifier. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Improved relations with opponent Leaders. They like pushovers they need not fear. [ICON_BULLET]Moderate Education bonus. The people are more focused on developing knowledge rather than on military strategy and physical prowess. [ICON_BULLET]Minor Happiness bonus. People are more cooperative and engaging with one another and are more content with life as a result.
TEXT.German: Negative Charaktereigenschaft "Ich glaube an die Gewaltlosigkeit als einziges Heilmittel." - Mohandas Karamchand (genannt Mahatma) Gandhi (1869-1948) Das Staatsoberhaupt hasst Konflikte jeglicher Art. Es vertritt die Meinung, dass Kriege absolut unnötig sind und es keinerlei Grund für die Anwendung von Gewalt gibt. Da der Anführer und sein Volk andere Prioritäten haben, vernachlässigen sie Militär und Verteidigung, was sie zu leichten Opfern für mächtige Aggressoren macht. Primäre Nachteile: [ICON_BULLET]Verminderung aller freien Militäreinheiten basierend auf der Gesamtbevölkerung [ICON_BULLET]Steigerung der Kriegsmüdigkeit des eigenen Volkes (Die Bevölkerung fürchtet den Krieg nicht nur, es hält ihn außerdem für sinnlos.) [ICON_BULLET]verlangsamte Ausbildung von Militäreinheiten (Es besteht im Volk keinerlei Interesse am Soldatenhandwerk.) [ICON_BULLET]Preisanstieg für die Modernisierung von Einheiten Einschränkungen für Einheiten: [ICON_BULLET]alle Kämpfer- und Marineeinheiten erhalten automatisch die Beförderung Pazifist I Vorteile: [ICON_BULLET]verbesserte Beziehungen zu anderen Staatsoberhäuptern (Sie mögen Schwächlinge, die sie nicht fürchten müssen.) [ICON_BULLET]erhöhter Bildungsstand (Das Volk konzentriert sich mehr auf das Lernen und Forschen als auf militärische Ausbildung und Körperertüchtigung.) [ICON_BULLET]erhöhte Zufriedenheit (Deine Leute arbeiten eher mit- als gegeneinander und sind deshalb zufriedener mit ihrem Leben.)

TEXT.Polish: Cecha negatywna "Wojna? Co z niej dobrego? Absolutnie nic!" Lider ten nie znosi konfliktów i ma tendencjê do ¿ycia w zaprzeczeniu, ¿e czasami mo¿e byæ to konieczne. On i jego ludzie skupiaj¹ siê bardziej na innych priorytetach, w wyniku czego czêsto nara¿aj¹ siê na bezbronnoœæ. Podstawowe kary: [ICON_BULLET]Redukcja wszelkich dostêpnych darmowych jednostek wojskowych opartych na ca³kowitej liczbie twojej ogólnej populacji. [ICON_BULLET]Ogromny wzrost zmêczenia wojn¹, na który cierpisz. Wasi ludzie nie tylko boj¹ siê wojny, ale sprzeciwiaj¹ siê jej jako rozwi¹zaniu. [ICON_BULLET]Silne zmniejszenie szybkoœci szkolenia wszystkich jednostek wojskowych. Twoi ludzie sprzeciwiaj¹ siê zostaniu ¿o³nierzami w jakimkolwiek charakterze. [ICON_BULLET]Silny wzrost ceny za ulepszenie swoich jednostek. Unikalne kary: [ICON_BULLET]Stosuje Awans Pacyfista I do wszystkich jednostek Kombatantów. Pacyfista I to doœæ podstawowa promocja ze stosunkowo niewielkim modyfikatorem walki -10%. Korzyœci: [ICON_BULLET]Lepsze relacje z wrogimi przywódcami. Lubi¹ popychad³a, których nie musz¹ siê baæ. [ICON_BULLET]Umiarkowana premia edukacyjna. Ludzie s¹ bardziej skupieni na rozwijaniu wiedzy ni¿ na strategii wojskowej i sprawnoœci fizycznej. [ICON_BULLET]Drobny bonus do szczêœcia. Ludzie chêtniej wspó³pracuj¹ i anga¿uj¹ siê w siebie nawzajem, w wyniku czego s¹ bardziej zadowoleni z ¿ycia.

TEXT.English: Pacifist II
TEXT.Polish: Pacyfistyczny II

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "War? What's it good for? Absolutely nothing!" This Leader resents conflict and tends to live in denial that it can occasionally be necessary, or a key to achievement. He, and his people, focus more on other priorities and tend to leave themselves vulnerable as a result. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Huge Increase in War Weariness you suffer. Your people are not merely fearful of war, but object to it as a solution. [ICON_BULLET]Reduction of any available Free Military units from a penalty based on the total amount of your overall population. [ICON_BULLET]Huge reduction in the speed of training all Military units. Your people object to becoming soldiers in any capacity. [ICON_BULLET]Huge increase in the price to upgrade your units. Unique Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Applies Pacifist II Promotion to all Combatant units. Pacifist II is a fairly basic Promotion with a relatively minor -10% combat modifier. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Reduced rate of earning Great Military People. [ICON_BULLET]Small reduction to the maximum number of population you convert to units during a Conscription action in a city. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Reduction in overall upkeep due to a diminished focus on military training and quality assurance of national defense. [ICON_BULLET]Moderate Education bonus. The people are more focused on developing knowledge rather than on military strategy and physical prowess. [ICON_BULLET]Minor Health bonus. People tend to live safer lives with fights and conflict being infrequent. [ICON_BULLET]Minor Happiness bonus. People are more cooperative and engaging with one another and are more content with life as a result.
TEXT.German: Negative Charaktereigenschaft "Ich glaube an die Gewaltlosigkeit als einziges Heilmittel." - Mohandas Karamchand (genannt Mahatma) Gandhi (1869-1948) Das Staatsoberhaupt hasst Konflikte jeglicher Art. Es vertritt die Meinung, dass Kriege absolut unnötig sind und es keinerlei Grund für die Anwendung von Gewalt gibt. Da der Anführer und sein Volk andere Prioritäten haben, vernachlässigen sie Militär und Verteidigung, was sie zu leichten Opfern für mächtige Aggressoren macht. Primäre Nachteile: [ICON_BULLET]Steigerung der Kriegsmüdigkeit des eigenen Volkes (Die Bevölkerung fürchtet den Krieg nicht nur, es hält ihn außerdem für sinnlos.) [ICON_BULLET]Verminderung aller freien Militäreinheiten basierend auf der Gesamtbevölkerung [ICON_BULLET]verlangsamte Ausbildung von Militäreinheiten (Es besteht im Volk keinerlei Interesse am Soldatenhandwerk.) [ICON_BULLET]Preisanstieg für die Modernisierung von Einheiten Einschränkungen für Einheiten: [ICON_BULLET]alle Kämpfer- und Marineeinheiten erhalten automatisch die Beförderung Pazifist II Weitere Nachteile: [ICON_BULLET]gesenkte Geburtenrate für Große Feldherren [ICON_BULLET]Verminderung der Anzahl an neuen Militäreinheiten, die über Einberufungsaktionen gewonnen werden können Vorteile: [ICON_BULLET]Reduzierung der laufenden Kosten (Es wird nur wenig Wert auf militärisches Training und hochwertige Verteidigungsanlagen gelegt.) [ICON_BULLET]erhöhter Bildungsstand (Das Volk konzentriert sich mehr auf das Lernen und Forschen als auf militärische Ausbildung und Körperertüchtigung.) [ICON_BULLET]erhöhte Gesundheit (Das Volk lebt sicherer. Es kommt nur selten zu Raufereien und Streitigkeiten.) [ICON_BULLET]erhöhte Zufriedenheit (Deine Leute arbeiten eher mit- als gegeneinander und sind deshalb zufriedener mit ihrem Leben.)

People tend to live safer lives with fights and conflict being infrequent. [ICON_BULLET]Minor Happiness Penalty. People are more cooperative and engaging with one another and are more content with life as a result.
