TEXT.English: Pacifist III
TEXT.Polish: Pacyfistyczny III

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "War? What's it good for? Absolutely nothing!" This Leader resents conflict and tends to live in denial that it can occasionally be necessary, or a key to achievement. He, and his people, focus more on other priorities and tend to leave themselves vulnerable as a result. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Large increase in War Weariness you suffer. Your people are not merely fearful of war, but object to it as a solution. [ICON_BULLET]Reduction of any available Free Military units from a penalty based on the total amount of your overall population. [ICON_BULLET]Huge reduction in the speed of training all Military units. Your people object to becoming soldiers in any capacity. [ICON_BULLET]Huge Increase in the price to upgrade your units. Unique Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Applies Pacifist III Promotion to all Combatant units. Pacifist III is a fairly basic Promotion with a relatively minor -10% combat modifier. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Reduced rate of earning Great Military People. [ICON_BULLET]Moderate reduction to the maximum number of population you convert to units during a Conscription action in a city. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Moderate reduction in overall upkeep due to a diminished focus on military training and quality assurance of national defense. [ICON_BULLET]Strong Education bonus. The people are more focused on developing knowledge rather than on military strategy and physical prowess. [ICON_BULLET]Minor Health bonus. People tend to live safer lives with fights and conflict being infrequent.
TEXT.German: Negative Charaktereigenschaft "Ich glaube an die Gewaltlosigkeit als einziges Heilmittel." - Mohandas Karamchand (genannt Mahatma) Gandhi (1869-1948) Das Staatsoberhaupt hasst Konflikte jeglicher Art. Es vertritt die Meinung, dass Kriege absolut unnötig sind und es keinerlei Grund für die Anwendung von Gewalt gibt. Da der Anführer und sein Volk andere Prioritäten haben, vernachlässigen sie Militär und Verteidigung, was sie zu leichten Opfern für mächtige Aggressoren macht. Primäre Nachteile: [ICON_BULLET]Steigerung der Kriegsmüdigkeit des eigenen Volkes (Die Bevölkerung fürchtet den Krieg nicht nur, es hält ihn außerdem für sinnlos.) [ICON_BULLET]Verminderung aller freien Militäreinheiten basierend auf der Gesamtbevölkerung [ICON_BULLET]verlangsamte Ausbildung von Militäreinheiten (Es besteht im Volk keinerlei Interesse am Soldatenhandwerk.) [ICON_BULLET]Preisanstieg für die Modernisierung von Einheiten Einschränkungen für Einheiten: [ICON_BULLET]alle Kämpfer- und Marineeinheiten erhalten automatisch die Beförderung Pazifist III Weitere Nachteile: [ICON_BULLET]gesenkte Geburtenrate für Große Feldherren [ICON_BULLET]Verminderung der Anzahl an neuen Militäreinheiten, die über Einberufungsaktionen gewonnen werden können Vorteile: [ICON_BULLET]Reduzierung der laufenden Kosten (Es wird nur wenig Wert auf militärisches Training und hochwertige Verteidigungsanlagen gelegt.) [ICON_BULLET]erhöhter Bildungsstand (Das Volk konzentriert sich mehr auf das Lernen und Forschen als auf militärische Ausbildung und Körperertüchtigung.) [ICON_BULLET]erhöhte Gesundheit (Das Volk lebt sicherer. Es kommt nur selten zu Raufereien und Streitigkeiten.)

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "War? What's it good for? Absolutely nothing!" This Leader resents conflict and tends to live in denial that war can occasionally be necessary, or a key to achievement. He, and his people, focus more on other priorities and tend to leave themselves vulnerable as a result. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Large increase in War Weariness you suffer. Your people are not merely fearful of war, but object to it as a solution. [ICON_BULLET]Strong reduction of any available Free Military units from a penalty based on the total amount of your overall population. [ICON_BULLET]Strong reduction in the speed of training all Military units. Your people object to becoming soldiers in any capacity. [ICON_BULLET]Strong increase in the price to upgrade your units. Unique Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Applies Pacifist Promotion to all Combatant units. Pacifist is a fairly basic Promotion with a relatively minor -10% combat modifier. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Reduced rate of earning Great Military People. [ICON_BULLET]Moderate reduction to the maximum number of population you convert to units during a Conscription action in a city. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Improved relations with opponent Leaders. They like pushovers they need not fear. [ICON_BULLET]Strong Education bonus. The people are more focused on developing knowledge rather than on military strategy and physical prowess. [ICON_BULLET]Minor Health bonus. People tend to live safer lives with fights and conflict being infrequent. [ICON_BULLET]Minor Happiness bonus. People are more cooperative and engaging with one another and are more content with life as a result.
TEXT.German: Negative Charaktereigenschaft "Ich glaube an die Gewaltlosigkeit als einziges Heilmittel." - Mohandas Karamchand (genannt Mahatma) Gandhi (1869-1948) Das Staatsoberhaupt hasst Konflikte jeglicher Art. [ICON_BULLET]erhöhter Bildungsstand (Das Volk konzentriert sich mehr auf das Lernen und Forschen als auf militärische Ausbildung und Körperertüchtigung.) [ICON_BULLET]erhöhte Zufriedenheit (Deine Leute arbeiten eher mit- als gegeneinander und sind deshalb zufriedener mit ihrem Leben.)

TEXT.English: Allows a weak military in favor of more domestic concerns.
TEXT.French: Permet à une armée faible de favoriser des préoccupations plus nationales.
TEXT.German: Ein pazifistischer Anführer vernachlässigt das Militär und die Verteidigung zugunsten von innenpolitischen Anliegen.

TEXT.English: Pious CT
TEXT.Polish: Pobo¿ny CT

TEXT.English: Pious I
TEXT.Polish: Pobo¿ny I

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "A man who stands for nothing falls for anything. If you believe in a Religion, you MUST live what you believe, or you actually don't believe it at all. Devotion to a faith, mind, body, and soul, is the only way to find meaning in your life." When you adopt a Religion, you adopt it fully. It's not about hating rival faiths but about living the belief to the letter. That said, other faiths DO make everyone here very uncomfortable and it becomes state policy to dissuade them and run them off if the speak too loudly. You and your people enjoy incredible gifts where your State Religion is spread, all the moreso if you own the Holy City for that Religion. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Units are faster to train where you have your State Religion. [ICON_BULLET]Buildings are faster to construct where you have your State Religion. [ICON_BULLET]Gain a significant Experience point modifier boost in the Holy City of your State Religion. [ICON_BULLET]Allows the nation to produce Inquisitor units once technologically unlocked, that can remove all Religions but the State Religion in a city. Abilities: [ICON_BULLET]All combat capable units gain the Devotion I Promotion, which gives a strong Religious combat modifier, which is a combat modifier that applies as a benefit to your unit if the opponent unit is not of your Religion, but as a penalty if they are. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolutions Option, cities are more stable with your Religion. [ICON_BULLET]Priest type City Specialists give an additional Production yield. [ICON_BULLET]Priest type City Specialists give an additional Gold and Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]War Weariness is diminished due to strong faith that a higher power should favor them due to their devotion. [ICON_BULLET]Gains a significant bonus to the rate of birthing Great People wherever your State Religion has spread. [ICON_BULLET]Cities with your State Religion are Happier. [ICON_BULLET]Units trained in cities with your State Religion gain a few extra base free Experience points. [ICON_BULLET]Your State Religion is easier to spread. [ICON_BULLET]Gain a Happiness wherever you have access to the Incense resource. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolutions Option, cities are less stable with multiple Religions present. [ICON_BULLET]A small overall Gold percent penalty in all cities. Even the government donates a percentage to the Church. [ICON_BULLET]Religious and spiritual Technologies are discovered slower. The dedication to the faith the people have blinds them to new Religious thought. [ICON_BULLET]Each Non-State Religions in a city makes the city less Happy. [ICON_BULLET]War Weariness accumulates slower for your foes because they may tend to see your society as a threat to their views so are invigorated to battle you. [ICON_BULLET]Lose a small amount of free Experience on units trained in Holy Cities of Non-State Religions. [ICON_BULLET]Non-State Religions are more difficult to spread.

[ICON_BULLET]Dodatkowe szczêœcie, gdziekolwiek masz dostêp do zasobu Kadzid³a. Kary: [ICON_BULLET]W opcji Rewolucje miasta s¹ mniej stabilne, jeœli wystêpuje w nich wiele religii. [ICON_BULLET]Niewielka ogólna kara procentowa w z³ocie we wszystkich miastach. Nawet rz¹d przekazuje pewien procent Koœcio³owi. [ICON_BULLET]Technologie religijne i duchowe s¹ odkrywane wolniej. Przywi¹zanie do wiary ludzi zaœlepia ich na now¹ myœl religijn¹. [ICON_BULLET]Ka¿da niepañstwowa religia w mieœcie czyni miasto mniej szczêœliwym. [ICON_BULLET]Zmêczenie wojn¹ narasta wolniej u twoich wrogów, poniewa¿ mog¹ oni postrzegaæ twoje spo³eczeñstwo jako zagro¿enie dla ich pogl¹dów, wiêc s¹ o¿ywione do walki z tob¹. [ICON_BULLET]Tracisz niewielk¹ iloœæ darmowego doœwiadczenia na jednostkach szkolonych w Œwiêtych Miastach religii niepañstwowych. [ICON_BULLET]Religie niepañstwowe s¹ trudniejsze do szerzenia.

TEXT.English: Pious II
TEXT.Polish: Pobo¿ny II

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "A man who stands for nothing falls for anything. If you believe in a Religion, you MUST live what you believe, or you actually don't believe it at all. Devotion to a faith, mind, body, and soul, is the only way to find meaning in your life." When you adopt a Religion, you adopt it fully. It's not about hating rival faiths but about living the belief to the letter. That said, other faiths DO make everyone here very uncomfortable and it becomes state policy to dissuade them and run them off if the speak too loudly. You and your people enjoy incredible gifts where your State Religion is spread, all the moreso if you own the Holy City for that Religion. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Units are significantly faster to train where you have your State Religion. [ICON_BULLET]Buildings are significantly faster to construct where you have your State Religion. [ICON_BULLET]Gain a significant Experience point modifier boost in the Holy City of your State Religion. [ICON_BULLET]All cities you found or capture are immediately given your State Religion. Abilities: [ICON_BULLET]All combat capable units gain the Devotion II Promotion, which gives a strong Religious combat modifier, which is a combat modifier that applies as a benefit to your unit if the opponent unit is not of your Religion, but as a penalty if they are. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolutions Option, cities are more stable with your Religion. [ICON_BULLET]Priest type City Specialists give an additional Commerce yield. [ICON_BULLET]Priest type City Specialists give an additional Culture and Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]War Weariness is diminished due to strong faith that a higher power should favor them due to their devotion. [ICON_BULLET]Gains a significant bonus to the rate of birthing Great People wherever your State Religion has spread. [ICON_BULLET]Cities with your State Religion are Happier. [ICON_BULLET]Units trained in cities with your State Religion gain a few extra base free Experience points. [ICON_BULLET]Your State Religion is easier to spread. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolutions Option, cities are less stable with multiple Religions present. [ICON_BULLET]A small overall Gold percent penalty in all cities. Even the government donates a percentage to the Church. [ICON_BULLET]Religious and spiritual Technologies are discovered slower. The dedication to the faith the people have blinds them to new Religious thought. [ICON_BULLET]Religious Anarchy periods are twice as long as it takes a lot for the citizens to change their perspectives on Religion. [ICON_BULLET]War Weariness accumulates slower for your foes because they may tend to see your society as a threat to their views so are invigorated to battle you. [ICON_BULLET]Lose a small amount of free Experience on units trained in Holy Cities of Non-State Religions. [ICON_BULLET]Non-State Religions are more difficult to spread.

[ICON_BULLET]Lose a significant amount of free Experience on units trained in Holy Cities of Non-State Religions. [ICON_BULLET]Non-State Religions are more difficult to spread.

TEXT.English: Extremely dedicated to one Religion and is not agile at all at switching between them. Experiences very strong benefits for supporting the chosen State Religion.

TEXT.English: Pragmatic CT
TEXT.Polish: Pragmatyczny CT

TEXT.English: Pragmatic I
TEXT.Polish: Pragmatyczny I

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "People are counting on their Leaders to do things right. That requires the ability to make the tough choices and to always be willing to look your real challenges right in the face without a shred of denial. Take them head on and don't pussyfoot around the fact that there will always be wolves nipping at the heels of your society. Stay away from the indulgences that plague others." This Leader gets a percent bonus to all Commerces and Yields, the primary properties, Crime, Disease, and Education, are all improved, and there are some simple but effective military benefits, making this trait a solid selection for nearly any strategy or playstyle. However, there are some added expenses and delays and this trait gives the most direct and the strongest total Happiness penalties among all positive traits. Nevertheless, for the Pragmatic player, this can be a good, no-frills, no bells and whistles, simple generic choice. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your Cities all gain a minor percentage modifier to Food, Production, and Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Your Cities all gain a minor percentage modifier to Gold, Research, Culture, and Espionage. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your units are more thoroughly trained and start with an extra Experience Point. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are slightly more well defended by practical design. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities enjoy a little less Crime. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities enjoy a little less Disease. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities benefit from a touch more Education. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all less Happy since the Leader does not sugarcoat the problems the nation faces and pushes his nation to achieve as much as it possibly can despite the stress it causes. [ICON_BULLET]Overall Upkeep is higher because this Leader overlooks nothing and spends everything he must to get the best out of his nation. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Distance to Capital is higher. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Number of Cities is higher. [ICON_BULLET]Corporation Maintenance is higher. [ICON_BULLET]Your largest cities are less Happy because you put a lot of strain on your strongest centers of activity to perform. [ICON_BULLET]Your Military units take slightly longer to train due to the quality you insist on in their training.

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "People are counting on their Leaders to do things right. That requires the ability to make the tough choices and to always be willing to look your real challenges right in the face without a shred of denial. Take them head on and don't pussyfoot around the fact that there will always be wolves nipping at the heels of your society. Stay away from the indulgences that plague others." This Leader gets a percent bonus to all Commerces and Yields, the primary properties, Crime, Disease, and Education, are all improved, and there are some simple but effective military benefits, making this trait a solid selection for nearly any strategy or playstyle. However, there are some added expenses and delays and this trait gives the most direct and the strongest total Happiness penalties among all positive traits. Nevertheless, for the Pragmatic player, this can be a good, no-frills, no bells and whistles, simple generic choice. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your Cities all gain a percentage modifier to Food, Production, and Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Your Cities all gain a percentage modifier to Gold, Research, Culture, and Espionage. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your units are more thoroughly trained and start with a few extra Experience Points. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are more well defended by practical design. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities enjoy less Crime. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities enjoy less Disease. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities benefit from more Education. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all significantly less Happy since the Leader does not sugarcoat the problems the nation faces and pushes his nation to achieve as much as it possibly can despite the stress it causes. [ICON_BULLET]Overall Upkeep is higher because this Leader overlooks nothing and spends everything he must to get the best out of his nation. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Distance to Capital is significantly higher. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Number of Cities is significantly higher. [ICON_BULLET]Corporation Maintenance is significantly higher. [ICON_BULLET]Your largest cities are less Happy because you put a lot of strain on your strongest centers of activity to perform. [ICON_BULLET]Your Military units take longer to train due to the quality you insist on in their training.

TEXT.English: Gains wide ranging benefits but can be unpopular with his people as he seems to be a bit of a downer. Invests a little more than he could but gets what he pays for.
TEXT.French: Bénéficie de nombreux avantages mais peut être impopulaire auprès de son peuple car il semble être un peu déprimant. Investit un peu plus qu'il ne pouvait, mais obtient ce pour quoi il paie.

TEXT.English: Preeminent CT
TEXT.Polish: Wybitny CT

TEXT.English: Preeminent I
TEXT.Polish: Wybitny I

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "Power starts at the center of the government and extends outwards. That which is closest to the source is the most nurtured." Both political and Religious centers of power are highly favored in this Leader's preferences for funding and attention. He tends to let the exterior and less magnificent cities go underfunded and they actually end up costing more as a result. Those citizens who closest to these seats of power have stronger national pride and a fervor to protect the crown. A good trait for a super-city player. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]The Capital produces more Food, Production and Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]The Capital produces more Gold, Research, Culture and Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]Units trained in the Capital get significantly more bonus Experience Points than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Units Trained in the Holy City of your State Religion gain significantly more bonus Experience Points than normal. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Great Military People are generated faster from battles inside your borders. [ICON_BULLET]National Wonders are constructed faster in your cities. [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolution option, Holy City instability is diminished. [ICON_BULLET]Administrative and National Pride Buildings are faster to construct. [ICON_BULLET]Administrative and National Pride Buildings generate extra Happiness in your cities. [ICON_BULLET]Your units gain more Experience from combat within your borders. [ICON_BULLET]Holy Cities of Non-State Religions produce units with a bonus to Experience Points. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolution option, distance plays a larger role in creating instability. [ICON_BULLET]You suffer a significant increase in Maintenance from Distance to Capital due to underfunding allowing problems needing attention to exacerbate. [ICON_BULLET]You suffer a significant increase in the Maintenance from Number of Cities since you resent having to fund any cities that aren't of key importance and thus allows expenses to build to critical levels. [ICON_BULLET]Get one less Trade Route in every city since your citizens even tend to only recognize the most influential cities of the world as being on their own radar for Trade. [ICON_BULLET]Foreign Trade Routes are less productive since your people are less interested in what happens outside their borders.

TEXT.English: Preeminent II
TEXT.Polish: Wybitny II

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "Power starts at the center of the government and extends outwards. That which is closest to the source is the most nurtured." Both political and Religious centers of power are highly favored in this Leader's preferences for funding and attention. He tends to let the exterior and less magnificent cities go underfunded and they actually end up costing more as a result. Those citizens who closest to these seats of power have stronger national pride and a fervor to protect the crown. A good trait for a super-city player. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]The Capital produces more Food, Production and Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]The Capital produces more Gold, Research, Culture and Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]Units trained in the Capital get significantly more bonus Experience Points than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Units Trained in the Holy City of your State Religion gain significantly more bonus Experience Points than normal. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Great Military People are generated faster from battles inside your borders. [ICON_BULLET]National Wonders are constructed faster in your cities. [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolution option, Holy City instability is diminished. [ICON_BULLET]Administrative and National Pride Buildings are faster to construct. [ICON_BULLET]Administrative and National Pride Buildings generate extra Happiness in your cities. [ICON_BULLET]The largest cities in your empire are a little Happier. [ICON_BULLET]Your units gain more Experience from combat within your borders. [ICON_BULLET]Holy Cities of Non-State Religions produce units with a significant bonus to Experience Points. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolution option, distance plays a larger role in creating instability. [ICON_BULLET]You suffer a large increase in Maintenance from Distance to Capital due to underfunding allowing problems needing attention to exacerbate. [ICON_BULLET]You suffer a large increase in the Maintenance from Number of Cities since you resent having to fund any cities that aren't of key importance and thus allows expenses to build to critical levels. [ICON_BULLET]Get one less Trade Route in every city since your citizens even tend to only recognize the most influential cities of the world as being on their own radar for Trade. [ICON_BULLET]Foreign Trade Routes are less productive since your people are less interested in what happens outside their borders.

[ICON_BULLET]Zdob¹dŸ o jeden szlak handlowy mniej w ka¿dym mieœcie, poniewa¿ twoi obywatele maj¹ tendencjê do uznawania tylko najbardziej wp³ywowych miast œwiata za znajduj¹ce siê na ich w³asnym radarze handlowym. [ICON_BULLET]Zagraniczne szlaki handlowe s¹ mniej produktywne, poniewa¿ twoi ludzie s¹ mniej zainteresowani tym, co dzieje siê poza ich granicami.

TEXT.English: Preeminent III
TEXT.Polish: Wybitny III

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "Power starts at the center of the government and extends outwards. That which is closest to the source is the most nurtured." Both political and Religious centers of power are highly favored in this Leader's preferences for funding and attention. He tends to let the exterior and less magnificent cities go underfunded and they actually end up costing more as a result. Those citizens who closest to these seats of power have stronger national pride and a fervor to protect the crown. A good trait for a super-city player. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]The Capital produces more Food, Production and Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]The Capital produces more Gold, Research, Culture and Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]Units trained in the Capital get much more bonus Experience Points than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Units Trained in the Holy City of your State Religion gain much more bonus Experience Points than normal. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Great Military People are generated faster from battles inside your borders. [ICON_BULLET]National Wonders are constructed significantly faster in your cities. [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolution option, Holy City instability is diminished. [ICON_BULLET]Administrative and National Pride Buildings generate extra Happiness in your cities. [ICON_BULLET]The largest cities in your empire are Happier. [ICON_BULLET]Your units gain more Experience from combat within your borders. [ICON_BULLET]Holy Cities of Non-State Religions produce units with a significant bonus to Experience Points. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolution option, distance plays a larger role in creating instability. [ICON_BULLET]You suffer a huge increase in Maintenance from Distance to Capital due to underfunding allowing problems needing attention to exacerbate. [ICON_BULLET]You suffer a huge increase in the Maintenance from Number of Cities since you resent having to fund any cities that aren't of key importance and thus allows expenses to build to critical levels. [ICON_BULLET]Get one less Trade Route in every city since your citizens even tend to only recognize the most influential cities of the world as being on their own radar for Trade. [ICON_BULLET]Foreign Trade Routes are less productive since your people are less interested in what happens outside their borders.

TEXT.English: Progressive CT
TEXT.Polish: Progresywny CT

TEXT.English: Progressive I
TEXT.Polish: Progresywny I

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "Human rights and dignities are the most important thing to expand upon and protect." Far from a basket of deplorables, you and your people are engaged social activists and civil rights warriors. You do all you can to ensure fair treatment in this system and you benefit from some very unique and uncommon game effects in the process. However, it is heavily advised to never whip your slaves. Your people have no tolerance for mistreatment of anyone. Slavery itself is not particularly penalized because as long as you treat people well, it's understood to just be another station in society. War should be avoided if possible and as conscientious objectors, your people are reluctant to enter into military service. Your Leader also believes that all Religions should be capable of tolerating one another and should be able to bring their own unique benefits to their diverse society without bias. The benefits in this trait are so unusual and potent that there are no Primary and Secondary Benefits here, just Benefits. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]The presence of any Religion gives a base benefit in yields, Commerce and Happiness regardless of if they are your State Religion or not. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages are much longer than normal here since people so greatly rejoice in the strength of their diversity. [ICON_BULLET]Cities require less Food to grow. [ICON_BULLET]You get a Free Specialist for each National Wonder in your city. [ICON_BULLET]All Religions are active in your nation on the Religious Disabling option. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities enjoy a reduction in Crime. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities enjoy a reduction in Disease. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities enjoy an increase in Education. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Basic Upkeep is slightly more expensive. New progressive programs are consistently attempted and are often more costly than they prove beneficial. [ICON_BULLET]You may conscript one less citizen with a draft action in a city. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Number of Cities is higher since you do all you can to meet the needs of your marginalized elements of society and the more communities you have, the more this becomes an issue. [ICON_BULLET]Your Military Units take longer to train due to reluctance among the people to enlist. [ICON_BULLET]Periods of anger from whipping slaves for construction and training is much longer than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Enemy War Weariness is reduced since foes tend to think of your people as snowflakes.

[ICON_BULLET]Your cities enjoy a reduction in Crime. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities enjoy a reduction in Disease. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities enjoy an increase in Education. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Basic Upkeep is more expensive. New progressive programs are consistently attempted and are often more costly than they prove beneficial. [ICON_BULLET]You may conscript a few less citizens with a draft action in a city. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Number of Cities is significantly higher since you do all you can to meet the needs of your marginalized elements of society and the more communities you have, the more this becomes an issue. [ICON_BULLET]Your Military Units take significantly longer to train due to reluctance among the people to enlist. [ICON_BULLET]Periods of anger from whipping slaves for construction and training is significantly longer than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Enemy War Weariness is significantly reduced since foes tend to think of your people as snowflakes.

TEXT.English: Progressive III
TEXT.Polish: Progresywny III

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "Human rights and dignities are the most important thing to expand upon and protect." Far from a basket of deplorables, you and your people are engaged social activists and civil rights warriors. You do all you can to ensure fair treatment in this system and you benefit from some very unique and uncommon game effects in the process. However, it is heavily advised to never whip your slaves. Your people have no tolerance for mistreatment of anyone. Slavery itself is not particularly penalized because as long as you treat people well, it's understood to just be another station in society. War should be avoided if possible and as conscientious objectors, your people are reluctant to enter into military service. Your Leader also believes that all Religions should be capable of tolerating one another and should be able to bring their own unique benefits to their diverse society without bias. The benefits in this trait are so unusual and potent that there are no Primary and Secondary Benefits here, just Benefits. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all Happier. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all Healthier. [ICON_BULLET]Great People are born far more frequently. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages are twice as long as normal here since people so greatly rejoice in the strength of their diversity. [ICON_BULLET]Cities require significantly less Food to grow. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities enjoy a reduction in Crime. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities enjoy a reduction in Disease. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities enjoy an increase in Education. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Basic Upkeep is significantly more expensive. New progressive programs are consistently attempted and are often more costly than they prove beneficial. [ICON_BULLET]You may conscript a few less citizens with a draft action in a city. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Number of Cities is much higher since you do all you can to meet the needs of your marginalized elements of society and the more communities you have, the more this becomes an issue. [ICON_BULLET]Your Military Units take much longer to train due to reluctance among the people to enlist. [ICON_BULLET]Enemy War Weariness is greatly reduced since foes tend to think of your people as snowflakes.

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "Human rights and dignities are the most important thing to expand upon and protect." Far from a basket of deplorables, you and your people are engaged social activists and civil rights warriors. You do all you can to ensure fair treatment in this system and you benefit from some very unique and uncommon game effects in the process. However, it is heavily advised to never whip your slaves. Your people have no tolerance for mistreatment of anyone. Slavery itself is not particularly penalized because as long as you treat people well, it's understood to just be another station in society. War should be avoided if possible and as conscientious objectors, your people are reluctant to enter into military service. Your Leader also believes that all Religions should be capable of tolerating one another and should be able to bring their own unique benefits to their diverse society without bias. The benefits in this trait are so unusual and potent that there are no Primary and Secondary Benefits here, just Benefits. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]The presence of any Religion gives a base benefit in yields, Commerce and Happiness regardless of if they are your State Religion or not. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages are far longer than normal here since people so greatly rejoice in the strength of their diversity. [ICON_BULLET]Cities require significantly less Food to grow. [ICON_BULLET]You get a Free Specialist for each World Wonder in your city. [ICON_BULLET]You get a Free Specialist for each National Wonder in your city. [ICON_BULLET]You get a Free Specialist for each Team Project in your city. [ICON_BULLET]All Religions are active in your nation on the Religious Disabling option. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities enjoy a reduction in Crime. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities enjoy a reduction in Disease. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities enjoy an increase in Education. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Basic Upkeep is more expensive. New progressive programs are consistently attempted and are often more costly than they prove beneficial. [ICON_BULLET]You may conscript fewer citizens with a draft action in a city. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Number of Cities is significantly higher since you do all you can to meet the needs of your marginalized elements of society and the more communities you have, the more this becomes an issue. [ICON_BULLET]Your Military Units take longer to train due to reluctance among the people to enlist. [ICON_BULLET]Periods of anger from whipping slaves for construction and training is doubled. [ICON_BULLET]Enemy War Weariness is reduced since foes tend to think of your people as snowflakes.

TEXT.English: Numerous very unique benefits are derived from valuing Human rights. Golden Ages last a lot longer. Cities don't require as much Food to grow. You gain free Specialists from Wonders. Crime, Disease and Education are improved.
TEXT.French: De nombreux avantages très uniques découlent de la valorisation des droits de l'homme. L'âge d'or dure beaucoup plus longtemps. Les villes n'ont pas besoin d'autant de nourriture pour grandir. Vous obtenez gratuitement des spécialistes des merveilles. La criminalité, les maladies et l'éducation sont améliorées.

TEXT.English: Prolific CT
TEXT.Polish: P³odny CT

TEXT.English: Prolific I
TEXT.Polish: P³odny I

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "Our most sacred duty is to spread our people across the face of the Earth. Swell in numbers and we shall outperform all other competitors. Fertility and Health are our greatest resources." This trait gives your city a powerful head start in population and culture and then backs that up by making your cities require less Food to grow and supports greater population with Happiness benefits and faster unit training. However, it can cost you directly in Gold expenses, which can already be a strain on fast growing nations, and make sure you aren't just placing these faster sprouting assets for others to easily capture. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain a percentage modifier to Food and Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Cities start with an additional population. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]All cities are Healthier because the people are inspired to nurture one another. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities all produce an extra base Food and Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Cities require a bit less Food to grow. [ICON_BULLET]Newly placed cities are given a small amount of immediate culture. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all penalized a base Gold. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities all suffer from a percentage reduction to Gold. [ICON_BULLET]Merchant and Noble type Specialists maintain enormous family clans themselves and thus end up costing you one Gold each. [ICON_BULLET]Hurrying construction and training through whipping is a travesty to population development and therefore your people hang on to anger for this for a long time.
TEXT.Russian: Positive Trait 'Our most sacred duty is to spread our people across the face of the Earth. Swell in numbers and we shall outperform all other competitors. Fertility and Health are our greatest resources.' This trait gives your city a powerful head start in population and culture and then backs that up by making your cities require less Food to grow and supports greater population with Happiness benefits and faster unit training. However, it can cost you directly in Gold expenses, which can already be a strain on fast growing nations, and make sure you aren't just placing these faster sprouting assets for others to easily capture. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain a percentage modifier to Food and Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Cities start with an additional population. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]All cities are Healthier because the people are inspired to nurture one another. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities all produce an extra base Food and Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Cities require a bit less Food to grow. [ICON_BULLET]Newly placed cities are given a small amount of immediate culture. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all penalized a base Gold. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities all suffer from a percentage reduction to Gold. [ICON_BULLET]Merchant and Noble type Specialists maintain enormous family clans themselves and thus end up costing you one Gold each. [ICON_BULLET]Hurrying construction and training through whipping is a travesty to population development and therefore your people hang on to anger for this for a long time.

TEXT.English: Prolific II
TEXT.Polish: P³odny II

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "Our most sacred duty is to spread our people across the face of the Earth. Swell in numbers and we shall outperform all other competitors. Fertility and Health are our greatest resources." This trait gives your city a powerful head start in population and culture and then backs that up by making your cities require less Food to grow and supports greater population with Happiness benefits and faster unit training. However, it can cost you directly in Gold expenses, which can already be a strain on fast growing nations, and make sure you aren't just placing these faster sprouting assets for others to easily capture. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain a percentage modifier to Food and Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Cities require less Food to grow. [ICON_BULLET]Cities start with an additional population. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]All cities are Healthier because the people are inspired to nurture one another. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities all produce an extra base Food and Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Your Largest Cities are Happier since the people in large communities feel deeply interconnected as many are related. [ICON_BULLET]Your Military units are trained faster since your family oriented folk are quick to offer themselves into service to their kin. [ICON_BULLET]Newly placed cities are given a small amount of immediate culture. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all penalized a base Gold. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities all suffer from a percentage reduction to Gold. [ICON_BULLET]Citizen and Slave type Specialists maintain enormous family clans and often need help supporting them thus end up costing you one Gold each. [ICON_BULLET]Hurrying construction and training through whipping is a travesty to population development and therefore your people hang on to anger for this for a long time. [ICON_BULLET]Hurrying construction and training with Gold is more expensive than normal.

Fertility and Health are our greatest resources." This trait gives your city a powerful head start in population and culture and then backs that up by making your cities require less Food to grow and supports greater population with Happiness benefits and faster unit training. However, it can cost you directly in Gold expenses, which can already be a strain on fast growing nations, and make sure you aren't just placing these faster sprouting assets for others to easily capture. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain a percentage modifier to Food and Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Cities require much less Food to grow. [ICON_BULLET]Cities start with an additional population. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]All cities are Healthier because the people are inspired to nurture one another. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities all produce an extra base Food and Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Your Largest Cities are much Happier since the people in large communities feel deeply interconnected as many are related. [ICON_BULLET]Your Military units are trained significantly faster since your family oriented folk are quick to offer themselves into service to their kin. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all penalized a base Gold. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities all suffer from a percentage reduction to Gold. [ICON_BULLET]Priest and Law type Specialists promote large family clans that often need help supporting, thus end up costing you one Gold each. [ICON_BULLET]Hurrying construction and training through whipping is a travesty to population development and therefore your people hang on to anger for this for a long time. [ICON_BULLET]Hurrying construction and training with Gold is significantly more expensive than normal.

TEXT.Polish: Korzyœci ze wzrostu populacji z pewnymi karami w z³ocie

TEXT.English: Slob CT
TEXT.Polish: Niechlujny CT

TEXT.English: Slob I
TEXT.Polish: Niechlujny I

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "Its too much effort to clean up and it gets in the way of progress to worry about it. Nature will sort it out eventually." When your rivers run neon blue due to pollutants and air stations are installed for citizens to refill their tanks, you know you might have allowed a bit too much 'freedom' for the good of the world. But hey, you probably made a lot of money doing it so hopefully you're Happy with what you've earned. Your people certainly aren't. They probably miss the trees and Healthy grasslands that once produced so much Food for them but now struggles to sprout weeds, let alone crops. Ok, it might not start off that bad, but hey... let's see just how many dunes we can spread across the Earth and still manage to survive as a species! Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer from more Air Pollution. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer from more Water Pollution. Unique Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]All your units gain the Slob I Promotion, which makes all your units leave garbage wherever they go, thus spreading an additional Air and Water Pollution in their wake each round. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all more unhealthy. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all more Unhappy. [ICON_BULLET]Artist Type Specialists cost a Production. [ICON_BULLET]Celebrity and Artist Type Specialists produce one less Culture. [ICON_BULLET]You get a Diplomatic penalty since your waste tends to find and disturb the rest of the world. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Generic Upkeep is reduced since being irresponsible with industry is cheap. [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain a small percentage modifier to Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Number of Cities is reduced. [ICON_BULLET]Corporations are cheaper to operate without emissions and waste regulations. [ICON_BULLET]The cost of upkeep for each Military Unit is reduced since you don't care to cover the labor costs of cleaning up after them. [ICON_BULLET]The expense of rushing constructions and training is reduced since your industries are skilled at cutting corners to get faster results.

TEXT.English: Slob II
TEXT.Polish: Niechlujny II

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "Its too much effort to clean up and it gets in the way of progress to worry about it. Nature will sort it out eventually." When your rivers run neon blue due to pollutants and air stations are installed for citizens to refill their tanks, you know you might have allowed a bit too much 'freedom' for the good of the world. But hey, you probably made a lot of money doing it so hopefully you're Happy with what you've earned. Your people certainly aren't. They probably miss the trees and Healthy grasslands that once produced so much Food for them but now struggles to sprout weeds, let alone crops. Ok, it might not start off that bad, but hey... let's see just how many dunes we can spread across the Earth and still manage to survive as a species! Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]All Specialists cost an extra Food. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer from more Air Pollution. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer from more Water Pollution. Unique Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]All your units gain the Slob II Promotion, which makes all your units leave garbage wherever they go, thus spreading an additional Air and Water Pollution in their wake each round. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all more unhealthy. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all more Unhappy. [ICON_BULLET]Your Largest cities are less Happy since these Urban communities are festering in garbage. [ICON_BULLET]You get a Diplomatic penalty since your waste tends to find and disturb the rest of the world. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Generic Upkeep is reduced since being irresponsible with industry is cheap. [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain a small percentage modifier to Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Number of Cities is reduced. [ICON_BULLET]Corporations are cheaper to operate without emissions and waste regulations. [ICON_BULLET]The cost of upkeep for each Military Unit is reduced since you don't care to cover the labor costs of cleaning up after them. [ICON_BULLET]The expense of rushing constructions and training is moderately reduced since your industries are skilled at cutting corners to get faster results.

TEXT.English: Slob III
TEXT.Polish: Niechlujny III

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "Its too much effort to clean up and it gets in the way of progress to worry about it. Nature will sort it out eventually." When your rivers run neon blue due to pollutants and air stations are installed for citizens to refill their tanks, you know you might have allowed a bit too much 'freedom' for the good of the world. But hey, you probably made a lot of money doing it so hopefully you're Happy with what you've earned. Your people certainly aren't. They probably miss the trees and Healthy grasslands that once produced so much Food for them but now struggles to sprout weeds, let alone crops. Ok, it might not start off that bad, but hey... let's see just how many dunes we can spread across the Earth and still manage to survive as a species! Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]All Specialists cost an extra Food. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer from significantly more Air Pollution. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer from significantly more Water Pollution. Unique Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]All your units gain the Slob III Promotion, which makes all your units leave garbage wherever they go, thus spreading an additional Air and Water Pollution in their wake each round. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all more unhealthy. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all more Unhappy. [ICON_BULLET]Your Largest cities are much less Happy since these Urban communities are festering in garbage. [ICON_BULLET]You get a Diplomatic penalty since your waste tends to find and disturb the rest of the world. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Generic Upkeep is reduced since being irresponsible with industry is cheap. [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain a percentage modifier to Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Number of Cities is significantly reduced. [ICON_BULLET]Corporations are significantly cheaper to operate without emissions and waste regulations. [ICON_BULLET]The expense of rushing constructions and training is moderately reduced since your industries are skilled at cutting corners to get faster results.

TEXT.English: Strategist CT
TEXT.Polish: Strateg CT

TEXT.English: Strategist I
TEXT.Polish: Strateg I

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "Delegation of command through intensive training is the way to superiority on the battlefield. When every soldier uses his head and heart to obtain mastery at his craft, we have a force that can win any conflict." Discipline means everything for this Leader and he demands it at every level of his highly organized nation. Competency is the prime directive he issues from his place of rule and although it does cost him in a number of ways, he finds the return in value very worthwhile. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Free Experience points to all units. [ICON_BULLET]Less Experience required for units to gain levels. [ICON_BULLET]Small percentage modifier of bonus Experience points assigned to units trained in the Capital. Unique Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Get a Golden Age whenever a Great General is born to your nation. [ICON_BULLET]Get a free Great General whenever you advance an Era. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Enhancement to the rate of earning Great Military People. [ICON_BULLET]Further enhancement to the rate of earning Great Military People when Experience accumulated towards that goal is earned within your borders. [ICON_BULLET]Military Training Buildings are cheaper to build. [ICON_BULLET]Techs that bring military training benefits are faster to discover. [ICON_BULLET]Your units gain more Experience when they fight inside your borders. [ICON_BULLET]Slightly increased Defense against Espionage due to the improved level of discipline, and thus care taken with procedure, at every level of command. [ICON_BULLET]Great Generals are a little more likely to be born as normal Great People. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Slightly reduced rate of earning standard Great People. The importance placed on discipline suppresses the creative genius in some individuals that may have otherwise become powerfully influential. [ICON_BULLET]Military units cost more to train due to the increased efforts and costs involved in training them to such a degree of enhanced excellence. [ICON_BULLET]Since Golden Ages are far more common, they last a quarter less rounds when they take place. People don't remain impressed with their society as long. [ICON_BULLET]More expensive to upgrade units since they are more specialized and have greater demands on their quality.

TEXT.English: Strategist II
TEXT.Polish: Strateg II

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "Delegation of command through intensive training is the way to superiority on the battlefield. When every soldier uses his head and heart to obtain mastery at his craft, we have a force that can win any conflict." Discipline means everything for this Leader and he demands it at every level of his highly organized nation. Competency is the prime directive he issues from his place of rule and although it does cost him in a number of ways, he finds the return in value very worthwhile. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Free Experience points to all units. [ICON_BULLET]Less Experience required for units to gain levels. [ICON_BULLET]Percentage modifier of bonus Experience points assigned to units trained in the Capital. Unique Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Get a Golden Age whenever a Great Admiral is born to your nation. [ICON_BULLET]Get a free Great Admiral whenever you advance an Era. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Enhancement to the rate of earning Great Military People. [ICON_BULLET]Further enhancement to the rate of earning Great Military People when Experience accumulated towards that goal is earned within your borders. [ICON_BULLET]Military Training Buildings are cheaper to build. [ICON_BULLET]Techs that bring military training benefits are faster to discover. [ICON_BULLET]Your units gain more Experience when they fight inside your borders. [ICON_BULLET]Increased Defense against Espionage due to the improved level of discipline, and thus care taken with procedure, at every level of command. [ICON_BULLET]Great Generals are more likely to be born as normal Great People. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Reduced rate of earning standard Great People. The importance placed on discipline suppresses the creative genius in some individuals that may have otherwise become powerfully influential. [ICON_BULLET]Military units cost more to train due to the increased efforts and costs involved in training them to such a degree of enhanced excellence. [ICON_BULLET]Since Golden Ages are far more common, they last a quarter less rounds when they take place. People don't remain impressed with their society as long. [ICON_BULLET]More expensive to upgrade units since they are more specialized and have greater demands on their quality.

[ICON_BULLET]Increased Defense against Espionage due to the improved level of discipline, and thus care taken with procedure, at every level of command. [ICON_BULLET]Great Generals are significantly more likely to be born as normal Great People. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Reduced rate of earning standard Great People. [ICON_BULLET]Military units cost more to train due to the increased efforts and costs involved in training them to such a degree of enhanced excellence. [ICON_BULLET]Since Golden Ages are far more common, they last a quarter less rounds when they take place. People don't remain impressed with their society as long. [ICON_BULLET]More expensive to upgrade units since they are more specialized and have greater demands on their quality.

TEXT.English: Quality over quantity. Highest priority is an Experience driven military led by masterful commanders.
TEXT.French: La qualité plutôt que la quantité. La plus haute priorité est une expérience militaire dirigée par des commandants magistraux.

TEXT.English: Stubborn CT
TEXT.Polish: Uparty CT

TEXT.English: Stubborn I
TEXT.Polish: Uparty I

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "It requires careful, meticulous planning to run an empire and all these people wanting me to focus on all of these things need to just quiet down on their enthusiasm. I'll get to it all when I'm damned good and ready!" This Leader has his own way of doing things and puts importance on the most basic things taking place in his empire. He does not care to try to leave a huge legacy and is very patient when making his demands. People often resist doing what he wishes and go about those things with less exuberance, and the results show in the end. He more thoroughly trains his military and it makes them hard to improve with later developments. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]World Wonders, National Wonders, and Team Projects are constructed far slower than usual. [ICON_BULLET]Rushing construction and training costs much more than normal. Unique Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Buildings that speed up construction and training are constructed slower. [ICON_BULLET]Techs that give benefits for being first to Research them are discovered slower. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Civic Anarchy periods last longer because your Leader won't tolerate any disagreements and must root out all resistance to his policy changes. [ICON_BULLET]Improvements naturally upgrade far slower. [ICON_BULLET]Workers are much slower than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Thanks to difficulties working under your policies, your workforce is less effective and you are penalized a Free Specialist as a result. [ICON_BULLET]Military Units are slower to train due to thorough training regimens. [ICON_BULLET]Units are more expensive to upgrade since they are harder to teach new ways to fight. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Trade Route profits are increased for Food yields. [ICON_BULLET]Units begin with one more Experience Point due to thorough training. [ICON_BULLET]Your nation naturally supports an increased amount of Free Units based on a small percentage of the overall total population. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages last longer because the Leader is slower to let things get back to normal.

TEXT.English: Stubborn II
TEXT.Polish: Uparty II

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "It requires careful, meticulous planning to run an empire and all these people wanting me to focus on all of these things need to just quiet down on their enthusiasm. I'll get to it all when I'm damned good and ready!" This Leader has his own way of doing things and puts importance on the most basic things taking place in his empire. He does not care to try to leave a huge legacy and is very patient when making his demands. People often resist doing what he wishes and go about those things with less exuberance, and the results show in the end. He more thoroughly trains his military and it makes them hard to improve with later developments. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]World Wonders, National Wonders, and Team Projects are constructed far slower than usual. [ICON_BULLET]Rushing construction and training costs much more than normal. Unique Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Buildings that speed up construction and training are constructed slower. [ICON_BULLET]Techs that give benefits for being first to Research them are discovered slower. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Civic Anarchy periods last significantly longer because your Leader won't tolerate any disagreements and must root out all resistance to his policy changes. [ICON_BULLET]Improvements naturally upgrade far slower. [ICON_BULLET]Workers are much slower than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Thanks to difficulties working under your policies, your workforce is less effective and you are penalized a Free Specialist as a result. [ICON_BULLET]Military Units are moderately slower to train due to thorough training regimens. [ICON_BULLET]Units are moderately more expensive to upgrade since they are harder to teach new ways to fight. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Trade Route profits are increased for Commerce yields. [ICON_BULLET]This nation suffers less War Weariness since this Leader has unshakeable confidence. [ICON_BULLET]Units begin with one more Experience Point due to thorough training. [ICON_BULLET]Your nation naturally supports an increased amount of Free Units based on a small percentage of the overall total population. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are marginally easier to defend since the defenses are built to respond to all possible threats. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages last longer because the Leader is slower to let things get back to normal.

[ICON_BULLET]Military Units are significantly slower to train due to thorough training regimens. [ICON_BULLET]Units are significantly more expensive to upgrade since they are harder to teach new ways to fight. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Trade Route profits are increased for all yield types. [ICON_BULLET]This nation suffers less War Weariness since this Leader has unshakeable confidence. [ICON_BULLET]Units begin with one more Experience Point due to thorough training. [ICON_BULLET]Your nation naturally supports an increased amount of Free Units based on a small percentage of the overall total population. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are easier to defend since the defenses are built to respond to all possible threats. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages last longer because the Leader is slower to let things get back to normal.
TEXT.Russian: Negative Trait 'It requires careful, meticulous planning to run an empire and all these people wanting me to focus on all of these things need to just quiet down on their enthusiasm. I'll get to it all when I'm damned good and ready!' This Leader has his own way of doing things and puts importance on the most basic things taking place in his empire. He does not care to try to leave a huge legacy and is very patient when making his demands. People often resist doing what he wishes and go about those things with less exuberance, and the results show in the end. He more thoroughly trains his military and it makes them hard to improve with later developments. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]World Wonders, National Wonders, and Team Projects are constructed far slower than usual. [ICON_BULLET]Rushing construction and training costs much more than normal. Unique Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Buildings that speed up construction and training are constructed slower. [ICON_BULLET]Techs that give benefits for being first to Research them are discovered slower. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Civic Anarchy periods last longer because your Leader won't tolerate any disagreements and must root out all resistance to his policy changes. [ICON_BULLET]Improvements naturally upgrade far slower. [ICON_BULLET]Workers are much slower than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Thanks to difficulties working under your policies, your workforce is less effective and you are penalized a Free Specialist as a result. [ICON_BULLET]Military Units are significantly slower to train due to thorough training regimens. [ICON_BULLET]Units are significantly more expensive to upgrade since they are harder to teach new ways to fight. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Trade Route profits are increased for all yield types. [ICON_BULLET]This nation suffers less War Weariness since this Leader has unshakeable confidence. [ICON_BULLET]Units begin with one more Experience Point due to thorough training. [ICON_BULLET]Your nation naturally supports an increased amount of Free Units based on a small percentage of the overall total population. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are easier to defend since the defenses are built to respond to all possible threats. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages last longer because the Leader is slower to let things get back to normal.

TEXT.English: A lot gets done a lot slower in this empire but there are a few places where the extra care and attention can pay off. This Leader almost seems to balk at all suggestions and thus avoid good decisions specifically because others want him to make them.
TEXT.French: Beaucoup se fait beaucoup plus lentement dans cet empire, mais il y a quelques endroits où le soin et l'attention supplémentaires peuvent porter leurs fruits. Ce Leader semble presque reculer devant toutes les suggestions et éviter ainsi les bonnes décisions, notamment parce que d'autres veulent qu'il les fasse.

TEXT.Polish: W tym imperium wiele rzeczy dzieje siê znacznie wolniej, ale jest kilka miejsc, w których dodatkowa troska i uwaga mog¹ siê op³aciæ. Wydaje siê, ¿e ten przywódca wzbrania siê przed wszelkimi sugestiami i w ten sposób unika dobrych decyzji, zw³aszcza dlatego, ¿e inni chc¹, aby je podj¹³.

TEXT.English: Timid CT
TEXT.Polish: Nieœmia³y CT

TEXT.English: Timid I
TEXT.Polish: Nieœmia³y I

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "Me? Attack someone else? No... no... initiating a war is just too Great a risk and morally wrong." While this trait will hobble your nation in offensive war efforts, it does give you some defensive benefits and makes war less likely to be thrust upon you. If you can compensate in other ways, like outgrowing your opponents, you might be able to succeed despite this painful set of penalties. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Inflicts War Weariness upon enemy players slower than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Increased cost of upkeep per military unit. Unique Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Applies the Timid I Promotion to all Combatant and Naval Combatant units. Gives a large attack penalty but a small defense bonus. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Decrease in the rate of earning Great Military People. [ICON_BULLET]Combatants and Naval Combatants lose a few Experience points when trained. [ICON_BULLET]Combatants and Naval Combatants take longer to train. The people are culturally resistant to the idea of being in the military. [ICON_BULLET]You accumulate significantly more War Weariness than usual. [ICON_BULLET]Small decrease to the maximum number of population you convert to units during a Conscription action in a city. [ICON_BULLET]Lose some Free Military Units if you are getting some from other sources. [ICON_BULLET]Slightly less likely to capture enemy units when defeating them. Your troops often let surviving enemies flee. [ICON_BULLET]Units are more likely to be captured when defeated. Your units will more readily surrender to be taken alive. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Increase in the rate of earning Great Military People on combats that take place inside your borders. Enough to counter the penalty you get overall so that the penalty really ONLY applies when the battle is outside your borders. [ICON_BULLET]Increase in the amount of Experience earned during fights within your borders. [ICON_BULLET]Slightly improved base city defense level. [ICON_BULLET]Bonus to diplomacy. It's very comforting to other Leaders to believe it's unlikely you're going to ever attack them, or anyone else for that matter. [ICON_BULLET]Less expensive to upgrade units. Retraining simpler units that act more effectively at harnessing their terror than tapping into anger and hate is less costly.
TEXT.German: Negative Charaktereigenschaft "Es gibt eine Grenze, wo Zurückhaltung aufhört, eine Tugend zu sein." - Edmund Burke (1729-1797) Obwohl diese Charaktereigenschaft dir Steine bei eventuellen Kriegsbestrebungen in den Weg legt, bringt sie doch auch unbestreitbare defensive Vorteile und sorgt dafür, dass deine Nation wesentlich seltener in bewaffnete Auseinandersetzungen verwickelt wird. Wem es gelingt, die üblen Nachteile anderweitig zu kompensieren, etwa durch technologische Fortschritte oder kulturelle Ausbreitung, der kann durchaus auch als schüchterner Anführer siegreich sein. Primäre Nachteile: [ICON_BULLET]verzögerte Kriegsmüdigkeit bei gegnerischen Nationen [ICON_BULLET]erhöhte laufende Kosten für militärische Einheiten Einschränkungen für Einheiten: [ICON_BULLET]alle Kämpfer- und Marineeinheiten erhalten automatisch die Beförderung Schüchtern I Weitere Nachteile: [ICON_BULLET]gesenkte Geburtenrate für Große Feldherren [ICON_BULLET]Kämpfer- und Marineeinheiten erhalten beim Training weniger Erfahrungspunkte [ICON_BULLET]verzögertes Training für Kämpfer- und Marineeinheiten (Die Bevölkerung hat keine Erfahrung mit Auseinandersetzungen und ist dementsprechend untrainiert.) [ICON_BULLET]Steigerung der Kriegsmüdigkeit des eigenen Volkes [ICON_BULLET]Senkung der Anzahl an neuen Militäreinheiten, die über Einberufungsaktionen gewonnen werden können [ICON_BULLET]weniger freie Einheiten, für die keine laufenden Kosten anfallen [ICON_BULLET]geringere Wahrscheinlichkeit für die Gefangennahme gegnerischer Einheiten (Deine Truppen lassen überlebende Gegner eher entkommen.) [ICON_BULLET]erhöhte Wahrscheinlichkeit für die Gefangennahme eigener Einheiten (Deine Truppen hängen am Leben und ergeben sich eher.) Vorteile: [ICON_BULLET]normale Geburtenrate für Große Feldherren bei Gefechten innerhalb der eigenen Grenzen (Der Bonus für Gefechte außerhalb der eigenen Grenzen wird gerade aufgehoben.) [ICON_BULLET]Erhöhung der Erfahrungspunkte für Gefechte innerhalb der eigenen Grenzen [ICON_BULLET]verbesserte Stadtverteidigung [ICON_BULLET]Vorteile bei diplomatischen Verhandlungen (Andere Staatsoberhäupter fühlen sich wohler, wenn sie nicht ständig mit Angriffen rechnen müssen.) [ICON_BULLET]Preissenkung für die Modernisierung von Einheiten (Da weniger Wert auf die neuesten Taktiken und Tötungsarten gelegt wird, werden Kosten gespart.)

Chocia¿ ta cecha unieruchomi twój naród w ofensywnych wysi³kach wojennych, daje ci pewne korzyœci obronne i zmniejsza prawdopodobieñstwo, ¿e wojna zostanie na ciebie narzucona. [ICON_BULLET]Stracisz czêœæ darmowych jednostek wojskowych, jeœli zdobêdziesz je z innych Ÿróde³. [ICON_BULLET]Nieco mniej prawdopodobne, ¿e przejmie wrogie jednostki podczas ich pokonywania. TEXT.English: Timid II
TEXT.Polish: Nieœmia³y II

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "Me? Attack someone else? No... no... initiating a war is just too Great a risk and morally wrong." While this trait will hobble your nation in offensive war efforts, it does give you some defensive benefits and makes war less likely to be thrust upon you. If you can compensate in other ways, like outgrowing your opponents, you might be able to succeed despite this painful set of penalties. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Inflicts War Weariness upon enemy players much slower than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Increased cost of upkeep per military unit. [ICON_BULLET]You accumulate far more War Weariness than usual. Unique Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Applies the Timid II Promotion to all Combatant and Naval Combatant units. Gives a large attack penalty but a small defense bonus. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Decrease in the rate of earning Great Military People. [ICON_BULLET]Great Military People city Specialists lose two Gold each. [ICON_BULLET]Combatants and Naval Combatants lose Experience points when trained. [ICON_BULLET]Combatants and Naval Combatants take longer to train. The people are culturally resistant to the idea of being in the military. [ICON_BULLET]Decrease to the maximum number of population you convert to units during a Conscription action in a city. [ICON_BULLET]Lose some Free Military Units if you are getting some from other sources. [ICON_BULLET]Slightly less likely to capture enemy units when defeating them. Your troops often let surviving enemies flee. [ICON_BULLET]Units are more likely to be captured when defeated. Your units will more readily surrender to be taken alive. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Increase in the rate of earning Great Military People on combats that take place inside your borders. Enough to counter the penalty you get overall so that the penalty really ONLY applies when the battle is outside your borders. [ICON_BULLET]Increase in the amount of Experience earned during fights within your borders. [ICON_BULLET]Improved base city defense level. [ICON_BULLET]Bonus to diplomacy. It's very comforting to other Leaders to believe it's unlikely you're going to ever attack them, or anyone else for that matter. [ICON_BULLET]Less expensive to upgrade units. Retraining simpler units that act more effectively at harnessing their terror than tapping into anger and hate is less costly.

TEXT.English: Timid III
TEXT.Polish: Nieœmia³y III

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "Me? Attack someone else? No... no... initiating a war is just too Great a risk and morally wrong." While this trait will hobble your nation in offensive war efforts, it does give you some defensive benefits and makes war less likely to be thrust upon you. If you can compensate in other ways, like outgrowing your opponents, you might be able to succeed despite this painful set of penalties. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Inflicts War Weariness upon enemy players far slower than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Increased cost of upkeep per military unit. [ICON_BULLET]You accumulate way more War Weariness than usual. Unique Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Applies the Timid III Promotion to all Combatant and Naval Combatant units. Gives a large attack penalty but a small defense bonus. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Decrease in the rate of earning Great Military People. [ICON_BULLET]Combatants and Naval Combatants lose a large amount of Experience points when trained. [ICON_BULLET]Combatants and Naval Combatants take much longer to train. The people are culturally resistant to the idea of being in the military. [ICON_BULLET]Significant decrease to the maximum number of population you convert to units during a Conscription action in a city. [ICON_BULLET]Lose some Free Military Units if you are getting some from other sources. [ICON_BULLET]Slightly less likely to capture enemy units when defeating them. Your troops often let surviving enemies flee. [ICON_BULLET]Units are more likely to be captured when defeated. Your units will more readily surrender to be taken alive. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Increase in the rate of earning Great Military People on combats that take place inside your borders. Enough to counter the penalty you get overall so that the penalty really ONLY applies when the battle is outside your borders. [ICON_BULLET]Significant increase in the amount of Experience earned during fights within your borders. [ICON_BULLET]Improved base city defense level. [ICON_BULLET]Bonus to diplomacy. It's very comforting to other Leaders to believe it's unlikely you're going to ever attack them, or anyone else for that matter. [ICON_BULLET]Less expensive to upgrade units. Retraining simpler units that act more effectively at harnessing their terror than tapping into anger and hate is less costly.
TEXT.German: Negative Charaktereigenschaft "Es gibt eine Grenze, wo Zurückhaltung aufhört, eine Tugend zu sein." - Edmund Burke (1729-1797) Obwohl diese Charaktereigenschaft dir Steine bei eventuellen Kriegsbestrebungen in den Weg legt, bringt sie doch auch unbestreitbare defensive Vorteile und sorgt dafür, dass deine Nation wesentlich seltener in bewaffnete Auseinandersetzungen verwickelt wird. Wem es gelingt, die üblen Nachteile anderweitig zu kompensieren, etwa durch technologische Fortschritte oder kulturelle Ausbreitung, der kann durchaus auch als schüchterner Anführer siegreich sein. Primäre Nachteile: [ICON_BULLET]verzögerte Kriegsmüdigkeit bei gegnerischen Nationen [ICON_BULLET]erhöhte laufende Kosten für militärische Einheiten [ICON_BULLET]Steigerung der Kriegsmüdigkeit des eigenen Volkes Einschränkungen für Einheiten: [ICON_BULLET]alle Kämpfer- und Marineeinheiten erhalten automatisch die Beförderung Schüchtern III Weitere Nachteile: [ICON_BULLET]gesenkte Geburtenrate für Große Feldherren [ICON_BULLET]Kämpfer- und Marineeinheiten erhalten beim Training weniger Erfahrungspunkte [ICON_BULLET]verzögertes Training für Kämpfer- und Marineeinheiten (Die Bevölkerung hat keine Erfahrung mit Auseinandersetzungen und ist dementsprechend untrainiert.) [ICON_BULLET]Senkung der Anzahl an neuen Militäreinheiten, die über Einberufungsaktionen gewonnen werden können [ICON_BULLET]weniger freie Einheiten, für die keine laufenden Kosten anfallen [ICON_BULLET]geringere Wahrscheinlichkeit für die Gefangennahme gegnerischer Einheiten (Deine Truppen lassen überlebende Gegner eher entkommen.) [ICON_BULLET]erhöhte Wahrscheinlichkeit für die Gefangennahme eigener Einheiten (Deine Truppen hängen am Leben und ergeben sich eher.) Vorteile: [ICON_BULLET]normale Geburtenrate für Große Feldherren bei Gefechten innerhalb der eigenen Grenzen (Der Bonus für Gefechte außerhalb der eigenen Grenzen wird gerade aufgehoben.) [ICON_BULLET]Erhöhung der Erfahrungspunkte für Gefechte innerhalb der eigenen Grenzen [ICON_BULLET]verbesserte Stadtverteidigung [ICON_BULLET]Vorteile bei diplomatischen Verhandlungen (Andere Staatsoberhäupter fühlen sich wohler, wenn sie nicht ständig mit Angriffen rechnen müssen.) [ICON_BULLET]Preissenkung für die Modernisierung von Einheiten (Da weniger Wert auf die neuesten Taktiken und Tötungsarten gelegt wird, werden Kosten gespart.)

TEXT.English: Gains some diplomatic bonus at the cost of having weak units - particularly on the attack. A little bit stronger when backed into a corner though.
TEXT.French: Gagne un bonus diplomatique au prix d'avoir des unités faibles - en particulier sur l'attaque. Un peu plus fort quand on est dans un coin cependant.
TEXT.German: Schüchterne Anführer haben es bei diplomatischen Verhandlungen etwas leichter. Leider sorgt ihr zögerliches Verhalten aber für eine Schwächung des Militärs. Besonders im Angriff sind ihre Einheiten anderen deutlich unterlegen. In die Ecke gedrängt, können sie aber immer noch zu formidablen Gegnern werden.

TEXT.Polish: Zyskuje pewn¹ premiê dyplomatyczn¹ kosztem posiadania s³abych jednostek - szczególnie w ataku. Jednak trochê silniejszy, gdy zostanie podstawiony pod œcian¹.

TEXT.English: Traditional CT
TEXT.Polish: Tradycyjny CT

TEXT.English: Traditional I
TEXT.Polish: Tradycyjny I

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "We already know everything we need to know! Stick to tradition or we'll lose our way!" You might feel this is clearly the worst selection for all Negative Traits but it's actually been a historically common way to see things for people. Change can be frightening and discoveries bring change. There are some significant benefits to offset the obvious hindrance of Researching slower, but you can also overcome your impediment in other ways, such as enhanced Commerce levels elsewhere, taking the scientific achievements from your conquered enemy cities, stealing Technologies with Espionage, or simply out-expanding your rivals. This is a fairly Happy people that can be much more stable for you if you give them the reliability they desire. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]All cities are penalized a couple less base Research. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer a percentage penalty to Research. [ICON_BULLET]All Specialists cost a Research. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are less Healthy since the people tend to stoically deny any need for treatment, not trusting what they don't understand. [ICON_BULLET]Your nation generates Great People slower. Those with new ideas tend to suffer mockery and mistrust. [ICON_BULLET]Buildings that are focused on Science and Research are slower to build. [ICON_BULLET]Scientist type Specialists generate one less Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Citizen and Slave type Specialists cost a Research. [ICON_BULLET]Your Capital generates a percentage less Research. [ICON_BULLET]Technologies that lead to developments in Science and Research are slower to discover. [ICON_BULLET]Civic Anarchy time is increased since your people resent any changes. [ICON_BULLET]Religious Anarchy time is greatly increased since your people are stubbornly fixed in their ways. [ICON_BULLET]Great Scientists are less likely to be born. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your largest cities are Happier since urban living promises more reliable patterns day to day. [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain an extra free Specialist because the people obtain a higher degree of mastery through reliable routines. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are a bit easier to Educate since your people don't fear their knowledge being obsoleted by new discoveries.
