TEXT.English: Traditional II
TEXT.Polish: Tradycyjny II

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "We already know everything we need to know! Stick to tradition or we'll lose our way!" You might feel this is clearly the worst selection for all Negative Traits but it's actually been a historically common way to see things for people. Change can be frightening and discoveries bring change. There are some significant benefits to offset the obvious hindrance of Researching slower, but you can also overcome your impediment in other ways, such as enhanced Commerce levels elsewhere, taking the scientific achievements from your conquered enemy cities, stealing Technologies with Espionage, or simply out-expanding your rivals. This is a fairly Happy people that can be much more stable for you if you give them the reliability they desire. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]All cities are penalized with less base Research. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer a percentage penalty to Research. [ICON_BULLET]All Specialists cost a Research. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are less Healthy since the people tend to stoically deny any need for treatment, not trusting what they don't understand. [ICON_BULLET]Your nation generates Great People slower. Those with new ideas tend to suffer mockery and mistrust. [ICON_BULLET]Buildings that are focused on Science and Research are slower to build. [ICON_BULLET]Archaeological plot Improvements are built much slower. [ICON_BULLET]Doctor type Specialists generate one less Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Scientist type Specialists generate a few less Research. [ICON_BULLET]Your Capital generates a small percentage less Research. [ICON_BULLET]Technologies that lead to developments in Science and Research are slower to discover. [ICON_BULLET]Civic Anarchy time is significantly increased since your people resent any changes. [ICON_BULLET]Religious Anarchy time is greatly increased since your people are stubbornly fixed in their ways. [ICON_BULLET]Great Scientists are significantly less likely to be born. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your people are Happier, with the idea that they have found reliable ways to thrive. [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain an extra free Specialist because the people obtain a higher degree of mastery through reliable routines. [ICON_BULLET]Military units are faster to train since the people embrace a regimented style of living.

Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your people are Happier, with the idea that they have found reliable ways to thrive. [ICON_BULLET]Your largest cities are Happier since urban living promises more reliable patterns day to day. [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain an extra free Specialist because the people obtain a higher degree of mastery through reliable routines. [ICON_BULLET]Military units are faster to train since the people embrace a regimented style of living. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are a bit easier to Educate since your people don't fear their knowledge being obsoleted by new discoveries.
TEXT.Polish: Cecha negatywna "Wiemy ju¿ wszystko, co powinniœmy wiedzieæ! Trzymajmy siê tradycji, inaczej zgubimy drogê!" Mo¿esz uwa¿aæ, ¿e jest to zdecydowanie najgorszy wybór ze wszystkich cech negatywnych, ale w rzeczywistoœci by³ to historycznie powszechny sposób postrzegania rzeczy z punktu widzenia ludzi. Zmiany mog¹ budziæ strach, a odkrycia przynosz¹ zmiany. Istnieje kilka znacz¹cych korzyœci, które zrównowa¿¹ oczywist¹ przeszkodê wynikaj¹c¹ z wolniejszego prowadzenia badañ, ale mo¿esz tak¿e pokonaæ tê przeszkodê w inny sposób, na przyk³ad podnosz¹c poziom bogactaw w innym miejscu, zabieraj¹c osi¹gniêcia naukowe z podbitych miast wroga, kradn¹c technologie w ramach szpiegostwa lub po prostu rozszerzaj¹c siê szybciej ni¿ Twoi rywale. To doœæ szczêœliwi ludzie, którzy mog¹ byæ dla ciebie znacznie bardziej stabilni, jeœli zapewnisz im niezawodnoœæ, której pragn¹. Podstawowe kary: [ICON_BULLET]Wszystkie miasta s¹ karane o kilka bazowych badañ mniej. [ICON_BULLET]Wszystkie miasta otrzymuj¹ procentow¹ karê do badañ. [ICON_BULLET]Wszyscy specjaliœci kosztuj¹ jedno badanie. [ICON_BULLET]Twój naród wolniej generuje Wielkich Ludzi. Ci, którzy maj¹ nowe pomys³y, czêsto spotykaj¹ siê z drwin¹ i brakiem zaufania. [ICON_BULLET]Specjaliœci typu Obywatel i Niewolnik kosztuj¹ jedno badanie. [ICON_BULLET]Twoja stolica generuje procent mniej badañ. [ICON_BULLET]Technologie prowadz¹ce do rozwoju nauki i badañ s¹ wolniej odkrywane. [ICON_BULLET]Czas Anarchii Obywatelskiej wyd³u¿a siê, poniewa¿ twoi ludzie nie zgadzaj¹ siê z jakimikolwiek zmianami. [ICON_BULLET]Wszystkie miasta zyskuj¹ dodatkowego bezp³atnego specjalistê, poniewa¿ ludzie uzyskuj¹ wy¿szy stopieñ bieg³oœci dziêki niezawodnym procedurom. [ICON_BULLET]Twoje miasta s¹ nieco ³atwiejsze do edukowania, poniewa¿ twoi ludzie nie boj¹ siê, ¿e ich wiedza zostanie zdezaktualizowana przez nowe odkrycia.

TEXT.English: Poor Research, slow to recover from Anarchy inducing changes, and Great People emergence is weak, as pushing in a new direction is frowned upon. But the people feel content and secure and do get efficient, being well practiced with the existing knowledge and methods, resulting in free Specialists and some Education benefit.
TEXT.French: Pauvre recherche, lent à se remettre de changements induisant l'anarchie, et l'émergence de Great People est faible, car pousser dans une nouvelle direction est mal vu. Mais les gens se sentent satisfaits et en sécurité et deviennent efficaces, étant bien entraînés avec les connaissances et les méthodes existantes, ce qui donne des spécialistes gratuits et certains avantages éducatifs.

TEXT.Polish: S³abe badania, powolne wychodzenie ze zmian wywo³uj¹cych anarchiê, a pojawienie siê Wielkich Ludzi jest s³abe, poniewa¿ pchanie w nowym kierunku jest Ÿle widziane. Jednak ludzie czuj¹ siê zadowoleni i bezpieczni, a dziêki dobrej praktyce z istniej¹c¹ wiedz¹ i metodami staj¹ siê wydajni, co skutkuje wolnymi specjalistami i pewnymi korzyœciami edukacyjnymi.

TEXT.English: Unrefined CT
TEXT.Polish: Nieokrzesany CT

TEXT.English: Unrefined I
TEXT.Polish: Nieokrzesany I

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "Arts and Culture are worthless distractions to achieving dominance." If you've ever felt that you could forgo the value of culture, you are welcome to try working with a Leader with this negative trait. There are some benefits, like reduced upkeep, but the loss of cultural output should make it apparent how valuable culture can be. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]All cities produce a few less base Culture. [ICON_BULLET]All cities lose a percentage penalty to Culture. [ICON_BULLET]All Specialists produce one less Culture. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are less Happy since artistic expression is devalued. [ICON_BULLET]Great People are slower to emerge since personal expression is frowned upon. [ICON_BULLET]World Wonders are slower to construct since such projects seem frivolous. [ICON_BULLET]Buildings that are primarily for generating Culture are constructed slower. [ICON_BULLET]Artist type Specialists produce one less Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Citizen and Slave type Specialists are penalized a Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Your Capital loses a small percentage less Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Technologies that lead to Cultural development are slower to discover. [ICON_BULLET]Entertainer units are trained with one less Experience Point. [ICON_BULLET]Entertainer units are trained slower. [ICON_BULLET]Great Artists are less likely to be born. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer a bit more Crime. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Overall upkeep is lower since you deny funding anything that isn't absolutely functional. [ICON_BULLET]All Combatant units you train gain an additional Experience Point. [ICON_BULLET]Your nation suffers less War Weariness since they are a stoic folk. [ICON_BULLET]Your are significantly faster at building Improvements as they make them strong and simple. [ICON_BULLET]Your draft actions conscript an additional citizen. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are a little harder to attack since architectural design considers structural integrity paramount. [ICON_BULLET]Your Military Units are a little faster to train. [ICON_BULLET]Your enemies suffer more War Weariness, knowing your people are tough and rugged. [ICON_BULLET]When you defeat enemy units, you are a bit more likely to capture them.

TEXT.English: Unrefined III
TEXT.Polish: Nieokrzesany III

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "Arts and Culture are worthless distractions to achieving dominance." If you've ever felt that you could forgo the value of culture, you are welcome to try working with a Leader with this negative trait. There are some benefits, like reduced upkeep, but the loss of cultural output should make it apparent how valuable culture can be. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]All cities produce much less base Culture. [ICON_BULLET]All cities lose a percentage penalty to Culture. [ICON_BULLET]All Specialists produce one less Culture. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are less Happy since artistic expression is devalued. [ICON_BULLET]Great People are slower to emerge since personal expression is frowned upon. [ICON_BULLET]World Wonders are slower to construct since such projects seem frivolous. [ICON_BULLET]Buildings that are primarily for generating Culture are constructed slower. [ICON_BULLET]Celebrity type Specialists produce one less Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Artist type Specialists are penalized a Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Your Capital loses a small percentage less Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Technologies that lead to Cultural development are slower to discover. [ICON_BULLET]Entertainer units are trained with fewer Experience Points. [ICON_BULLET]Entertainer units are trained slower. [ICON_BULLET]Great Artists are much less likely to be born. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer from a little more Crime. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are a slightly harder to Educate. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Overall upkeep is lower since you deny funding anything that isn't absolutely functional. [ICON_BULLET]All Combatant units you train gain some additional Experience Points. [ICON_BULLET]Your nation suffers less War Weariness since they are a stoic folk. [ICON_BULLET]Your are significantly faster at building Improvements as they make them strong and simple. [ICON_BULLET]Your draft actions conscript an additional citizen. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are a little harder to attack since architectural design considers structural integrity paramount. [ICON_BULLET]Your Military Units are a little faster to train. [ICON_BULLET]Your enemies suffer more War Weariness, knowing your people are tough and rugged. [ICON_BULLET]When you defeat enemy units, you are a bit more likely to capture them.

[ICON_BULLET]Your cities are a little harder to attack since architectural design considers structural integrity paramount. [ICON_BULLET]Your Military Units are a little faster to train. [ICON_BULLET]Your enemies suffer more War Weariness, knowing your people are tough and rugged. [ICON_BULLET]When you defeat enemy units, you are a bit more likely to capture them.

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "Arts and Culture are worthless distractions to achieving dominance." If you've ever felt that you could forgo the value of culture, you are welcome to try working with a Leader with this negative trait. There are some benefits, like reduced upkeep, but the loss of cultural output should make it apparent how valuable culture can be. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]All cities produce a few less base Culture. [ICON_BULLET]All cities lose a significant percentage penalty to Culture. [ICON_BULLET]All Specialists produce one less Culture. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are less Happy since artistic expression is devalued. [ICON_BULLET]Great People are slower to emerge since personal expression is frowned upon. [ICON_BULLET]World Wonders are significantly slower to construct since such projects seem frivolous. [ICON_BULLET]Buildings that are primarily for generating Culture are constructed slower. [ICON_BULLET]Celebrity type Specialists lose a Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Artist type Specialists produce one less Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Artist and Celebrity type Specialists lose a few Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Citizen and Slave type Specialists are penalized a Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Your Capital loses a percentage less Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Technologies that lead to Cultural development are slower to discover. [ICON_BULLET]Entertainer units are trained with one less Experience Point. [ICON_BULLET]Entertainer units are trained slower. [ICON_BULLET]Great Artists are less likely to be born. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer a bit more Crime. [ICON_BULLET]Your people are more resistant to Education. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Overall upkeep is significantly lower since you deny funding anything that isn't absolutely functional. [ICON_BULLET]All Combatant units you train gain an additional Experience Point. [ICON_BULLET]Your nation suffers less War Weariness since they are a stoic folk. [ICON_BULLET]Your are significantly faster at building Improvements as they make them strong and simple. [ICON_BULLET]Your draft actions conscript more citizens. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are harder to attack since architectural design considers structural integrity paramount. [ICON_BULLET]Your Military Units are faster to train. [ICON_BULLET]Your enemies suffer more War Weariness, knowing your people are tough and rugged. [ICON_BULLET]When you defeat enemy units, you are more likely to capture them.

TEXT.English: Poor Culture People are Unhappy lacking for identity and expression. But they are roughshod by nature as a result.
TEXT.French: Pauvre culture Les gens sont malheureux et manquent d'identité et d'expression. Mais ils sont par conséquent grossiers par nature.

TEXT.English: Unsanitary CT
TEXT.Polish: Niehigieniczny CT

TEXT.English: Unsanitary I
TEXT.Polish: Niehigieniczny I

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "Let the people get sick so they can figure out how not to. Besides, we can turn our diseased against our enemies who are weak in their sterile environments." There can be an advantage to allowing Disease to plague your nation without offering it much resistance. The people CAN end up stronger, those who survive the outbreaks anyhow. Generally speaking, it is not considered a Great way to run things in a country, however, and it certainly leads to public resentment. It's certainly cheaper at least. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are significantly more UnHealthy. [ICON_BULLET]Disease is significantly increased in all cities. Unique Abilities: [ICON_BULLET]Most stealthy unit types and animal units all gain the Unsanitary I Promotion, which causes the promoted units to spread the Disease Property. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are less Happy thanks to resent for the toll that frequent rampant Disease takes on their lives and those of loved ones. [ICON_BULLET]Buildings that improve your capacity to combat Disease are slower to build. [ICON_BULLET]Citizen Type Specialists produce one less Production. [ICON_BULLET]Scientist and Doctor Type Specialists generate one less Research. [ICON_BULLET]Technologies that open up medical knowledge are slower to discover. [ICON_BULLET]Your Healer units are trained with one less Experience Point. [ICON_BULLET]Your Healer units are trained slower. [ICON_BULLET]Your nation suffers from more War Weariness since your people don't feel you have their best interests at heart. [ICON_BULLET]Great Doctors are less likely to be born in your cities. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities require a little more Food to grow thanks to a much higher mortality rate. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Generic Upkeep is cheaper since budgeting for medical care is of no governmental concern. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Distance to Capital is lower. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Number of Cities is lower. [ICON_BULLET]Your people let go of anger tremendously faster from whip rushing construction and training since life has much less meaning in a sick society.
TEXT.Polish: Cecha negatywna "Niech ludzie choruj¹, ¿eby wiedzieli, jak tego nie robiæ. Poza tym mo¿emy zwróciæ naszych chorych przeciwko naszym wrogom, którzy s¹ s³abi w swoim sterylnym œrodowisku." Pozwolenie, aby choroby nêka³y twój naród bez stawiania mu wiêkszego oporu, mo¿e byæ korzystne. Ludzie MOGA staæ siê silniejsi, ci, którzy prze¿yj¹ epidemie. Ogólnie rzecz bior¹c, nie jest to jednak uwa¿ane za œwietny sposób kierowania sprawami kraju i z pewnoœci¹ prowadzi do niezadowolenia opinii publicznej. Na pewno jest przynajmniej taniej. Podstawowe kary: [ICON_BULLET]Twoje miasta s¹ znacznie bardziej niezdrowe. [ICON_BULLET]We wszystkich miastach znacznie wzros³a liczba zachorowañ. Unikalne zdolnoœci: [ICON_BULLET]Wiêkszoœæ ukrywaj¹cych siê typów jednostek i jednostek zwierzêcych zyskuje awans Niehigieniczny I, który powoduje, ¿e promowane jednostki rozprzestrzeniaj¹ W³aœciwoœæ Chorobow¹. Kary boczne: [ICON_BULLET]Twoje miasta s¹ mniej szczêœliwe z powodu cierpienia, jakie czêsto szerz¹ce siê choroby powoduj¹ w ich ¿yciu i ¿yciu ich bliskich. [ICON_BULLET]Budynki zwiêkszaj¹ce twoj¹ zdolnoœæ do zwalczania chorób s¹ wolniejsze w budowie. [ICON_BULLET]Specjaliœci typu obywatel produkuj¹ o jedn¹ produkcjê mniej. [ICON_BULLET]Specjaliœci typu Naukowiec i Lekarz generuj¹ o jedno badanie mniej. [ICON_BULLET]Technologie poszerzaj¹ce wiedzê medyczn¹ s¹ wolniej odkrywane. [ICON_BULLET]Twoje jednostki Uzdrowicieli s¹ szkolone z jednym punktem doœwiadczenia mniej. [ICON_BULLET]Twoje jednostki Uzdrowicieli s¹ szkolone wolniej. [ICON_BULLET]Twój naród cierpi z powodu wiêkszego zmêczenia wojn¹, poniewa¿ twoi ludzie nie czuj¹, ¿e le¿y ci na sercu ich dobro. [ICON_BULLET]Wielcy lekarze rzadziej rodz¹ siê w twoich miastach. [ICON_BULLET]Twoje miasta potrzebuj¹ do rozwoju nieco wiêcej ¿ywnoœci ze wzglêdu na znacznie wy¿sz¹ œmiertelnoœæ. Korzyœci: [ICON_BULLET]Ogólne utrzymanie jest tañsze, poniewa¿ p³acenie na opiekê medyczn¹ nie jest przedmiotem zainteresowania rz¹du. [ICON_BULLET]Utrzymanie odleg³oœci od stolicy jest ni¿sze. [ICON_BULLET]Koszt utrzymania z liczby miast jest ni¿szy. [ICON_BULLET]Twoi ludzie znacznie szybciej wypuszczaj¹ z³oœæ dziêki poœpiesznemu budowaniu i szkoleniu, poniewa¿ ¿ycie w chorym spo³eczeñstwie ma znacznie mniejszy sens.

TEXT.English: Unsanitary II
TEXT.Polish: Niehigieniczny II

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "Let the people get sick so they can figure out how not to. Besides, we can turn our diseased against our enemies who are weak in their sterile environments." There can be an advantage to allowing Disease to plague your nation without offering it much resistance. The people CAN end up stronger, those who survive the outbreaks anyhow. Generally speaking, it is not considered a Great way to run things in a country, however, and it certainly leads to public resentment. It's certainly cheaper at least. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are significantly more UnHealthy. [ICON_BULLET]Disease is significantly increased in all cities. Unique Abilities: [ICON_BULLET]Most stealthy unit types and animal units all gain the Unsanitary II Promotion, which causes the promoted units to spread the Disease Property. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are less Happy thanks to resent for the toll that frequent rampant Disease takes on their lives and those of loved ones. [ICON_BULLET]Buildings that improve your capacity to combat Disease are slower to build. [ICON_BULLET]Slave Type Specialists produce one less Production. [ICON_BULLET]Doctor Type Specialists generate one less Espionage and Gold. [ICON_BULLET]Technologies that open up medical knowledge are slower to discover. [ICON_BULLET]Your Healer units are trained with a few less Experience Points. [ICON_BULLET]Your Healer units are trained significantly slower. [ICON_BULLET]Your nation suffers from significantly more War Weariness since your people don't feel you have their best interests at heart. [ICON_BULLET]Your Largest Cities are less Happy since infectious diseases hit larger populations more regularly. [ICON_BULLET]Great Doctors are significantly less likely to be born in your cities. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities require a little more Food to grow thanks to a much higher mortality rate. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Generic Upkeep is significantly cheaper since budgeting for medical care is of no governmental concern. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Distance to Capital is lower. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Number of Cities is lower. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities gain one Trade Route since there is no effort to control travel.

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "Let the people get sick so they can figure out how not to. Besides, we can turn our diseased against our enemies who are weak in their sterile environments." There can be an advantage to allowing Disease to plague your nation without offering it much resistance. The people CAN end up stronger, those who survive the outbreaks anyhow. Generally speaking, it is not considered a Great way to run things in a country, however, and it certainly leads to public resentment. It's certainly cheaper at least. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]A lot more UnHealthiness in all cities. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities require more Food to grow thanks to a much higher mortality rate. [ICON_BULLET]Disease is significantly increased in all cities. Unique Abilities: [ICON_BULLET]Most stealthy unit types and animal units all gain the Unsanitary Promotion, which causes the promoted units to spread the Disease Property. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are less Happy thanks to resent for the toll that frequent rampant Disease takes on their lives and those of loved ones. [ICON_BULLET]Buildings that improve your capacity to combat Disease are slower to build. [ICON_BULLET]Citizen, Slave and Engineer Type Specialists produce one less Production. [ICON_BULLET]Scientist and Doctor Type Specialists generate one less Research. [ICON_BULLET]Technologies that open up medical knowledge are slower to discover. [ICON_BULLET]Your Healer units are trained with a few less Experience Points. [ICON_BULLET]Your Healer units are trained significantly slower. [ICON_BULLET]Your nation suffers from more War Weariness since your people don't feel you have their best interests at heart. [ICON_BULLET]Your Largest Cities are less Happy since infectious diseases hit larger populations more regularly. [ICON_BULLET]Great Doctors are less likely to be born in your cities. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Generic Upkeep is significantly cheaper since budgeting for medical care is of no governmental concern. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Distance to Capital is significantly lower. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Number of Cities is significantly lower. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities gain one Trade Route since there is no effort to control travel. [ICON_BULLET]Your people let go of anger much faster from whip rushing construction and training since life has much less meaning in a sick society.

TEXT.English: Suffers from high Disease rates. People worry about becoming sick without proper medical care.
TEXT.French: Souffre de taux de maladie élevés. Les gens craignent de tomber malades sans soins médicaux appropriés.

TEXT.English: Usurper CT
TEXT.Polish: Uzurpator CT

TEXT.English: Usurper I
TEXT.Polish: Uzurpator I

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "Let the people of the land rejoice! For I have liberated them from the weak Leaders they relied upon before my arrival. The power of this position is now mine to wield and we have a lot more conquering ahead of us!" This Leader has taken command by force and the people resent him for bypassing due process and disposing of the original leadership. You may be able to enjoy some very strong military benefits, but if you select this trait, do ALL you can to avoid running out of Specialist slots and land to work because citizens will cost you far more than they generate thanks to the will to undermine and rebel that exists among those who don't have much to lose to oppose you. Better to keep your population whipped down to a manageable size, or at least openly angry and Unhappy than pretending to do you any favors. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer a percentage penalty to Gold and Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Citizen Type Specialists cost a Production. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are less Happy, resentful of the way your Leader took power. [ICON_BULLET]National Wonders are slower to construct due to a complete lack of national pride. [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolutions option, your cities are less stable and more likely to revolt. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities lose a base Gold and Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Your Capital suffers a percentage penalty to Food, Production and Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Your Capital suffers a percentage penalty to Gold and Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are slightly easier to perform Espionage Missions against since many citizens would help your foes if they feel they can get away with it. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer from a bit more Crime since many citizens wish to foment revolt against you. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]General Upkeep is reduced due to the elimination of a lot of government staff. [ICON_BULLET]Great Military People emerge significantly faster in this nation since your Leader came to power relying on some key military figures. [ICON_BULLET]Civic Anarchy time is greatly reduced since resistance to policy changes is met with the punishment of death.
TEXT.Polish: Cecha negatywna "Niech siê raduj¹ mieszkañcy tej ziemi! Bo wyzwoli³em ich od s³abych przywódców, na których polegali przed moim przybyciem. Lepiej ograniczyæ populacjê do rozs¹dnej wielkoœci lub przynajmniej otwarcie byæ wœciek³ym i nieszczêœliwym, ni¿ udawaæ, ¿e wyœwiadczaj¹ ci przys³ugê. Podstawowe kary: [ICON_BULLET]Wszystkie miasta otrzymuj¹ procentow¹ karê do Z³ota i Kultury. [ICON_BULLET]Specjaliœci typu obywatel kosztuj¹ produkcjê. Kary boczne: [ICON_BULLET]Wasze miasta s¹ mniej szczêœliwe i oburzone sposobem, w jaki wasz przywódca przej¹³ w³adzê. [ICON_BULLET]Cuda narodowe buduje siê wolniej ze wzglêdu na ca³kowity brak dumy narodowej. [ICON_BULLET]W przypadku opcji Rewolucje Twoje miasta s¹ mniej stabilne i bardziej podatne na bunt. [ICON_BULLET]Twoje miasta trac¹ bazowe z³oto i kulturê. [ICON_BULLET]Twoja stolica ponosi karê procentow¹ na rzecz ¿ywnoœci, produkcji i bogactwa. [ICON_BULLET]Twoja Stolica ponosi karê procentow¹ do Z³ota i Kultury. [ICON_BULLET]Twoje miasta cierpi¹ z powodu nieco wiêkszej przestêpczoœci, poniewa¿ wielu obywateli chce wznieciæ bunt przeciwko tobie. Korzyœci: [ICON_BULLET]Ogólne Koszty utrzymania s¹ zmniejszone ze wzglêdu na eliminacjê du¿ej liczby personelu rz¹dowego. [ICON_BULLET]Wielcy Ludzie Wojskowi pojawiaj¹ siê w tym kraju znacznie szybciej, odk¹d wasz przywódca doszed³ do w³adzy, opieraj¹c siê na kluczowych postaciach wojskowych. [ICON_BULLET]Wielcy Ludzie Wojskowi pojawiaj¹ siê w tym kraju znacznie szybciej, odk¹d wasz przywódca doszed³ do w³adzy, opieraj¹c siê na kluczowych postaciach wojskowych. TEXT.English: Negative Trait "Let the people of the land rejoice! For I have liberated them from the weak Leaders they relied upon before my arrival. The power of this position is now mine to wield and we have a lot more conquering ahead of us!" This Leader has taken command by force and the people resent him for bypassing due process and disposing of the original leadership. You may be able to enjoy some very strong military benefits, but if you select this trait, do ALL you can to avoid running out of Specialist slots and land to work because citizens will cost you far more than they generate thanks to the will to undermine and rebel that exists among those who don't have much to lose to oppose you. Better to keep your population whipped down to a manageable size, or at least openly angry and Unhappy than pretending to do you any favors. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer a percentage penalty to Gold and Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Citizen Type Specialists cost a Food, Production, and Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Citizen Type Specialists cost a Gold, Research, Culture and Espionage. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are less Happy, resentful of the way your Leader took power. [ICON_BULLET]National Wonders are significantly slower to construct due to a complete lack of national pride. [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolutions option, your cities are less stable and more likely to revolt. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities lose a base Gold and Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Your Capital suffers a percentage penalty to Food, Production and Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Your Capital suffers a percentage penalty to Gold and Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are easier to perform Espionage Missions against since many citizens would help your foes if they feel they can get away with it. [ICON_BULLET]Your units are easier to capture by enemies that defeat them because many such captives feel liberated from military service to your Leader. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer from a bit more Crime since many citizens wish to foment revolt against you. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]General Upkeep is significantly reduced due to the elimination of a lot of government staff. [ICON_BULLET]Great Military People emerge far faster in this nation since your Leader came to power relying on some key military figures. [ICON_BULLET]Civic Anarchy time is greatly reduced since resistance to policy changes is met with the punishment of death.

TEXT.English: Large national instability problems. Less government expenses as bureaucracy has been eliminated so all authority is focused on new Leader. The nation is ashamed of itself (-Culture) and economic uncertainty is high (-Gold).
TEXT.French: Grands problèmes d'instabilité nationale. Moins de dépenses gouvernementales car la bureaucratie a été éliminée, donc toute autorité est concentrée sur le nouveau chef. La nation a honte d'elle-même (-Culture) et l'incertitude économique est élevée (-Or).

TEXT.English: Warmonger CT
TEXT.Polish: Pod¿egacz wojny CT

TEXT.English: Warmonger I
TEXT.Polish: Pod¿egacz wojenny I

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "War is the way of the world. Only by being stronger than all others can we obtain peace." This Leader is intensely focused on the efficient and effective training of the basics of warfare and promotes a martial culture throughout his empire. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Free Military units from a bonus earned by the total amount of your overall population. [ICON_BULLET]Greatly improved speed of training all Military units. [ICON_BULLET]Strong Reduction in the price of upgrading your units. Unique Abilities: [ICON_BULLET]Free Combat I Promotion to all Combatant units. While Combat I is a fairly basic Promotion with a relatively minor +10% combat modifier, it is a major prerequisite for other Promotions and therefore places your units closer to more specialized abilities. [ICON_BULLET]All cities will use Food as production when units are being trained. This reduces the growth rate in those cities significantly, but also increases the speed you produce your units and helps you take advantage of highly Food producing regions for military preparedness. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Increased rate of earning Great Military People. [ICON_BULLET]Reduction in War Weariness you suffer. Your people embrace the idea that war will help them achieve their aims personally. [ICON_BULLET]Small improvement to the maximum number of population you convert to units during a Conscription action in a city. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Increased Upkeep from the costs of providing the programs your nation needs to obtain these benefits. [ICON_BULLET]Moderate Education penalty. The people are more focused on developing personal prowess than on studies. [ICON_BULLET]Minor Health Penalty. The fascination with combat and fighting increases rates of injury and mortality.
TEXT.German: Positive Charaktereigenschaft "Je stärker wir sind, desto unwahrscheinlicher ist der Krieg." - Otto von Bismarck (1815 - 1898) Dieser Anführer ist nur auf den Ausbau und das Training seines Militärs fokussiert. Sein martialischer Führungsstil sorgt dafür, dass in der ganzen Gesellschaft Kampf und Auseinandersetzungen im Vordergrund stehen. Primäre Vorteile: [ICON_BULLET]Erhöhung der freien Militäreinheiten basierend auf der Gesamtbevölkerung [ICON_BULLET]beschleunigte Ausbildung von Militäreinheiten [ICON_BULLET]Preissenkung für die Modernisierung von Einheiten Vorteile für Einheiten: [ICON_BULLET]alle Kämpfer- und Marineeinheiten erhalten automatisch die Beförderung Rang I - Leutnant [ICON_BULLET]alle Städte nutzen [ICON_FOOD] als [ICON_PRODUCTION], wenn Einheiten ausgebildet werden (beschleunigte Einheitenproduktion zum Preis eines stark verlangsamten Stadtwachstums) Weitere Vorteile: [ICON_BULLET]erhöhte Geburtenrate für Große Feldherren [ICON_BULLET]Verminderung der Kriegsmüdigkeit des eigenen Volkes (Die Bevölkerung empfindet den Krieg als beste Variante, um die eigenen Ziele zu erreichen.) [ICON_BULLET]Erhöhung der Anzahl an neuen Militäreinheiten, die über Einberufungsaktionen gewonnen werden können Nachteile: [ICON_BULLET]erhöhte laufende Kosten für die Gesellschaft [ICON_BULLET]verminderter Bildungsstand (Das Volk konzentriert sich mehr auf Körperertüchtigung und Kampf als auf das Lernen und Forschen.) [ICON_BULLET]verminderte Gesundheit (Die Kampfeslust führt zu häufigeren Verletzungen und einer höheren Sterblichkeit.)

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "War is the way of the world. Only by being stronger than all others can we obtain peace." This Leader is intensely focused on the efficient and effective training of the basics of warfare and promotes a martial culture throughout his empire. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Huge Reduction in War Weariness you suffer. Your people embrace the idea that war will help them achieve their aims personally. [ICON_BULLET]Free Military units from a bonus earned by the total amount of your overall population. [ICON_BULLET]Strong improvement to the speed of training all Military units. [ICON_BULLET]Strong Reduction in the price of upgrading your units. Unique Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Free Combat II Promotion to all Combatant units. While Combat II is a fairly basic Promotion with a relatively minor +10% combat modifier, it is a major prerequisite for other Promotions and therefore places your units closer to more specialized abilities. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Increased rate of earning Great Military People. [ICON_BULLET]Moderate improvement to the maximum number of population you convert to units during a Conscription action in a city. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Increased Upkeep from the costs of providing the programs your nation needs to obtain these benefits. [ICON_BULLET]Moderate Education penalty. The people are more focused on developing personal prowess than on studies. [ICON_BULLET]Minor Health Penalty. The fascination with combat and fighting increases rates of injury and mortality. [ICON_BULLET]Minor Happiness Penalty. The competitiveness and high value placed on martial superiority leaves many feeling marginalized and suppressed.

TEXT.English: Warmonger III
TEXT.Polish: Pod¿egacz wojenny III

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "War is the way of the world. Only by being stronger than all others can we obtain peace." This Leader is intensely focused on the efficient and effective training of the basics of warfare and promotes a martial culture throughout his empire. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Huge Reduction in War Weariness you suffer. Your people embrace the idea that war will help them achieve their aims personally. [ICON_BULLET]Free Military units from a bonus earned by the total amount of your overall population. [ICON_BULLET]Strong improvement to the speed of training all Military units. [ICON_BULLET]Strong reduction in the price of upgrading your units. Unique Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Free Combat III Promotion to all Combatant units. While Combat III is a fairly basic Promotion with a relatively minor +10% combat modifier, it is a major prerequisite for other Promotions and therefore places your units closer to more specialized abilities. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Solid increase in the rate of earning Great Military People. [ICON_BULLET]Strong improvement to the maximum number of population you convert to units during a Conscription action in a city. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Increased Upkeep from the costs of providing the programs your nation needs to obtain these benefits. [ICON_BULLET]Strong Education penalty. The people are more focused on developing personal prowess than on studies. [ICON_BULLET]Minor Health Penalty. The fascination with combat and fighting increases rates of injury and mortality. [ICON_BULLET]Minor Happiness Penalty. The competitiveness and high value placed on martial superiority leaves many feeling marginalized and suppressed.
TEXT.German: Positive Charaktereigenschaft "Je stärker wir sind, desto unwahrscheinlicher ist der Krieg." - Otto von Bismarck (1815 - 1898) Dieser Anführer ist nur auf den Ausbau und das Training seines Militärs fokussiert. Sein martialischer Führungsstil sorgt dafür, dass in der ganzen Gesellschaft Kampf und Auseinandersetzungen im Vordergrund stehen. Primäre Vorteile: [ICON_BULLET]Verminderung der Kriegsmüdigkeit des eigenen Volkes (Die Bevölkerung empfindet den Krieg als beste Variante, um die eigenen Ziele zu erreichen.) [ICON_BULLET]Erhöhung der freien Militäreinheiten basierend auf der Gesamtbevölkerung [ICON_BULLET]beschleunigte Ausbildung von Militäreinheiten [ICON_BULLET]Preissenkung für die Modernisierung von Einheiten Vorteile für Einheiten: [ICON_BULLET]alle Kämpfer- und Marineeinheiten erhalten automatisch die Beförderung Rang III - Hauptmann Weitere Vorteile: [ICON_BULLET]erhöhte Geburtenrate für Große Feldherren [ICON_BULLET]Erhöhung der Anzahl an neuen Militäreinheiten, die über Einberufungsaktionen gewonnen werden können Nachteile: [ICON_BULLET]erhöhte laufende Kosten für die Gesellschaft [ICON_BULLET]verminderter Bildungsstand (Das Volk konzentriert sich mehr auf Körperertüchtigung und Kampf als auf das Lernen und Forschen.) [ICON_BULLET]verminderte Gesundheit (Die Kampfeslust führt zu häufigeren Verletzungen und einer höheren Sterblichkeit.) [ICON_BULLET]verminderte Zufriedenheit (Da in der Gesellschaft die körperlich Überlegenen besser angesehen sind und ein starker Wettbewerb herrscht, fühlen sich viele Bürger ausgegrenzt und unterdrückt.)

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "War is the way of the world. Only by being stronger than all others can we obtain peace." This Leader is intensely focused on the efficient and effective training of the basics of warfare and promotes a martial culture throughout his empire. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Large reduction in War Weariness you suffer. Your people embrace the idea that war will help them achieve their aims personally. [ICON_BULLET]Strong amount of Free Military units from a bonus earned by the total amount of your overall population. [ICON_BULLET]Huge improvement to the speed of training all Military units. [ICON_BULLET]Huge reduction in the price to upgrade your units. Unique Abilities: [ICON_BULLET]Free Combat I Promotion to all Combatant units. While Combat I is a fairly basic Promotion with a relatively minor +10% combat modifier, it is a major prerequisite for other Promotions and therefore places your units closer to more specialized abilities. [ICON_BULLET]All cities will use Food as production when units are being trained. This reduces the growth rate in those cities significantly, but also increases the speed you produce your units and helps you take advantage of highly Food producing regions for military preparedness. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Enhanced rate of earning Great Military People. [ICON_BULLET]Moderate improvement to the maximum number of population you convert to units during a Conscription action in a city. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Increased Upkeep from the costs of providing the programs your nation needs to obtain these benefits. [ICON_BULLET]Strong Education penalty. The people are more focused on developing personal prowess than on studies. [ICON_BULLET]Minor Health Penalty. The fascination with combat and fighting increases rates of injury and mortality. [ICON_BULLET]Minor Happiness Penalty. The competitiveness and high value placed on martial superiority leaves many feeling marginalized and suppressed.

TEXT.English: Military concept with a balanced strategy focused on high volume forces with improved training.
TEXT.French: Concept militaire avec une stratégie équilibrée axée sur des forces à fort volume avec un entraînement amélioré.
TEXT.German: Kriegstreiber legen ihr Hauptaugenmerk auf ein starkes, gut ausgebildetes Militär. Jeder Überschuss an Gold wird in die Entwicklung und den Bau neuer Kriegsmaschinen und das Training neuer Einheiten investiert.

TEXT.English: Zealous CT
TEXT.Polish: Gorliwy CT

TEXT.English: Zealous I
TEXT.Polish: Gorliwy I

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "Our gods are the ONLY gods and those who believe otherwise have earned their wrath and deserve to die!" This Leader takes his faith to a dramatically unhealthy level of devotion. He likely suffers from cognitive dissonance as he uses his faith to justify all manner of violence and hatred, even though his faith may at its core promote peace and harmony. His people live in fear that if they are not devout, they will run afoul of harsh laws and penalties. But they live in even greater fear of the extremely demanding role they can fall into as Religious Leaders. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]The Anarchy time to change Religions is twice as long as normal. [ICON_BULLET]For every Non-State Religions in a city, you suffer from an additional unHappiness. [ICON_BULLET]Gain a penalty to diplomacy since other Leaders fear, and find irritating, your desire to force your Religious views on others. [ICON_BULLET]Lose a percentage amount of free Experience on units trained in Holy Cities of Non-State Religions. [ICON_BULLET]When playing with the Religious Disabling option, all Non-State Religions are inactive, and, depending on Civics, if they also bar Non-State Religions, their buildings are destroyed rather than simply disabled. Abilities: [ICON_BULLET]All combat capable units gain the Devotion I Promotion, which gives a strong Religious combat modifier, which is a combat modifier that applies as a benefit to your unit if the opponent unit is not of your Religion, but as a penalty if they are. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolutions Option, cities are less stable with multiple Religions present. [ICON_BULLET]Priest type City Specialists lose one Food yield. [ICON_BULLET]A small overall Gold percent penalty in all cities. Even the government donates a percentage to the Church. [ICON_BULLET]Priest type City Specialists give an additional Gold and Research. [ICON_BULLET]Religious and Spiritual Technologies are discovered slower. The people are terrified of new Religious thought. [ICON_BULLET]Non-State Religions are significantly more difficult to spread. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Great Military People are generated a little faster since those with Great fervor for the Religion are heavily motivated to serve. [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolutions Option, cities are more stable with your Religion. [ICON_BULLET]Wherever you have spread your State Religion, you produce Great People faster. [ICON_BULLET]Allows the nation to produce Inquisitor units once technologically unlocked, that can remove all Religions but the State Religion in a city.

TEXT.English: Zealous II
TEXT.Polish: Gorliwy II

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "Our gods are the ONLY gods and those who believe otherwise have earned their wrath and deserve to die!" This Leader takes his faith to a dramatically unhealthy level of devotion. He likely suffers from cognitive dissonance as he uses his faith to justify all manner of violence and hatred, even though his faith may at its core promote peace and harmony. His people live in fear that if they are not devout, they will run afoul of harsh laws and penalties. But they live in even greater fear of the extremely demanding role they can fall into as Religious Leaders. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]The Anarchy time to change Religions is prohibitive. [ICON_BULLET]For every Non-State Religions in a city, you suffer from an additional Unhappiness. [ICON_BULLET]Gain a penalty to diplomacy since other Leaders fear, and find irritating, your desire to force your Religious views on others. [ICON_BULLET]Lose a significant percentage amount of free Experience on units trained in Holy Cities of Non-State Religions. Abilities: [ICON_BULLET]All combat capable units gain the Devotion II Promotion, which gives a strong Religious combat modifier, which is a combat modifier that applies as a benefit to your unit if the opponent unit is not of your Religion, but as a penalty if they are. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]You earn Great People slower since your people spend much of their lives humbly, and fearfully, devoted to the faith. [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolutions Option, cities are less stable with multiple Religions present. [ICON_BULLET]Priest type City Specialists lose one Commerce yield. [ICON_BULLET]An overall Gold percent penalty in all cities. Even the government donates a percentage to the Church. [ICON_BULLET]Priest type City Specialists give an additional Gold and Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Religious and Spiritual Technologies are discovered slower. The people are terrified of new Religious thought. [ICON_BULLET]Non-State Religions are much more difficult to spread. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Great Military People are generated a little faster since those with Great fervor for the Religion are heavily motivated to serve. [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolutions Option, cities are more stable with your Religion. [ICON_BULLET]Wherever you have spread your State Religion, you produce Great People faster, enough to counter the usual penalty in all cities. [ICON_BULLET]Wherever you have spread your State Religion, your units are trained a little faster. [ICON_BULLET]Wherever you have spread your State Religion, buildings are constructed a bit faster. [ICON_BULLET]Gain a significant Experience point modifier boost in the Holy City of your State Religion. [ICON_BULLET]Your State Religion is easier to spread. [ICON_BULLET]Gain a Happiness wherever you have access to the Incense resource.

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "Our gods are the ONLY gods and those who believe otherwise have earned their wrath and deserve to die!" This Leader takes his faith to a dramatically unhealthy level of devotion. He likely suffers from cognitive dissonance as he uses his faith to justify all manner of violence and hatred, even though his faith may at its core promote peace and harmony. His people live in fear that if they are not devout, they will run afoul of harsh laws and penalties. But they live in even greater fear of the extremely demanding role they can fall into as Religious Leaders. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]The Anarchy time to change Religions is absolutely prohibitive and should only be done once and/or during Golden Ages. [ICON_BULLET]For every Non-State Religions in a city, you suffer from an additional Unhappiness. [ICON_BULLET]Gain a strong penalty to diplomacy since other Leaders greatly fear, and find irritating, your desire to force your Religious views on others. [ICON_BULLET]Lose a significant amount of free Experience on units trained in Holy Cities of Non-State Religions. [ICON_BULLET]When playing with the Religious Disabling option, all Non-State Religions are inactive, and, depending on Civics, if they also bar Non-State Religions, their buildings are destroyed rather than simply disabled. Abilities: [ICON_BULLET]All combat capable units gain the Devotion Promotion, which gives a strong Religious combat modifier, which is a combat modifier that applies as a benefit to your unit if the opponent unit is not of your Religion, but as a penalty if they are. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]You earn Great People slower since your people spend much of their lives humbly, and fearfully, devoted to the faith. [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolutions Option, cities are less stable with multiple Religions present. [ICON_BULLET]Priest type City Specialists lose one Food yield. [ICON_BULLET]A small overall Gold percent penalty in all cities. Even the government donates a percentage to the Church. [ICON_BULLET]Priest type City Specialists give an additional Gold, Research, Espionage AND Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Religious and Spiritual Technologies are discovered slower. The people are terrified of new Religious thought. [ICON_BULLET]Non-State Religions are much more difficult to spread. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Great Military People are generated faster since those with Great fervor for the Religion are heavily motivated to serve. [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolutions Option, cities are more stable with your Religion. [ICON_BULLET]Wherever you have spread your State Religion, you produce Great People faster, enough to counter the penalty. [ICON_BULLET]Wherever you have spread your State Religion, your units are trained a little faster. [ICON_BULLET]Wherever you have spread your State Religion, buildings are constructed a bit faster. [ICON_BULLET]Gain a significant Experience point modifier boost in the Holy City of your State Religion. [ICON_BULLET]Your State Religion is easier to spread. [ICON_BULLET]Allows the nation to produce Inquisitor units once technologically unlocked, that can remove all Religions but the State Religion in a city. [ICON_BULLET]Gain a Happiness wherever you have access to the Incense resource.

TEXT.English: Gains some benefits for the State Religion but severe penalties for Non-State Religions.
TEXT.French: Bénéficie de certains avantages pour la Religion d'État mais de lourdes sanctions pour les Religions non étatiques.
